-Y3v-m5jt5GDjubKZDrNLg.text: Really great service. Came at lunch and she had us in and out quickly ! The food was Hott and fresh. She was attentive and kept our drinks filled.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BLT AND CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP  LOVE !

sKEXVpshfdU1--u9_-XRFA.text: My friends and I needed a little spot to grab a bite to eat and a drink. This hit the mark. Great drinks and awesome food.  And the server was a pro at the menu and helping us figure out what we'd like to eat.  she nailed it!! Like the terminator said "I'll be back!"

RAyNozNk5lzMpObHAeRDcg.text: I've been here a couple of times now. Very classy looking and pleasing to be in. Great service and excellent food. I'm not normally a big salad fan, but theirs are really good, especially with the salmon added on top. There's shared parking at the back and you can walk in from there.

EKjOBB6BGGFsoKOmuhWo4Q.text: The Dump Truck (chicken sandwich) is amazing. Should be featured on one of these food channel shows. Every time I eat here I wonder why I don't stop here more often. All was excellent !

S1auBaB2FcnFLlNW7PoW3A.text: I had a wonderful salad today, switch house salad with mixed greens and romaine, and had Champagne Chipotle dressing with Perfectly grilled salmon. Yum so good. I had the half salad that came with a smaller portion of fish, perfect size for lunch. We had a large party with reservations about 13 people and all the food arrived about the same time, that was amazing. We had a special and memorable lunch, thank you Switch staff! Can't wait till next time.

rNN-jWUiEYZanhDBnaSxcQ.text: Our friends invited us for brunch and we have become instant fans. Fabulous menu with lots of choices. We started with the $6 carafe of Bloody Mary's. I ordered the green chili Benedict and my husband ordered the breakfast burger.  The staff was amazingly helpful.   The food was delicious!  And we definitely want to come back to try more items.   Insider tip: we met chef Jason and a new menu will be introduced shortly. Good southern inspired and hip yumminess!   The ambience is great. Cool patio and nice interior. We will be back!

W5Kma5FPbu97thhY7UXfKQ.text: It has changed owners since I was here a few years ago. It is better than ever. Weekly specials and a standard menu that literally everything on it just kills. The chef knows his stuff and the staff is friendly and efficient. Go!

ZElqxJ4JjonvqPbQRGoxTg.text: Overall it was ok, not bad not super great either. Sunday afternoon, little patrons...low energy vibe. Perhaps due to the overall paint color and decor which is a little drab even for Phoenix standards.   Server was super nice and very attentive, manager even came by to say hi. Menu choices were just ok, standard faire I guess. Brunch menu looked better than actual lunch menu which is why I leaned towards brunch.   Sadly the menu item I desperately wanted was out. Apparently one must stop in before 12:30 to get the dish. Hmmm...if it's that popular, why are there not more of it made?   As a runner up dish I had the Huevos Rancheros and I was pleasantly surprised! I'd have to say it may have been the best HR I've ever had - seriously! Very fresh ingredients and seasoned to perfection, the amount of heat was spot on! I'm particular about my tortillas and it was also a winner! Mind you it was a single tortilla.   My friend seemed to enjoy his BLT, his macaroni n cheese was pretty good. It wasn't an included side dish but the server had no issue with "upselling" it along with avocado for his sandwich. She made the attempt with me but I caught on real quick. He also had a "Lemonade" but it was no more than a crystal light in a glass - False advertising! :(  We went in for a light lunch and walked out wallet poor. The lunch bill came to $40 NOT including tip! 2 lunches 2 non-alcoholic drinks and $40...in the end it really must have been the upselling that gouged the pocketbook.   The likelihood of returning is pretty much not in the cards.  Considering the amount of restaurants in the valley, skies the limit so why return to something that was almost overall underwhelming.

n9mBv9jgYJS_rtgrQKsQFA.text: Great experience overall !  deana took good care of us ! We Loooved the shrimp and grits hands down best ever .. i even asked to meet the  chef .. and he came out and i got to shake his hand!! and then .. the chef told us about the bread pudding to try.. and OMG it was to die for .. such good flavor .. me and my girlfriends CRUSHED it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best Shrimp and Grits experience EVER!! After I tried Aprils lol ... got to meet the chef !! #shrimpandgrits #switch #girlsnightout

MGTfWeiyGOR3FfGzR4egDg.text: I enjoyed the Buttermilk Chicken with Smashed Potatoes. The Cookie and Ice Cream is a great desert for two.  My wife, TheScottsdaleRealEstateAgent had the Shrimp and Grits. She loved it!!

tssYKwrfGRFuUbBKyXpV7w.text: We went on a Saturday night as a very large group. Drinks arrived quickly and were delicious. Everyone had their meals delivered at the same time and all were amazing! All 16 of us had nothing but positive feedback for our experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum!

wcJzNx9pmg06B1omfI4YnQ.text: Switch is a welcome restaurant in the neighborhood.  Food is alway fresh, original, served with thoughtfulness and has a slice of personality and imagination I expect from a quality food service establishment.  Service has been routinely efficient.  I like to get take out on occasion as my work hours are varied and often end up having late dinners.  They are packed with care, don't forget items and consider not mixing protein with salads until I can get home (Separate containers).  This is great as it keeps the greens fresh and allows you to reheat protein if needed before adding to the salad.  Well done!  Keep it up.

IidKHhqTOBSIYcX9p-5m_A.text: Ooops!  Sorry Switch!  I probably should have updated this review about... 2 years ago?  :(  I went back to Switch at the INSISTENCE of a GF for brunch.  Oh  Emm  Geee  We have eaten here on the patio no less than 20 times since the last time I reviewed this place.  The carafes on weekends are chock full of booze and reasonably priced.  The salad is AMAZING and whatever my ex-DH ordered he loved too.  They have an amazing waitress that we got EVERY time afterward and she is a doll.  Oh, I'm sorry Switch.  If it helps any... I was sitting next to a couple on an airplane and they said, "Have you ever tried Switch?  It's amazing!"  Even 30,000 feet above ground people are talking about you.  For the record, I agreed - your food, your booze, and your waitress are amazing.

F0s3McOogO3kVW0J__Qy6Q.text: This place is my go-to whenever I'm downtown. The service and food are always excellent AND they take reservations. Weekend brunch is a MUST-mimosa carafe anyone? The diversity of the menu is impressive and the price is very good  considering the quality of the food and portion size. LOVE that many of their appetizers are available in a smaller portion!

dWYZqIOho93rH2DqsXbW7A.text: Tried this place for lunch based off a recommendation since it's close to my office. It's a cute little restaurant that I was happy to walk into, but I came in right around noon and we didn't get out of there for a solid hour and a half  even though we ordered right away. The food took FOREVER and the waiter although very nice and so good with the drink refills, hardly came by after our food was delivered so took an extra 20 minutes longer to get our check than it should have. I think for lunch places, especially downtown where people are clearly working and just on a break, should be more mindful of people's time.  I had the switch house salad which was decent but wouldn't order again. The switch house burgers were a popular item for tables around us and looked really good so will probably try that if I go again. My friend ordered the Fish and Chips which I think was the special of the day. The fries/potatoes were really good. I tried a fish stick and it seemed like good fresh fish, just way too fried and greasy for me but I guess people expect so she seemed to be happy with it. Oh, and at the risk of sounding super cheap - I got charged an extra amount for the extra side of dressing which I always find irritating especially when they don't tell you. I wouldn't have ordered it had I known and it was a waste because by the time I got it I didn't use any of it.

52RdfwPcDt0SlPgOj2wa8Q.text: Came here as a travel weary businessman on the road and was craving something healthy in the form of some greens & protein. It was a bit hard to find off Central and had to do a few u-turns before finding the place. There's some parking in the back of the restaurant.  There's a nice little outdoor patio area where I would have sat down, if it wasn't super hot that night. The waiters & hostesses were quick to sit me down and take my order and overall was a pleasant experience. The summer salad that I had was pretty amazing too. Added some chicken to that and *boom* a great salad.   The only thing that was odd was the ambiance of the restaurant. The walls are painted black and they tried to go for a "loungy" look even though it's not *really* a lounge. I kinda wish it was more bright in the seating area...

g-S7SUOKr9Sn3fdqT3XSCQ.text: Their lobster & crab mac n cheese is a dish I like to categorize in my prestigous "jizzing in thy pants worthy"   Nomnomlicious as it is though,  as a college student with an empty/dusty wallet that is always there to remind me that I, 99% of the time, am not allowed to indulge and happily jizz my pants, I cannot get what jesus christ probably ate at his Last Dinner.   Fear not though, that's where their daily specials save the day and for roughly less than 10 bucks, I can satisfy myself with their filling and hearty bruschetta while my boyfriend makes love to his beloved drunk italian sodas in a way I've never been treated to before.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. bruschetta and a tejano burger. our usual :]

CpkRhwzFDKwWMLPlhFgSbA.text: Solid 4 stars - great food, huge value, good service.

LB-Rh1R0S23Hho3DPhthCg.text: I went to Switch for my first time with a few friends after work. The atmosphere was really chill and the service was friendly! The food overall was very good, however I felt the prices were a little high for what you got. The cost to add a black bean patty to a grilled cheese was literally $7, which would mean that a black bean burger with just cheese would be almost $20, since the grilled cheese is $10.00 (again cost is a little off for what you get). Overall I was satisfied with my experience and would maybe go again.

i1Ub5Jf51_Tyftm5B-3jJQ.text: We are big fans of Switch for lunch!  It's a sit down restaurant and so you'll pay more than a fast food place, but having said all that the VALUE is incredible. Al the beef is angus. It is cooked perfectly. The chicken is tender, cooked well, without being rubbery or flavorless. The salads are wonderful. The starters are wonderful. And the iced tea doesn't taste like dishwater, which, in Phoenix, is always a great big plus!!  I can't say enough about the food because, well...it tastes like the owner truly cares about quality ingredients, decent size portions, keeping the cost to the customers low considering what you get, and well...just making everything taste truly special.  Inside it is busy for lunch and you might wait 5-10 minutes. It is nice inside, with leather couches to sit in while you wait. It is LGBT friendly, and has a sophisticated vibe. Restaurant and bathrooms are spotlessly clean.

xZXCemi9KF68YVVfDtY9sQ.text: I'm violating my "don't review after just one visit" rule. It was THAT amazing. The five stars is flat out for the food. Although the service was excellent as well. We sat on the patio and it was a casual dining experience.   There were six of us. We shared entrees and had two appetizers. We ordered lamb lettuce wraps, lobster puffs, pork verde, Amsterdam pasta, mac n cheese with lobster, and a special seafood bake. Every single thing was perfection. Melt in your mouth perfection.   The table was a bevvy of ooohs and awwws and "I'm so glad Durant's was closed" (which is where we'd planned on going originally).   I read all the food blogs and "best of..." restaurants and hadn't heard about Switch. Which kind of pisses me off. It's A.M.A.Z.I.N.G

I508iPwd3xQdDFp-2uNv4g.text: Switch was recommended to me, so we went there for dinner on a very slow weekday night when there were no more than three other tables.   Two of our party received their food in relatively short order. My plate didn't show up until over 30 minutes later, at which point the rest of the table was finished eating and needed to leave. That situation wouldn't have happened if our waiter had been checking on us periodically, or even been visible so I could have stopped him to have him check. (Having had to leave the table prior to ordering just to locate him and put in our order should have been my clue that this was off to a bad start.)  I am very accommodating and understand when a restaurant is busy that this can happen, but I felt there was no excuse for the delay.   I was very disappointed and have better places to spend my money and time. I'd recommend looking elsewhere.

CRiup4V9TsgzL6FMeDb98g.text: Great restaurant the staff is extremely friendly the food was really good, the price is reasonable, i very much enjoyed their mimosas for breakfast and  you can get a craft at a reasonable price the outdoor patio is very nice lots of seating. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bwstHYOLYsLYCYzcUoL0FA.text: What happened, Switch? You were awesome. You're still good, but I feel like some things have slipped.  1. Quality of food doesn't seem as good. Last few times, the sandwich bread was hard and stale. Some of the appetizers were overpriced and seemed small for size and/or not so great in quality. 2. Service has gotten a bit slow. I realize that new servers have to learn the system, but the learning curve is only so long. 3. Food and drink specials have changed. Some stuff isn't as good a deal as it used to be.  That being said, I still have a good time when I go. It's just not my go to restaurant in Phoenix anymore.

Zr2P4Z60T_HivZSqjLONNg.text: Went here for brunch today, and was thoroughly unimpressed with the food.  I ordered chilaquiles, my husband ordered the green chile benedict.  Both were bland and uninspiring.  The chilaquiles in particular used the blandest red chile sauce that tasted like it came from a can at the local supermarket.  Especially considering the price, these dishes earn a big thumbs down from me.  Also, the brunch options skew heavily towards meat and potatoes and carbs, if you are dining with vegetarians/ vegans or even simply the health conscious they will have very limited options.  It's $5 for a side of fruit.  My chilaquiles had tiny pieces of chicken mixed in with few limp peppers and onions and tons of tortilla strips that reminded me of soggy Fritos, all coated in a miserably bland red chile sauce with no discernible heat at all, with poaches eggs, crema, and a little feta on top.  I ate the eggs and picked out the chicken, but I hated the sauce so much that I couldn't eat the chips.  I should have known better than to order Mexican food from this place.  I won't return.  If you're going to put Mexican food on your menu in the Southwest, do it right.

XRMQWaZzCKDCljycpfBTTA.text: Lamb Lettuce wrap 'small plate' was big enough as a meal for me! and it was delicious! Our waiter forgot our appetizer and brought our food first. We said it was unnecessary to bring it at that point, and he brought it anyway but comped us. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. nice atmosphere

wijltYS7hszsM1JzjhAFAw.text: I used to come here often, but then started trying some of the other places around the area.  I have not been here for probably a year or more and came in for lunch and was a little disappointed.  The food was not bad, but not anything exceptional and the dessert was served a little cold.  Overall, not a horrible meal.......but kind of pricey for what I received.  The service was very good, but I don't think I'll be heading back anytime soon.

DzGHBhACpiny073tskglJg.text: A great neighborhood spot. Sat on the patio with my dog.  The waiter,  Zim, brought water for my dog.  I was last here a month ago and Zim remembered me and my drink!  Had the delicious french dip.  The au jus was great.  Friendly service.  Good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

y65ZgrycDO73T_sMTnWWoQ.text: No longer a fan.  Service is still prompt and friendly.   But there has been a change in the menu that has made me greatly disappointed.    I recently stopped in for lunch, after a 6-month hiatus, to find that two of my favorite sandwiches have changed.  Both the BBQ Apricot Chicken Feta Sandwich and the Spartan Pita both use to be served with shaved Chicken Breast.   Now they are served as a whole chicken fillet.  Couple of things about this new presentation.  First, it's very difficult to eat a pita with chicken that isn't chopped or sliced.   Second, the chicken looked slimmy - like it had been reheated.   When I asked the waiter why the switch (ha ha) from shaved chicken breast to a whole chicken breast, he said the chef said that the meat was now a higher quality and can't be shaved.  Weird answer on many fronts. I mean, really, why would you even admit you weren't always serving quality food?    All I can say is that the chicken looked like it was frozen, spiced, and heated in the microwave.  This coupled with the fact that a pita is very difficult to eat when the chicken is served a la "Burger King" patty versus shaved (or at least chopped).  I use to love Switch for its unique combo of flavors - but in particular for these two sandwich standouts.   Now, I can't bare to ever go back.

clFFJA-AK758fscp6j5YKw.text: Not so much.    My salad had 14 1/4 inch pieces of tomatoes and 5 pieces of radishes. I was very disappointed in the poblano salad. A salad that you would buy at the airport would have been a lot better.   We live in the area and love walking to the restaurant, but the quality has gone downhill.   Hopefully, they will turn this place around. The prices and food quality are not what it used to be.   One final thing.....we used to love this place. We are not sure what happened.

yvzfgyA1_97rcqaDyB6tqg.text: My husband has been  here several times for lunch over the past year or so. He was finally able to take me there today. And it did not disappoint! The caprese sandwich I had was fabulous and I added chicken to it. The portions were huge and the twisted fries were delicious . The service was great. If I had to give one little drawback it would've been that the prices are very high for a lunch. But we will most certainly be back! And hopefully next time  have one of their wonderful looking desserts.

8ZoEX2UuZG99rNo11nvrYA.text: Not even joking with you but this place has the best chicken sandwich I've ever had in my whole life. If you try this restaurant please do me a solid and get the Dump Truck 2.0. You won't be disappointed. Also the staff is very friendly and the place itself has a really cool vibe. Switch has gained another new fan.

lSvl57S0j-l8mhOXinSO4Q.text: My husband and I have been going to Switch for Sunday Brunch for about a year and we enjoy every visit. The food is consistently good and the service from Gabriela is stellar. She brings iced tea and a carafe when she comes over to greet us at the table (we're THAT predictable). The sandwiches are great (Very Berry Turkey is a favorite), as are the burgers. The brunch pancakes are a wonderful sweet treat. The monthly special is always good.  The atmosphere in the restaurant is relaxed and comfortable on Sundays and we have brought friends and relatives on numerous occasions.

Dv1dNSbHRvTDmVpqrt5RUA.text: Love everything about this place. Cocktails, atmospere, food, decore are all well above standard. Awsome breakfast too.

CyDYE7c5lQKVt5eKB5pbvQ.text: Probably the worst, most over priced food I have ever had!!!!!!! Their Salad was straight out of a bag, the fries were cold and rubbery, the cowboy burger was over cooked, and the bacon was undercooked. How can this place even be in business?? I could have made a better meal with my arms cut off and my eyes gouged out. Save your money and go next door to Durant's.

gDUfpHBaA7E2PU_oU-Uuzg.text: You just can't go wrong - close your eyes, point anywhere on the menu, and you will be pleased.  Also, be sure to try the soup, no matter what it is.

vQ-4dx8YfvIzkVOCVloz6Q.text: We've been to Switch 3 times now and the only fault I can find is with my own decision to have the pork tenderloin medium-well done. Crepes great, sandwiches great, pasta great, meats well chosen and prepared, atmosphere great.

yzh8aWqxNrEGGZ-PlIB-Fw.text: Another good lunch spot. Cute, trendy, good music, good lunch food. My sandwich COULD have been a tad better (the Caprese... it could have used a little kick somewhere) but my other choices have been good. I really like the Spartan Pita, my side salads and fruit have always been fresh. Perhaps I will try a salad from the menu next time. The service has always been good. I rather enjoy this spot for a quick lunch date with friends.

nqY7rx3j7X0MpOsvSGCJ5Q.text: I must say that I am very impressed by the ownership.  Within 12hrs I received a response to my review from Tom.  This tells me that the owners are serious about getting things right and genuinely interested in their customer's feedback.

qn6MIkYvMdLAPw8U3tpuTQ.text: I like this place very much.  I've been three times now, and keep ordering the meatloaf (its really tasty!), though the last time we went with a large party and others mixed it up by trying many things off their expansive menu, and everyone enjoyed the food VERY much.  The atmosphere is casual, mellow, lounge-ish.  The service staff is friendly and casual, like the place.  I definitely plan on going back!

jdMDhMja0qzI9F771zzGIA.text: I admit, I didn't intend to go to Switch.  I was rolling up on Durant's for a bite of Saturday lunch when I remembered that Durant's doesn't *have* Saturday lunch.  Very sad.  But Switch was right there and oh so conveniently open.  I was pleasantly surprised.  It wasn't what I expected at all.  The drink I had was delicious, the food tasty and filling, the portions were large without being grotesque and the atmosphere was really warm and welcoming for having a modern look.  Best of all, I could actually sit across from my partner and have a conversation without having to shout over the low roar of the patrons.  I've gone back many times since and have not been disappointed.

JriZusQW61Yldp6exgDK0w.text: I went here a year ago for lunch with a new friend. The service and food quality was decent enough to justify the prices...otherwise nothing exceptional.  I may or may not go back.

vsfPTfNV_K_s02tH6ZCHxA.text: This restaurant has a hip and modern vibe, reminds me of the W hotel or aLoft hotel. I like how there are sofas that invite you to sit and chat, and how they transformed the space between Switch and Schlotzsky's into a little outdoor area.  Why you should eat at Switch: -Unique options (everything on the menu looks good - there are so many different kinds of sandwiches!) -Great flavor. I got the Dragon Pita and it was really delicious. On the downside, I had to eat it with a fork and a knife because the sauce was dripping all over the place and they didn't give us any paper napkins. -Freshness. Although $10 seems a bit much for a sandwich or burger, it was justified when our food came. All the ingredients are fresh and high quality, and the portions are appropriate. Even the water tasted really good!  Why I don't give Switch 5 stars: -Slow service. We were sitting for about 8 minutes before the server came to ask what we wanted to drink. The wait for our food seemed like forever (c'mon, how long does it take to make a sandwich?). Or maybe I'm just used to Subway. Strangely though, our server was amazingly quick to take away our plates and bring the bill. hmm. -The lighting. It was way too dark, it was actually darker inside than outside. This may be personal preference, and of course it is a bar, but next time I'm going here during the daytime for lunch, and not dinner. -Consistency. Whereas the Dragon Pita was delicious, the Lobster Roll was pretty ordinary. If you don't know what will turn out good, I'd advise choosing something with a variety of eclectic ingredients.  Finally, this restaurant seems to be targeted more towards the 20-35 year old age group. I wouldn't advise coming here with children or your parents... unless you order take-out.

N6hvwCaODEqY3k0H6jQVag.text: I love this restaurant. The menu is very broad -- loads of selections. Great munchies for happy hour (the hummus is amazing). Love the Blue Sky salad. The buffalo burger is also really yummy. They are always willing to change things for you with no problems -- which is big for me because I never order things the way they are! I love this place for lunch, happy hour and dinner. Also, very consistent.

I_koELK2S0gHbtQnshQR8g.text: Good food and vibes are good....interior is posh and comfortable.  Nice trendy resturant like FEZ.  I think they are the same owners.  My only request is that wine selection could use little work....all the dishes we ordered were fantastic.  Lamb, chicken and fruit plate were excellent...:) Price is resaonable and it stay open late.  I will definately go back to this place again....

2eH9ZRbYPzuDBEqUX31GNQ.text: Just want to add that I've gone there for breakfast the past two weekends and everything has been excellent.  The pecan pancakes are the perfect size and are wicked tasty as is the breakfast sandwich.  The service is 1000% better in the morning than the evening and there isn't really a wait which is nice compared to Matts, Ihop, Over Easy, etc...

1mujPB_pJQYHbOdVy_fDqw.text: Great Food, Excellent drinks.  Everything is fresh and delicious. The location is fantastic on Central Avenue right near the light rail stops.

oC1efp4Dsk_MoZChLFurHQ.text: Love the venue and the service, but food was not spectacular.  Sat and had a couple beverages in the side-by-side leather seats. Very cool and intimate, nice vibe here. Wife LOVED her red sangria, and they had some really good craft brews that kept me happy. Server was friendly and attentive. My burger was prepared just as I ordered, and was solid.  Wife's pasta with salmon was just o.k. - nothin' special. Fun place to hang.

2gwS36Cj6gVePY-FXxwnuA.text: All I can say is "Ditch the sandwich and head out to Switch"!  I visited Switch for the first time on 08/23/2008. I am very pleased to see this type of establishment be part of the growing downtown/revitalization trend that is underway in Phoenix, Arizona.   When I got there they had just opened their doors for that days business  so I cannot say that getting a parking place was difficult. I could see it being difficult  during peak hours though because they do share parking lots with another popular Phoenix restauraunt .  In fact, within the first 30 minutes of our being seated the place started getting a good crowd for brunch. We were greeted, seated and waited on by the same person. (which I  prefer) There is nothing more distracting than having a greeter, a seater, a waiter a water boy and server just to serve you simple fare.   Our server, Jen, is an absolute gem! From start to finish she was attentive, friendly extremely personable and has one of those million dollar smiles to go with it all. If you can get one of her tables, by all means do! Jen is also employed by Switch's sister restaurant Ticoz.  Another review for another time.   My friend and I shared an appetizer of hummus that was garnished with roasted red peppers and sliced artichoke heart. It was excellent. In fact, if you are not one to have ever had hummus, I suggest you try theirs. You will be a hummus eater from there on out. We each ordered sandwiches that were served with a delicious side Ceasar salad sans croutons and with a very rich, creamy garlicky Ceasar dressing. Yum! The sandwich I had was the Jalisco Chipotle Chicken sandwich and my friend had the Big BLT. That sandwich is appropriately named. It has 10 slices of bacon on it! Both sandwiches were delicious and through the whole meal I kept wondering why I never made it out to this place. Originally I saw some not so nice comments regarding the ambience and the food as well as some of the drink prices. However, I've come to the conclusion that some of the previous negatives from other reviewers are just from "uppity uptight no good bogus old queens" who have nothing better to do than gripe. This place is excellent, as is the food. Prices are reasonable and I would gladly pay the same price for half the food.  The ambiance is trendy but not pretentious or overdone. It would fit well into the likes of many of the east coast places I've been to. So if you are in a rut as to what to try for your next meal out I would definitely make the "Switch" and come here.

8f-zNmZFftpwQ_qcFmordw.text: I really like this place.  The staff is very friendly and it's a nice place to have a bite and a glass of wine.  I prefer it to Fez or Ticoz.

ITYugyxXti3pAlC0mFl1Tw.text: this place is all right. I've been here only once -- I had the veggie farmhouse whatever sandwich & a caipirinha. the caipirinhas are 2 for 1 on mondays, which is awesome but they don't make them as good as Carly's. the sandwich was delicious, but it's rather expensive for what you get. the interior is pretty. the service was lame. the music playing was lame. I probably wouldn't go back unless I knew someone else was paying.

L0duB9kMpa7af1VkAYAO8A.text: I started to write a review for Switch a while back. I loved it at first. I literally thought there could be nothing better. However, I have been back a several times since then and the food has never been the same. I have ordered several different items off the menu and they change each time I go back. I throughly suggest NOT ordering the hamburger simply because it they cannot cook it to order and it tastes like freezer burn. The buffalo sandwich continues to be a staple. It is the one thing that is always the same when I order it there. It's good if you are in the neighborhood, but there are much better sandwich shops around.

pKzzDaNfXSRkvdaKNP-wzQ.text: It's hard to beat $1 mimosas and screwdrivers on a Saturday or Sunday morning. That being said, Switch is one of my good friends. It's really airy and open, and just like Fez, the house music is blasting at 10 a.m. Their food is decent (I prefer Fez), but this is a nice spot to relive last night in the last fleeting moments of the weekend. If I went out with you last night, you can pretty much count on meeting up with me for more drinks at Switch.

9kbfesKRg_gJiJ4ERuPvxw.text: Awesome happy hour in terms of prices for their signature drinks. However, I give it a 5 b/c of the appetizers. They are fresh and yummy and the portion sizes are generous (especially the cheese and fruit plate and the hummus plate).

1dcwRPUGZH9eBAy4aDiVxw.text: What a nice surprise.  Good food. Eclectic mix with unique twist.  Tasty and reasonably priced for lunch.  We need more Switch Bakery's in Phoenix.

BLsyciNMIn1NcWqqMCHWWw.text: In town on business and a friend recommended this place. I must say the food & service was outstanding! Had the Thai tacos for an app and the Cowboy burger as my entree. I'm from TX and have eaten a lot of beef in my time and their burger was damn good! Has my seal of approval.

McGtVT-orZlesIIxmbyHxQ.text: After reading the latest Phoenix Magazine article about the Valley's 21 best sandwiches, myself and two friends tried Switch this past Sunday, 1/10.  While this place came hihgly recommend by friends and the magazine, I thought it was average at best.  Tried the sandwich in the article, the Murano.  Tasty but nothing extraordinary.  Certainly not  on of the 21 best in the Valley.  The side of mac-n-cheese was also average.  Friends had the turkey galette and the lobster mac.  Both enjoyed them; maybe more than I enjoyed mine.  You need to be comfortable eating with strangers at this place as the tables are way too close to one another.  For those who like Swicth, if you look up their web site on your mobile device, there is a coupon for free hummus.  Won't go back and suggest to Phoenix Magazine readers to replace the Murano with the Frency at the Vig and 40th and Camelback - a MUCH better sandwich.

aAfHKCIdaHHo1Bm38A2n-Q.text: Love Switch!  Great food and really great staff (except Amy, but just avoid her).  Favorite food:  Caesar, mac and cheese, chicken pops (amazing appetizer), divine fries and onion rings, and killer burgers.  And the brunch - heaven!  The Switch french toast with fig and blueberry syrup is epic.

mtZzNufi2X1e7X8WeP9YbQ.text: We happened upon this great place while in town. Unfortunately, we were in Phoenix due to family illness and it's proximity to St. Joseph's Hospital. There isn't much in the area to choose from but that's not why it got high marks. The staff was perfect, kind and accommodating. Service was A+. The food was really outstanding. We ate there three days in a row. Yep. Every dish was a winner. Put it on your list, they got it going on!

rsnEJAbwKQQZQ9DFIr1XoA.text: eat the pasta. drink the wine.  i wish david still worked there.  hahahahahahahhahaha.  robert rules.

CO4TTq-xWyoJROKsNkzt9Q.text: Switch is one of my favorite places to go for dinner on  a night before going clubbing.  Aaron Lee is our favorite waiter, he knows how to take care of his customers and treat them  very kindly.  He is always there if you need him. He is the reason we choose Switch when we go out.  John Griffey  aka  Stacha

q7RCzWR2q2G_gY5mFK0HwA.text: I'm new to the Phoenix area and have been to several restaurants  here searching for standouts.  Switch stands out, but not for the best reasons.  I had the Ibiza Sangria Chicken Sandwich.  As soon as it arrived I knew I was in for a let down.  The menu states "roasted chicken".  What I got was clumps of soggy compressed deli chicken.  The bread was described as a "large rustic artisan roll".  It was not large...nor was it fresh.  Artisan to me does not mean stale and tough.  But the biggest issue was with what is described on the menu as a "Caesar salad".  There are variations on this dish available for the chef to draw from, however chopped iceberg lettuce with a few bits of romaine thrown in changes the dish into a mixed green salad, not a Caesar.  Also there was no cheese, no croutons, no hint of anchovy, just the mixed lettuces with a Caesar-style dressing glopped on top.  Sloppy, tasteless presentation of the food along with confused descriptions on the menu makes me not want to go back.  Save some money, you can get something similar at Arby's for half the price.

Au2rRA6zq7ctQHjrbETMUw.text: Got very, very, sick off the french dip.  Service was without a smile. Long wait.  Would not recommend.

woICAwNQD-_ZSXx2E2wjqQ.text: What an amazing place to dine and drink!  It is soon becoming our regular brunch hangout, and we certainly through in a dinner or two every so often.  The food is moderately priced, tastes amazing, and large enough portions to split if you're not too hungry. We've never had anything we don't like, and are very partial to the French Dip, Cheese Plate, and the BBQ Apricot Chicken Sandwich! Oh, and of course the Recession Special never lets you down.   We have always had attentive service, and if you're lucky enough to get Gabriela as your server, you're in good hands.  She's been known to handle a group of 20 of us by herself with extreme attentiveness and ease!  She's amazing!  The atmosphere is casual but classy, food is yummy, price is right, and service is great -- you can't go wrong.  Enjoy!!!

80rGfbKdn_AscfsakBjW_g.text: Wow... and I mean wow in a bad way. Stopped in this week and I must say I don't think I would even think of coming back. I really don't want to spend too much time reviewing food that's better executed at Jack in the Box so let me just tell you it was pretty bad. Some hot dishes came out cold and cold dishes came out luke warm WTF. The drinks were over priced and the place was cheaply put together and I mean in a failed attempt to lure people in with a $100 design budget, Target furniture and terrible design taste kind of way. I love to eat and I wouldn't have minded if my server/manager wasn't so rude and arrogant or the food was way better. It's probably a former deli turned restaurant that someone thought "Hey let's put blue light bulbs in, play techno, serve martini's and all the gay men in town will love it.(insulting)"???? My brother (which is gay) was with me that day he lives part time in San Fran and that was his feed back on this, which my girlfriend shared the same opinion on this since we have many friends in the gay community. I think I have said enough or maybe to much but I know that I don't want to say any more...

7TtxbMivEYu0GD7PM1aBrg.text: This is an excellent restaurant for a wide variety of situations: whether its having night out with the spouse or dining with friends for a weekend brunch, Switch makes the grade. The drinks are strong, the food is inventive and delectable, and the waitstaff, especially Gabriela, take exceptional care of you.

snHnHnXFuP7aHueD06Ij0g.text: My wife and I ate at Switch today for the first time. The food was very good with an excellent fresh taste of fresh grown vegetables and other ingredients. Our waiter, Aaron provided excellent, very responsive service. We would recommend the restaurant highly for Sunday brunch.

CodO4_tDW-Og9Kz2wpj3yA.text: I was a little nervous to try this place as I've hear it was a super hip place to dine down town-I enjoy more casual places that aren't about see and be seen. Switch turned out to be excellent. It is comfortable, chic, and the people that work there are so nice. I was expecting a snooty atmosphere, but not at all what I got. I asked for tequila straight in a glass with nothing else, and the waiter brought me a full to the rim rocks glass of tequila. You can't beat that! The food was great too. I had the Amsterdam chicken pasta. Wow, yummy. I am definitely going to be a repeat customer. They had some great sandwiches on the menu that I can't wait to try. I live about 30 minutes away, and I will do the drive to eat there again.

KZAudcs1h6nXHtW-jtkliQ.text: I still love Switch!! I dine here more or less weekly!  It is a great spot to hang out with friends and have a couple glasses of wine at night, or to meet up on the weekend for brunch.  Gabriela is my favorite server there!  She is always very nice, and always on top of things! I always request her when I dine here.

dTeIFa3jjklJMPNRhalBeQ.text: Went to breakfast here recently with friends and the service was basically incompetent. You have this poor servers you don't seem to give a hoot about proper service and it shows. My server could not even get a basic order right, and there was hair in my food of which the server asked if I would place it on the plate maybe he wanted to analyze it in the kitchen. When my food was brought back a second time it was still not what I requested by now my party was done with there food and I have not yet eaten. The server never apologized a manager came over and with a smile said that he would comp everything ( thanks but I have not yet eaten!!!!) comping the meal was the least you could have done to fix the situation. We will never go back they just seem like they don't give a crap like it's all a joke. Not a customer centric restaurant. They think they are hip and cool here and they look like a bunch of Dutch boys with the caps that they wear. Guys lose the caps your selling newspapers. I went straight to McDonald's placed in order they got it right delivered it hair free and then I paid them. It should always be that easy.....in any case I will take inspiration from their name and "switch" to another place to eat. Do yourself a favor pass on this place and go somewhere else your friends and family will thank you for it. This place should switch from customer no service to customer service if they want to be around in six months. People vote with your feet and when you see this place keep walking.

eEv_aLb8XgLbdQ5U6BaOKw.text: I have been waiting patiently for the meatloaf to hit the menu after getting to taste it a couple of weeks ago (they were still tweaking the recipe)....finally it made it's debut on Monday and thanks to a text from our boy Matt we wasted no time in getting there....Yes...the meatloaf rocks and is good comfort food at its best. Two thick slabs on top of cheesy creamy potatoes and seasonal baby carrots and asparagus. I think I am in love with the meatloaf (and Matt B.) Nathan you nailed it with this one. By the way... there are other new items on the menu as well but I will probably never make it past the meatloaf.

DdS2bhF9rQ6NEoQ8y9WaVQ.text: The salads and sandwiches at this establishment are very tasty, I have no complaints!  The sangrias here are great, and I can't wait to try more items off the menu!

naKg9-RABb9N15Uy_NMwkw.text: Amazing food, fantastic service, great decor and super cute patio...highly recommended!!!

8RdY6D7fLXxORaqvN20uPw.text: Great food! Great place to eat and mingle with friends. I suggest trying the lobster mac n cheese! Super delicious!

JNG9QcEojYFM0tJ_B7H-Lg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Arizona! The atmosphere, food and service are always on point. I've been to this restaurant plenty of times & have never had a disappointing experience.   I recommend making a reservation. This trendy delicious restaurant stays pretty busy.

qzOd_TDOKEfsqM75-5T0wA.text: Bring your appetite for this place!!! I wanted to try everything on the menu. We started with the jumbo tater tots and got them loaded, they were so good. The group I was with enjoyed the fried chicken, the mac and cheese was as amazing as it should be, and the switch burger was so good. Had to try the king for dessert, and he did not disappoint. Amazing food, amazing atmosphere, amazing staff... made it a nice evening out with friends.

UVpb-7cgf6sx7zwG7eGpYg.text: This restaurant has delicious food and a comfortable relaxing ambiance.   I had the country club panini with a side green salad. The dressing on the salad was so good and sweet.  My husband had a mushroom burger and I took a bite of it.  It was absolutely mouth-watering.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom Burger
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. country club panini
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ambiance

GhsQ6jntaAjPjpst36XFFQ.text: Switch is a great place for sandwiches for lunch or a late night meal.  Lots of space and a cute atmosphere with a small patio for fall and winter.  Although it overlooks a parking lot, the cushy blue furniture still makes the atmosphere appealing.    Start with the onion rings - they're crisp, crunchy, thick, and delicious.  Sandwiches There's a wide variety of sandwiches, many of which are quite good and feature ingredients like soft pretzel buns, housemade pickles, and grilled ciabatta.  Skip the lobster roll and go for one of the pitas or, if you're in the mood for something hearty and a little sweet, try the Southern Dump Truck.  Although the chicken batter won't be as crispy as you might like and will slide off of the thigh meat, the meat itself will be moist and flavorful.  Maple tabasco mayo and vidalia onion jam give it a real touch of sweetness to balance it against the tartness of housemade pickles, all sandwiched inside a pretzel bun with bacon and fried onion strings.  I wouldn't recommend it for a weekday lunch unless your job is compatible with post-lunch food comas!

aVebZpvIXMYH9s7q0ixRjg.text: This use to be my favorite restaurant. The new ownership removed the old very berry turkey sandwich we all loved. The switch burger has also changed. I ordered sweet potato fries and the waiter informed us they were out. Literally came in for the turkey sandwich, switch burger, and sweet potato fries and ended up with nothing. Great service but shitty ownership.

AcwxSORA9EGPbeRYO0nPoA.text: BEST brunch in Phoenix! Absolutely delicious food (American with a twist) and $4-6 carafes of excellent mixed drinks = a fun brunch with friends! I highly recommend their 'MAC N' CHEESE BREAKFAST BOWL'. 3 people in our group ordered it last time and loved it.  Besides brunch I would state (as a foodie) that they have the best food for the price in Phoenix ($12-17 for most entrees). Their specials in particular are always interesting, delicious and affordable. I would also recommend their 'DUMP TRUCK 2.0' sandwich.  Great choice for parties of 2 to 6 people. Their outdoor seating is very modern and great in good weather (no misters, only fans).

fRXje8TAgZ67Eiu0bCsvSg.text: Went in again for Mother's Day- Cynthia took care of us- service was 5 star! Food was incredible. So happy we live right around the corner of this amazing restaurant!!!

YW7xjSKta_ShQHAW_MUO5A.text: We love the atmosphere and friendly service at Switch and the food is fantastic. Recently we went for Sunday brunch and highly recommend the gallette, crepes, and green chili.

7zmVnekRHsP6PGKeTKAm5A.text: Omggggggggg Amazingggggg I had brunch with a group of my girlfriends and I ordered the Shrimp and Gritsand topped it off with screwdriver it was hands down one of the best shrimp and grits I have ever eaten and the drink was smooth with a I can not wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I got the chicken panini this time with a side ceasar salad and it was veryyyyyy good. This place never lets us down
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My wife got the Burger she is in
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Weekly special Vegetable shrimp soup..... So much flavor packed in this little bowl

KhF_OBv6qxB7_c-f3Wd3Dw.text: Always a great tasting meal.  Wait staff has forgotten our appetizer more than once. We love the hot pretzel bread and fondu.  I enjoy the chicken-vegetable pasta.  My wife used to order a burger but the last two were rare instead of well done.  Chefs seem to resist well done orders. Still, by comparison to other Phoenix establishments, this one shines.

Odxa8G3hDQ1Ow5Mpnk9Leg.text: Coincidentally ended up here a day after rolled out the new menu. Great experience. The food was so tasty. Both had chicken sandwiches which were phenomenal.  But the star of the show was the cast iron clams appetizer. Bacon jalepeno broth. Mac n cheese side was also great. Topping it off was fantastic service by Deena. We'll be back to try other parts of ths menu. Happy about this find.

xlfuR3AIkxt37eQyF_gv8Q.text: Your summertime salad reviews didn't mention Switch on Central in Phoenix. They have great food, Sunday brunch, and a Sangria Salad that is awesome add some chicken to it and it's a meal.   The portion is plenty and is not over priced. The sangria salad dressing...yummy.

EIJH2-e3pwfIO-pEk-BGKg.text: What better way to spend the first 118 degree day of 2016 than with....carafes of bloody marys and sangria at Switch? My critic in crime, "Fork", and I were visiting downtown to attend a local art show. Afterwards, we headed to Switch for lunch. Conveniently located on Central right next to well-known, Durants, Switch is a new, hip take on dining. Fork and I both agreed that the restaurant decor was modern and trendy.  Fork commented that she thought it was a bit noisy on this Saturday afternoon.  The pressed tin ceiling may not help with the noise. For my part, I didn't find the noise as any impediment to across the table conversation. Back to the carafes... Fork had a carafe of sangria ($6) and I had the bloody marys ($4).  Both great deals as you easily get 2 plus drinks from each carafe. For apps, Fork and I split the Brie Wedge and got an order of hummus.  The Brie Wedge was very nice. Baked and coated with panko it is served with toasted bread, berries and green apple and a drizzle of honey.  Very nice.  In my opinion, the hummus was just average. Paled, really, in comparison to the wedge.  The serving of hummus was also quite small whereas the wedge seemed more plentiful.  For our entree, Fork ordered their Sangria salad and added salmon.  She said the salad was quite good.  Nice greens, grapes, strawberries, goat cheese, almonds and apple. Fork also appreciated the fact that the dressing was served on the side. Fork liked the option of "dunking" rather than "drowning" her salad.  The salmon, Fork said, was prepared perfectly. I had the Cowboy Burger which was quite good. The burger was cooked just right and the ground beef was ground to just the right consistency.  The burger comes with barbecue sauce, bacon, cheddar, aioli, onion on a brioche bun. I had the Cesar salad as the side which was a very good choice. Nice dressing a big shavings of cheese. Our server, Drew, was very attentive, but did not hover. We did have one little mix up in that I was given the wrong bill when I went to pay. However after bringing it to Drew's attention, he was quick to correct the mix up. I believe both Fork and I enjoyed Switch and we think you will too. Be sure to check out those carafe options; you won't be sorry!  - Knife  (Written by Knife of Knife N Fork. Be sure to check out the reviews written by my critic in crime (and art show buddy), "Fork", of Fork N Knife.)

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sangria salad with salmon. Nicely presented and tasty!
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cowboy Burger with a side Cesar salad.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Weekend brunch carafes of sangria and bloody marys. YUMMO!

xysMHUDvwfW3tYkBbCypzg.text: Cute atmosphere! I had the ombre drink which was a jalapeno vodka and pineapple juice which was amazing! The lobster puffs and chicken sticks appetizers were delicious. I order the pork verde, it was okay, nothing special, I would not order it again and a side of mac and cheese with bacon that was SO GOOD! Our waitress was extremely sweet but it took forever to get anything, even to order food she would be gone for a long time. She brought out their cookie dough dessert for my uncles birthday which was so nice! I wouldn't suggest that, I want to go back and try the cobbler.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Ombré- jalapeño vodka and pineapple - AMAZING

-aNqfzAWHPa1QLoR0mRiBA.text: Four stars purely on the staff!!  They were so attentative to our party, our waiter was fantastic and the cooks had someone come out and make sure i didn't want fried onions on my burger....because i ordered it with the gluten free bun.  Service like this is amazing!!  The food is sooo goood!!  You can't go wrong with one of the burger--the Switch House Burger is amazing!!  So much goat cheese:)  And perfect amount of ceasar salad on the side.    Most of my party agreeded that we'll be back for many more lunches and possibly happy hours:)

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Switch House Burger:)  Goat cheese!!!

nPDBQJcPge21D2xukzO_0A.text: I had the lobster roll and some sort of Gin/Pomegranate drink that was divine. We also had an amazing cookie dessert. Great service, I plan to return when I am in the area. One suggestion is to have lights or a sign so ppl can see the restaurant at night, it was overshadowed by Durants.

5dKEQ1JiKSmXZ_okY6rWBg.text: Popped in for dinner the other evening after years of not having been here. I ordered the Super Chop Salad and my friend ordered the Cowboy Burger. I'd had the salad years ago and remember how delicious it was. This time, it was still great, but next time I think I will try one of the many other delicious looking items on the menu. The red sangria was also amazing. Would love to come back during happy hour, hang out, relax and try a new food item!

MwvaXm4gVX-qmDCVHMuSWQ.text: We visited Switch this week on the recommendation of staff at the Heard Museum (don't miss the Frida Kahlo/Diego Rivera exhibit).  We LOVED Switch!  First, the cocktails:  new takes on old favorites were fun and delightful.  The food:  inventive, but not kooky; delicious, generous portions, fresh ingredients, served hot as intended.  The service:  our waiter was Sheree(sp?) and she was attentive, helpful, professional, friendly attitude, and a terrific asset to this restaurant.  We don't live in Arizona, but will go back soon to eat at this restaurant and see the next great exhibit at the beautiful Heard Museum.

8Nne37ItlPMy8usJ333k0Q.text: Do yourself a favor and order the chicken bites and don't be scared to mix the sauces it comes with! This is just an appetizer but it could be a meal too. Their strawberry mule KILLS-so refreshing!! I got the cheeseburger which is always a good choice and my husband got the pretzel sandwich which was flavorful! Great service too!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pGjI97htn03r5qNiP5Q22g.text: Phenomenal dinner!!! There were four of us and absolutely everything we ordered was amazing. The habanero Brie was the best mix of flavors and texture, the flying pig was so tender and had the best apricot bbq, the switch house salad had the best ingredients and dressing. My husband got the chicken fingers app as his entree and they were delicious and homemade and crispy and different than anything we've had before! My brother got one of the chicken sandwiches and it was so tender and had the best mix of flavors - he said it was the best. I got the lamb meatballs special with cheesy grits omg mouth watering. The list goes on! Their menu is to die for, and their drinks menu was awesome too. You will want to order everything. The atmosphere was great and our waiter was awesome! Definitely put up with our loud table very well haha. We had a blast and will definitely return ASAP.

2OIbSXsreRBacsrBbanpww.text: Still loving switch!! Here's more pics of meals we got! This is shrimp and grits and the dump truck sandwich (something like that). Just delicious all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8b_7scKPqPls6ktJswkrJQ.text: Went for Mother's Day and the Food was very good but my favorite was the appetizer the longneck clams they were excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would go again!!

UzrUjxW28NjnhQBeaAD_Ew.text: Fantastic place for lunch. Very flavorful and varied menu. Fun atmosphere, full bar...and excellent service.   It's a little loud, but very comfortable with tables, booths or the bar for seating.   It's situated between two other restaurants, and parking is in the back. Located on Central, but easy access.  I'll be back to try some other menu items...it was hard to decide.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu with wide variety!
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Entrance is a little hidden but worth the effort.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Dump truck fried chicken sandwich&#34; and the best sweet potato fries anywhere.

Wnf_sym6c48Eygh6Yd8V_Q.text: I wasn't sure what to expect when we walked into this restaurant. There was hardly anyone there! It must still be a hidden gem because the food was great! I suggest trying the Fried Chicken Bites appetizer. The chicken was perfectly crispy and had a great flavor. We ordered the Nashville Hot version of the app. It wasn't as spicy as I would have liked but it was still delicious. I also got to try the Super Chop salad! I love that they add white beans and sun dried tomatoes! It added great texture to the salad. I'll definitely be back for reverse happy hour soon! They also have wine deals on Monday! App and a bottle for only 20 bucks! I'm in!

T-Jqu0iwYWosD-7LzDRu7g.text: For our co-worker's wedding celebration our office decided on Switch. Assuming someone else had made the reservation, we walked in with 14 people.  No problem.  That was a sign of things to come. Our server was attentive but not overbearing (that would have been difficult). Our refills flowed well. So the service, outside of a misplaced soda on one of 14 individual checks, was impeccable.  The food was good. I had the Caesar salad, and as far as Caesar salads go was top notch. The big flakes of Parmesan were a great addition, and the homemade croutons were so much better than from a bag. The grilled chicken was also a nice addition, but not for and extra five dollars. A similar complaint about the three dollar fountain drinks.  Overall, a little over-priced for the numerous add-ons options but a tasty, if expensive, spot for a nice lunch.

hCLbvPBJHHPlnWmeEfunrg.text: Absolutely love it here! The food portions are nice and hearty. The menu has a little bit of everything for everyone. Brunch menu is amazing and you cant beat the cocktail prices for brunch. I will definitely be back!

N9r6benGTkF7EVNaDBh8jg.text: This food was exactly what we were looking for to indulge in our cheesy cravings. The soft pretzels with cheese sauce and the Mac and cheese were delicious. Dan was an incredible server: friendly, helpful and suggested the best dessert we've ever had...the blueberry bread pudding. MUST try. So amazing.

56NU0xIMnnhhj_eAVvKeyA.text: Very friendly staff! Fast service great selection of drinks. Nice brunch menu very reasonable prices. It's a great place to meet a group or just have a quiet bite to eat with your friend. It's in a nice area of town. Lots of parking in the back that's a good thing. Very good selection for drinks. Food is good I have never had a bad dish. They are very accommodating.

v_nXHHFtjSghWSoUKLhogA.text: I've had this little spot bookmarked forever and finally made it in last night! I feel robbed now of all the times we haven't eaten at this place! It is that good! Totally a local hidden gem tucked right next to Durant's on Central. Parking in the back off of Virginia. The main entrance doesn't face Central so it's easy to miss.   Amazing comfort food in a really chilled out atmosphere-unpretentious with super friendly staff. Our server Deena was outstanding! Genuinely kind and sweet, like going home to a family dinner made with love :)  I had the appetizer portion of the fried chicken and I have to say it it one of the best boneless fried chicken breast I've ever had-because you would almost expect it to be dry (you know, right?) and it's perfectly seasoned and so juicy! And the honey drizzle and bbq aoli....OMG YUM! And homemade pickles...  Manhattans from the bar - on point!   Portions are generous without compromising quality.   Even their croutons on the salad were amazing (because they make those too of course!)   Jason, the owner as well as the chef, even came out to say hello since it was our first time in. What a great guy! You can see how passionate he is about the food and this neighborhood. Love going to mom and pop places that still really care. Makes a huge difference!   Will be back to eat our way they the menu and maybe even get dessert next time!   A++++ Go! Your tummy will be very happy

AZ8t12EvDZBr0Exd-1s0Dg.text: I'm pleased to say that it appears they worked out the kinks from the transition of ownership. Last two meals there were sublime.

gkiPuNcsCYNHF9gbGObf7A.text: Amazing experience every time I dine at Switch! Great for business meetings, social gatherings, date night, or birthday celebrations! Food is DELISH and very reasonably priced! I always end up coming back. Service is great too!

lglGMNVm6qhhW_VbQ4IXhQ.text: I can't even write a long review because my mouth is salivating thinking about the breakfast mac and cheese.   That's it. That's all I can say.   Eat it!!!!!   Also, the cocktail carafes are such a great way to brunch. While eating the breakfast mac and cheese.   Just do it.

8WNsvY-LosuzQSyB1Ulamw.text: My friends and I came here tonight and had a good time. I had grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup. My friends had tacos, bacon & cheese burger, sweet potato fries and mac and cheese. Everyone enjoyed their meal and service was good. The menu was varied and the restaurant was rustic.

DsHT1MIVPbBUOwmpyXuDjw.text: Came here for the first time me with my mom who recommended this place highly. I left a believer myself.  First impression was at how great the decor was. Modern, chic and really very clean and well maintained. Sat down and looked over the menu and saw multiple things on both the brunch and regular menu that I'd totally want to try as well.   Ordered the berry turkey sandwich and I was bowled over by how delicious and well balanced it was. The sweetness mixed with the red onion and cheese was just so delicious. The fries they offer are $2 extra but they were worth it. Thick, well seasoned and fluffy, in a word heaven.   We shared the Caipirinha cocktail and oh my goodness, it was fantastic. Citrusy, sweet and such a great price for Sunday bunch as a carafe was only $6!   This place was a total win. If I lived in Phoenix I'd come back often.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. What a beautiful sandwich

n_YPq-MZbzfZQ3ejCLW6eA.text: Now, THIS is what a trendy, down town restaurant should be!  The food, service and atmosphere are fantastic!!  I have been meaning to come here for ever, but always wound up next door at Couderoy.  HOLY WOW.  The Bruscetta board was a flavor punch in the mouth.  As for the meals, I would love to talk about more of them, but I always find myself inhaling the Dump truck 2.0. What is that, you may ask?  GO and see for yourself!

8CdtQDJ-FvwHDsH9j4yVcA.text: I went here with my BF and felt bad that his drink was weak and my wine was old but at least the baked Brie was good. I told the server and she just said sorry. It wasn't that much of a interest to her. She told the manager and management never came by. So $30 down the toilet. The menu is perfect for college kids who like to pay for overpriced junk food. No vegan, vegetarian options. There were three customers in the place and our server blamed someone else for not bringing menus by. Overall a waste of money.

l6BwcXDfjZIIz6vlqiuGCg.text: We usually brunch here because they have unique dishes, good deal on carafe, great service and a good atmosphere. We love their salad, entrees and sometime their weekly special. Last night, we came in for a salad but their special was pork chop. Ended up getting salad and the pork chop. Very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop with white beans

vT0yBIYzUCm8HYuGvAigCw.text: Everything was great. Pot pie? Yes please. Burgers? Ordered 3, all different temperatures, all cooked perfectly (including medium rare). Drinks were tasty and perfectly poured. Apparently the shrimp and grits were also delicious. Mac and cheese was the cherry on the sundae.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Droooool... medium rare burger ...
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese delight

X8pAtV9jLra66JYT0Lezuw.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. Have been there at least 5 times the past 3 weeks.  It was the weekend of my birthday and we were looking for a new place to try downtown. We found Switch based on the reviews from Yelp! From the outside it's so easy to pass. Nothing special about it. I've actually passed there numerous times and never knew it was there!  We entered through the parking lot in the back and walked through the adorable patio, decorated with couches, pillows, umbrellas, etc. Too bad it was scorching outside, or else I would've loved to sit there.  The service here is always incredible. Servers are friendly and do not bother you during your meal. They seemed very informed about the menu and always sound so excited about the daily special lol. The ambiance inside is so relaxing and hip with the blue lights and leather couches to sit back and have a drink on.  The drinks are my favorite part! I've tried the cherry vodka italian soda, sunrise margarita, sangria, and another drink that had lime and mint in it. I'm not one to usually order sangria, but I decided to try theirs since it was the drink of the day, and it was delicious!  They make their drinks strong, let me tell you. No complaints about that!  I love their salads, the lettuce wrap appetizer, and every dessert I've tried has been so delicious! Brownie sundae comes in a huge parfait glass and is layered to perfection! My favorite was the white chocolate blueberry bread pudding. Came with ice cream, caramel sauce, and whipped cream!   Will be going back for happy hour again soon!

0ZXcMPtDmuwaG-abJwRzSw.text: We are so glad we tried this place out.  They seated us right away when we arrived and when our waiter came to the table he noticed I was opening gifts and asked if we were celebrating my birthday. After finishing our delicious meals, I had the Provence Chicken Risotto which was delicious as were all the our entrees, our waiter cleared our plates and surprised us with a warm cookie ice cream dessert with a lighted candle on top for us to share. I wish I had gotten his name because his excellent service, along with the incredible food, made for a very memorable night. We will definitely be back.

OGrP9EEo2q7aAoEWoiOIKQ.text: We went in on a monday nite. The Decor is somewhat depressing with all the blue lit lighting, but were greeted nicely and shown to our table by a server. Ordered the hamburgers , since the menu had so many options it made us think how could all of the choices be fresh ? The burger turned out to be over cooked and the bun was dry and crumbly. Our server didn't seem too familiar with the me nu or wine list, so we were on our own. Fries were tasty, but disappointing in general.

VFq-wAPsg9cwE3obyPVrSg.text: Finally made it over to this place after hearing it was the shiznit. Yeah, I said shiznit. Nice and quiet in here, kinda dark but very relaxing. Service was good and food was amazing! A great place to get a good burger or something a little fancier. There menu has a little bit of everything. I will be back!

_pdtKB477HyStocI_Z0_1w.text: This was a stop on my wine crawl (same as a pub crawl but we only drink wine) with girlfriends. It was a beautiful saturday afternoon so we sat outside. We ordered 2 appitizers, apricot chicken skewers & lobster/shrimp tarts, which were very tasty; and since we got there a little before thier 4:00 happy hour, the waitress waited till 4 to ring in our drink order which was great since it was 2 for 1. Our waitress was great. Will be going here again.

QduA9wdi-JlJDA6JDwd0TA.text: My hubby and I stumbled upon this place. The music and ambiance was so cool. It was like toned down house music. The service was amazing! Our waiter was mixing our drinks, and after 2 each Scott and I we're pretty drunk! The food was also amazing! If you like Greek salad I have to strongly recommend theirs! The best I've ever had, hands down. The entrees are so gourmet and its so hard to make a decision. I can't recommend this restaurant enough. We are so happy!

nAtD43Z4_dPp2h75IxDNLA.text: One of my top places in the Valley.  Great food and drinks - try the sangria.  Good service and a really nice ambience in the place.  Mixed crowd which always seems to get along well.  A communal dining area, nice for singles or small parties.  The cookie dessert is very decadent.   Open and serving late too which is a plus since most every decent eatery shuts down by 9 or 10 in this town.

NQarrVFf3qPWp4TQ3UZ8Bg.text: Wow! I'm so disappointed in myself for not dining or even drinking here before now.  We came in for brunch one Sunday. It was too warm for the patio we walked through to get inside, but believe you me I'm counting down the days until the temps are in double digits again to enjoy that beautifully cozy space. Sigh... I was a little sad we wouldn't be able to enjoy the patio but was snapped back into happiness when we walked in to the smell of bacon. Sweet sweet bacon. In case you didn't know, when you walk into a restaurant to the smell of bacon, that means an angel's earned their wings. The restaurant is bright and open and the servers are friendly and helpful.  On to their moneymakers... First off, carafe of mimosas for $6?!?!?!? They are tugging on my heart strings. The carafe holds about 4 mimosas... do the math. (I won't tell you how many the two of us had). Gosh, I love taking advantage of deals. Speaking of deals, pretty much everything on the menu is less than $10. My friend got the special, a tender belly that took 30 hours to prepare. It was $7.95. It came with pickled vegetables that we didn't care for, but I don't like anything pickled. The tender-belly was so tender and delicious. Since we had bacon on the brain, we got a couple sides of bacon between the two of us. (Just like the mimosas, I'll never tell how many). The chef came out to meet the guests whom were after his heart by ordering the tender belly with sides of bacon. Who doesn't love meeting the chef? It really shows that they care about their guests and what they think about their products. I had the quiche of the day that was freaking amazing. We needed something sweet after all that delicious, hearty food; so we shared the cookie dough with ice cream. This is my favorite dessert anywhere... the sort-of baked chocolate chip cookie dough with vanilla ice cream on top. I was in heaven.  This brunch was one of the best I have had ever! I love brunch... It's my favorite meal. I'll definitely have to come back when the nights are cooler and check out the dinner menu on the patio. LalalalalalalaLOVE this place!!!!

-CqhhcdiHyxZUroj8pCthw.text: So I'm not in love, but I'm definitely in HUGE like!  One of my friends wanted to try a new place for her bday lunch and she picked switch.  I wasn't too convinced but it was very good.  I knew it had to be part of the Fez/Ticoz family (which I consider myself a niece of because i can't get enough!).    My only complaint is that there weren't enough salad choices.... maybe I was unhappy with the selections overall but I had the sangria salad.  It was very good, but not enough fruit and enough lettuce to make 3 salads.  Overall very good.... I'll be back soon!

unWu9J28N66cPvr639k_6A.text: Love their food and drinks! You will love this place its amazing. The restraint has a nicely modern and cozy feel. Great service and stands out tremendously!

9o42QW-ymN0RGvuqB-n40A.text: My sister took me here last week its crazy that I haven't been yet right? This is her regular go to place. Not much I can say after so many reviews here already. The patio looked very nice I bet its the place to be when its cooler. It was kind of empty in here but it was late afternoon. My sis ordered us some Drunken Italian Sodas they were made super strong though usually this would not detour me however I had my child with me and had to drive all the way back home after. Basically it tasted like straight vodka in a giant glass it was a bit much for me mid day and after adding Sprite to it which I stole from my daughter I still couldn't drink it without feeling like I'd be a drunken Mexican after. I didn't understand this drink maybe someone can explain it to me? My sis told me their Sangria was good but I had no idea they made Caipirinha's next time that's what I get no question.  The food: We had the garlic lemon hummus it was really good the ingredients separately didn't have much taste to them but together it was really nice the pita bread was excellent. The kid couldn't stop eating the hummus she got so full she barely touched her mac n cheese so we brought that home along w all the leftover hummus. Now on to the Tejano burger we decided to split. OMG it was so delicous I couldn't put it down and we both regretted having split it w each other. Extra star just for that burger alone you best try it if you haven't son!!!

3TjoFs-K_KMvZlTHzFyNBg.text: Great local spot.  The salmon entre on spinach...umm...to die for.   The burgers are great as well.  Drink selection is good.  Service is tops.  I didn't like one appatizer.  It was off the table and off the bill faster than I could blink...and my choice of a replacement.  Wow.  There is attentive service.  All I said was that it wasn't my favorite...  They go the extra mile and for that they deserve extra loyalty.

Pu-IZELGAB85ClhULgdW1g.text: Excellent happy hour and yummy dinner. The caperinhas were great, and at $3.5 for happy hour, totally worth it. Wine is also $3 per glass during happy hour as well. The lobster and seafood crepes were super tasty, though a little small for the price. I added a side salade which brought this up to a tasty fully meal. Recommended.

c_Lec26tOJV5ckaL-BZbxw.text: Great food, gluten free hamburger buns and goat cheese!! A girl couldn't ask for more. A great atmosphere and excellent service.  The cheeseburger was amazing to boot.

JweBn8Jxj5kvmExATApX6g.text: Great food, service was excellent.  Great atmosphere, deffinately worth the money.

09gWWmTKju8yRAWaMzGSkQ.text: Fantabulous Menu, Service, Atmosphere and drinks!  Can't imagine anyone not finding there perfect meal and drink here.   2 for 1 happy hour!  Exceptional place in central Phoenix!

6ehlpQ1g4sVn57Ajapb7vw.text: 5 stars for a few reasons: 1) the staff was nice, 2) the shiraz was great, 3) the meal was for this type of place, 4) the music was characteristic of this style of restaurant but not too loud as is typical, 5) the chef came out to ask what I thought of the steak & his passion for the food was really evident.

b04MgakRl3SzlMYgu-5fcg.text: Enjoyed a nice dinner here last night. Had the lobster appetizer and cheese plate, which were both delicious. For dinner I decided to try the brie and turkey gallette, which was pretty good. The bechamel sauce was very rich and creamy, and the brie was a nice accompaniment. The grapes on top weren't a good fit for my palate. Service was a little slow, but it was a busy night at Switch. The waitress was kind and personable. I'd certainly come back again.

7G7iHfnDyZ3s_vc2KTaylw.text: Went for brunch on a Saturday morning. The food is excellent especially considering the price. The back patio is good environment...laid back with lots of umbrellas for shade.  Only negative was average coffee and juice (not that fresh).  Very close to giving this five stars.

PgXxLRgXqsVaqN7xY-xT6Q.text: Lettuce wrap w/ lamb sooo good! Cheese plate is awesome n the little ones love the mac and cheese. All the food is a must try though! Service is always on par and drinks are poored just right!

YnnkAfHJKrvJKJ-nRoI5Cw.text: What happened?! I used to love this place. Tonight I was incredibly disappointed. The appetizer (chopped pork over jalapeno tater tot) had no flavor, very bland. Three of us split it and all agreed. Horribly bland. When we complained about it there was no apology or taking it off the bill. The rest of the meal was just as bad. I had the Mac and cheese with chicken. Not interesting or special in the least. One table mate had the chicken pot pie galette which was dry and flavorless. And the other member of our group had the verde valley pork. He wasn't too happy either. Overall it was very tasteless. The drinks were good though.

ncifnbJSeRGE7XiQGrCzxg.text: Wonderful drinks, great food! We went on Saturday, has small plates. The Thai tacos were amazing, lobster crab puffs good too. And the icing on the cake? The chocolate martini!!

rSe2QX8pje8ZGVFlXUA3lw.text: A great place.  I live in the neighborhood. It's awesome.  The staff are very friendly and the restaurant is open long hours.   Also, it's very friendly for the GLBT community and the service is very good.   If you're craving a good burger, this is the place to go.

3kqbuwb1zWnpPP28Mdb4vQ.text: The food here is great, I've never had anything that I didn't like. My favorites are the: Lobster and crab puffs Switch burger Breakfast gallette  Come in on the weekends for their breakfast; they have $3 bloody mary carafes. The service can be a little slow sometimes but it's worth the wait for the food.

FCkPbmk-CG40oj-2DS6Z9A.text: First visit of what I can tell you will be MANY.. this place is a  fresh breath of creativity!  From the Decor to the Menu.  A Cozy patio area with comfortable cushioned seating and shady umbrellas leading into the  contemporary upscale eatery but not to the point of making one feel uncomfortable. I definitely  liked the color scheme it was very soothing.  The menu had a variety of  dishes from many cultures.I like this as it so wonderful to have  many Options.  My Ciaprianha was  refreshing and  absolutely divine!  my bestie and I decided on a few Small  plates. The Thai  Braised Beef Tacos were fantasmic!  Kon Tum Chicken Meatballs  soo savory!  Baked Lobster and Crab Puffs delightful!  I continued to look the menu up and down in anticipation for  my next visits here. I plan on dinner and definitely making it here for brunch as well.

ihlrJOXV615OafhjhqjF0w.text: I happen to pop in to this little spot here for a little lunch get together. I think they knew we were coming. As I still learn my way around the DT Phoenix area. Well I am here for the beer. As it would be on a early Friday afternoon. Everyone still working and not here for the same reason as me. Our server told us about the lunch special. I was like eh...... Kilt Lifter please. Beer is there and ready to be poured in a glass. Food was there and ready to be eaten. I had the Tejano Burger and the Fries. Even though the burger came with a Caesar salad? Different but ate it anyways. The big thing that surprised me that they actually split the bill for all 11 of us. I was not expecting that but  I will and need to come back to taste some vino as well....

65Kyb-UAOCG_HLVjGXj6TA.text: My new favorite restaurant in Phoenix! Loved everything we ordered and our server, David, was fabulous! The onion rings were the best i've ever had...and it was the first time I ever liked sweet potato fries (amazing).

IG6RmHPNfq_ttm8hENm8jA.text: I brunched (yes I used that as a verb) with some friends at Switch this Sunday.  I had an egg taco plus bacon; like most things with bacon, it was love at first bite.  We all shared a $6 pitcher of Mimosas.  Who doesn't love that?  The restaurant is very cute, it has that downtown Phoenix vibe.  Loved everything, although it was a little weird listening to house over brunch, but I digress... it was SO worth it.

SpP6NimlrM9lASV6TZ5-kA.text: My friend works here, so I had to try the place. To be honest, I don't think it has as many appealing options as one of the other restaurants the owners of this place also own; I like Bliss better for its food options but their servers aren't as friendly.  The service is great, the people are extremely nice and accommodating. The food is a bit pricy (hence 4 stars) as you need to ask for sides to go with your mains (i.e. the burger doesn't come with fries, you need to order them separately), but it is always delicious. I have had a drink there once and it was also well-concocted.

mbowXIy_5e8De1ic0DpY-g.text: Came here for the first time with a few friends about a week ago, and overall it was pretty great.
