We ate and had a few drinks on the back patio, which was nice and quiet. The atmosphere was nice, the service was friendly and effecient and the food was awesome. The only thing that knocks this rating to a four instead of a five is dish inconsisntency.  Along with my drink, I had ordered the "When Pigs Fly" appetizer for my meal. The dish itself was amazing - house made chicharrones, pork and duck pate, and bacon glace. As soon as the dish hit the table, my friend immediately ordered another one for himself, and it came out just as quickly. The only issue was that apparently my dish had come out incomplete. Along with the three pork centered items there were supposed to be pickles, red onion and crostinis.  My plate didn't have croistinis, and apparently the difference in the amount of pickles was noticeable by the whole table. We all thought it was kind of amusing and I wasn't upset about it by any means, although I did end up just eating the pate by itself seeing as how I had nothing to spread it onto.   Although the experience was great, by principle I can't give a 5/5 after seeing that much of a dish inconsistency, especially when there was no less than five minutes between each order and it was a monday night around 6pm and slow.  But! I will be back again to try out brunch!

4ZQdUtFK211dvs9LDuQ82A.text: This is definitely a new mom review.  I like this place, but I don't know if this restaurant really wants to be represented as the cool place to hang out with your little kids. My friend and I went to lunch today and we had great customer service from Jake and good food (Lobster Roll and Salad Special), while enjoying the weather on the patio. Our kids were with us and we we were lucky that there were only two kids since they had one highchair and one booster seat for the entire restaurant! I didn't get a good look inside so I don't know if space is an issue, but at least there was a diaper changing station in the women's restroom. So, I guess you should bring your child's own booster seat if you would like to dine here.  Bottom line: Good food, good service, and no one seemed to mind that I used a (clean) child's sock to make a hand puppet to amuse our kids. Just be willing to bring your own booster seat. Or at least one for your kid.

3tcCWvsHwM0lDmT5E2QFYw.text: One of my favorite places to go! The staff is always very friendly and attentive. Great atmosphere no matter what time you go to eat. The food.... The food is amazing, have tried many menu items never to be disappointed. Best brunch in phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Switch house burger!

Jf-_j8h5qS39v_7y78HWFQ.text: Not bad, but I will not be coming back.  For the price you can find better places.  Maybe I just hit them on an off night.

C6T14hO6fsyJAQbfd4tvWw.text: Thanks to Yelp I picked this place out while passing through Phoenix.  Whoa I really loved it.    I had the pork loin with cornbread pudding.  What a meal to end my 2 week stay in Arizona.  I think this meal was my favorite on the whole trip.

4uN2a5ZpcU9QN5lAPuzo0Q.text: 1st time going. And it was nice. Love the vibe. The waiter was super nice and friendly. I had the lamb lettuce wraps YUMMY. I definitely recommend it and this place.

epivlzNSBfTeh_Oe7aFxlA.text: So this review is just for the mac and cheese.  Yes, you read that correctly- the mac and cheese.  Several years ago I had an epic mac and cheese gastronomic experience- and since then I have been on a quest for truly great "gourmet" mac and cheese.  Haven't had any that fit that description here in Phoenix.  So I Googled it.  Switch's mac and cheese topped a couple of different lists for best mac and cheese in Phoenix- so of course I had to give it a shot.  Was it good?  Oh yeah.  It was very, very, very good.  Go ahead and order it- it might be one of the best dishes they have, and one of the best mac and cheeses you've had.  But was it transcendent?  Will it be calling me back again and again?  No.  Sadly, it didn't reach that level, in my opinion.  I guess Phoenix doesn't have any life-altering mac and cheese.

M-PZ4BxYMf2JDEFPybkNFA.text: I've been coming here with co-workers for at least two years.   My husband and I were back here in December and I noticed they had made some small changes to the menu.  Specifically my favorite grilled cheese panini with Gouda was gone which forced me to find something else. (Boo!)  I decided on the Caprese sandwhich and it was PHENOMENAL.  I gave some to my husband because he was still hungry after eating his meal and I knew I wouldn't be able to finish.  He's not a vegetarian and even he liked it.  It was so good I started ordering the Caprese sandwich at other local restaurants and have yet to find its equal.  All other Caprese sandwiches are now compared to the one at Switch.  The atmosphere is always fun.  When I come here for happy hour we usually try to sit outside because they have a cute patio with couches.  The decor inside is a little dark but I like it.

on-TngvL2E1ebf-6aKQ0gA.text: Switch is awesome. If you read nothing beyond that sentence, its OK.  The decor is very modern and sleek, and the music adds a good ambiance without drowning out conversation. The drinks are creative, and affordable. The wine selection is good, and also affordable.  Where Switch blows me away every time is the food. Whether you want something light, healthy and refreshing or something over-the-top decadently rich, there are options for you. The cast iron clams are not to be missed, and on a hot day the Spartan pita really satisfies without overdoing it.  When it comes to sides, don't pass on the Mac 'n Cheese, but the one that keeps my mouth watering days after I've had it is the greek feta, cucumber and tomato salad. Talk about refreshing!  The other piece that makes Switch cool is the service, they are really attentive and the staff have definite personalities that make dining here a lot of fun!

UWTECGM2E3Ot1DLMwiU7PA.text: I stayed in a hotel across the street for a week, so I visited Switch twice.  Delicious onion rings, tasty chicken kebabs (although they could have been hotter), satisfying bacon salad, and decadent bread pudding.  What's not to love?

0pHtWDpHGgXLE0l4sBzYCw.text: first time here a month ago for dinner after a business meeting had the switch lettuce wraps delicious! will be back again!

gHJUmLdtYtDVqanoE13S9g.text: Visited Saturday night for cocktails and dinner. Atmosphere is welcoming, was greeted and sat promptly by hostess. Waiter was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. Started with cocktails that were well executed and had the clam appetizer. I ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese and it was savory with perfectly cooked lobster pieces. It's a big serving so good for sharing or leftovers. My hubby had the Jalisco Panini which I took a couple of bites from and it was delicious. First time visit and will become a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stellar cocktails at Switch.

_x4Fo7OrV9klDEIyup2mfw.text: I had another wonderful time at Switch before a movie date. We had great service with excellent food. Everything was hot, fresh, and delicious. I can always count on Switch for a wonderful meal.

ulXxDKAcAPg9D3w4TgJLVg.text: loved everything about Switch The modern comfortable roomy restaurant. Great service. Interesting menu, the sangria salad was excellent with grilled shrimp added. Very tasty freshly baked pretzel as an appetizer.It was all good!

J9zBmUlTUGXtCGtLbpLbSg.text: Ate here last night and it was delicious and affordable. My companion had one of the many appealing signature cocktails. The Nashville hot chicken was tasty although could have packed more heat, but the green chili meatloaf chosen by my companion was unbelievable! Only sorry I didn't have room for dessert! Outside patio was quiet and lovely.

zCjE9L92RmHai5oX1IJG7Q.text: We ordered the Mac &'cheese with lobster and crab and the spinach bacon feta both very solid but not amazing. The prices, however were very high.  Even during happy hour, a small bottle of beer was $4 so really high prices.

0Hwz_u0R9aANnJIlmGM-yQ.text: Great service and food. Big portions. A little complex on the dishes but a Saturday Sunday brunch is the best in Central Phoenix

SXsVCHfJcS3Pzw48nWk1jw.text: Possibly new favorite joint  Atmosphere was sophisticated yet not so formal you would feel out of place in a tee and jeans. Service was friendly and engaging. The food was seasoned perfectly and the portions were on point. The buttermilk fried chicken is highly recommended.

AB3ce97XAeigMboN7rxfig.text: We came for happy and were pleasantly surprised.  Happy hour was fantastic,  we ordered a bottle of wine that the server suggested paired with the brie appetizer. It was amazing. We went early so it was nice and quiet. Will definitely return again.

S4yN51emOMcpuhOl_IWlHg.text: I can't anymore. I used to love this place. I'd find a way to sneak off for a couple of hours of alone time just to order the chicken/asparagus/risotto dish they used to have. This place held good memories of date nights and celebrations but then they changed the menu a year or so ago. Got rid of all of our favorite things. We went back once, struggled to find anything that sounded appetizing, and haven't been back since. It's too bad. That risotto with the tomato water was to die for.

NwWG_eFFx4Z23RHI5eluNQ.text: I have tried this places many times. I have to say that both the food and service hasn't been the greatest the past my past few visits. I have always ordered my eggs basted and now they don't offer that option due to new management. I recently celebrated my sisters birthday and brought one cup cake from urban Cookie as my sister is gluten free and they nearly cut my head off and said I couldn't bring this item inside the restaurant. I had about 10 people seated at the table and have brought many new people to this restaurant. I was so embarrassed on how the new manger approached me. I will have to say after the attitude, cold toast, horrible service and no more basted eggs I will never return to this restaurant.

XogRLG3faoTmsn_U5fckTw.text: Went in on a Saturday afternoon with friends for  lunch. We chose Thai tacos, onion rings, and hummus with pita. Who can brag on onion rings??? They can! The dipping sauce was amazing, creamy & tasty! Hummus had great flavor. The Thai tacos, packed with flavor & refreshingly crisp veggies. Why stop there...my lunch was an open faced breakfast burger...2 Fried eggs topped a juicy burger that included tomatoes, bacon and an amazing cheese sauce. My potatoes were seasoned & had red peppers mixed in...I forget the name of my dessert dish however it was a blueberry cakey thing with caramel & a scoop of vanilla ice cream. I can't rave enough about Switch & I'm bringing my mother next time...see you soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My friends blt was at least 4 to 5&#34; thick...missing a bite ;-)
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My friends pastry puff filled with sausage and other breakfast goodies
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My appetizer (Thai tacos) breakfast burger &amp; my dessert

47GCS9lEjIt35Zq8EsO9SQ.text: Unfortunately, this is going to be a bad review.   Please clean the lady's restroom. Please.  I came on Friday, and after going into the restroom, I couldn't even eat the pork belly special. Needless, to say I lost my appetite.   After a while, (a few sips of my lemon drop) I decided I was hungry.  However, The cheese board was mediocre, and the chicken appetizer was dry.   This place used to be my favorite go-to for brunch and happy hour. This makes me sad.

RMMlp7slcSODNErdWyBJjg.text: Had a great meal here while staying one night in Phoenix. The hot pretzels were good to share. My wife had the fried chicken bites and they were crispy and well seasoned and the trio of sauces that came with them were flavorful and not overly spicy. I had the Dragon Pita and it was honestly one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had; chicken cooked properly and not dry, marinated well and loaded with fresh veggies. Everything was excellent and I'm glad I got to meet and compliment the chef as he said goodbye as we were leaving. Even talked about flying back to trade for a roast pork from my area which he knew a lot about. Check this place out!

gkk_6osQ-lZBkrW1NKkAGw.text: I enjoyed a delicious meal here for a UYE lunch event. The restaurant was very accommodating for our party of 11 and provided excellent service - keeping our water glasses filled and ensuring all of our meals arrived at the same time.   I enjoyed the Thai Braised Beef Tacos ($11.95) during a previous visit and they were just as delicious this time as I remembered! The 4 tacos have the perfect combination of spicy and sweet braised beef rib meat on corn tortillas with Asian hot sauce and tangy slaw. The tacos are accompanied by jalapeno slices and sweet pickles for those who want to "kick it up a notch."   All of my dining companions seemed equally pleased with the mac 'n cheese, burger, salad, and lobster & seafood crepes.   I will definitely return to Switch for the variety of entree options, cocktails, and great service. This is a great restaurant for a number of occasions - a birthday lunch, romantic brunch on the patio, or dinner with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Braised Beef Tacos (close up)
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Braised Beef Tacos

ztxl8jq41KeeIQlLKmoIlg.text: I'm a huge fan of switch. So close to a 5 star rating but I've had some servers with a bit of a tude preventing them from getting a full 5 stars. The food is amazing and timely, their chief does a great job even if you're picky and want things omitted. The desert "the king" is a must if you're celebrating anything at all, even something as simple as breathing. Their mac n cheese is amazing, pretty much everything I've had there is tasty, filling, and very good. The thai tacos as a starter is our current jam. Also don't be afraid of the switch burger it's legit! Great community vibe in there and I would most def recommend to all my yelp friends.

Ti5GXy8TwqzIzQCovqAbtg.text: Came for brunch, had the beef dip sandwich which was delicious. Perfectly cooked, and mighty tasty. Service was amazing, she was always checking go make sure all was ok.

RUWpfFreOtHzH-iVg_vNMw.text: Tried this place last night that has been bookmarked for months. We loved it! We started with the lettuce wraps and thai tacos. Both incredible. I had the Switch Super Cobb (think that's what it was called) which was delish. And my boyfriend had the pot pie which was flavorful but some of the veggies were a little undercooked. Overall, we loved the food and the patio atmosphere. Will absolutely go back again!

P2Udp4Q3y6_QcIbwFMd_hg.text: Well I panned this place but had to give it another try. The owner went out his way to apologize and ask for me to come back and give them a second chance. The owners eagerness to right the wrongs alone impressed me they care about their clientele.   Their speciality drinks are good and tasty. Their appetizers are generous. Not overly inventive but satisfying. Dinner as well a good meal. I avoided asking for a substitute (one of the issues only first visit). I can say the lighting was much better and the staff much more friendly and knowledgeable! So kudos. Great improvements. I have to say the dessert was the best I had - not to sweet and a nice ending to the meal.  So thanks for encouraging me to come back.

KFHTKLASfnNZElwt-6qe5g.text: I don't think that Switch should share a parking lot with Durant's. The burger I ate might as well been a plate of just goat cheese. I'm a fan of goat cheese especially when used well, but when the meat is over cooked and goat cheese is spilling out of the burger you've gone too far.

T3PrRhPDTBzUu6MvF2gcOw.text: OK, EVERYONE! If you're looking for a great spot with great service and amazing food .. this is your place!  Truthfully I haven't been this impressed by a restaurant since last year in CA.   Husband and I walked in as first timers (I think through the wrong door), and right away a nice guy who was also a server I think greeted us within 3 seconds, and asked us where we would like to sit, what we preferred, etc. he brought over waters right away.   Drinks were ordered and came fast. We ordered the Brie appetizer as well as the chicken bite appetizer. SO good! And really big portions for appetizers.    My husband (who I've never seen eat meatloaf before) got the meatloaf and I got the chopped salad with salmon. Amazing!!!! We were both so amazed by the food and may even come back this weekend for brunch, which I've heard great things about .   *i wrote a review last year to a restaurant in San Diego about how I've never had as great of experience like that in AZ..... We now have experienced that in Arizona. Love this place

7W1hdt3phhlhEPCSV6jWEA.text: Switch......What do I say about this place?  You're right on the light rail in Phoenix.  You are urban enough to call it a place I think is cool.   The decor fits the area and the crowd likes it as well.  I think what makes this place is the Sat and Sun brunch.  Food comes out looking great, taste matches it as well.  Drink specials are affordable to keep what you had going the night before.  Patio seating is nice and intimate during the fair weather months here in Phoenix.  The only downfall I have for this restaurant is the wine list.  Oh you can be more creative and get better wines that have those clever names!

-Lfc16cRQGyPfDvFEqYK1Q.text: I am puzzled by the number of poor reviews for Switch, i just had a great meal.  The ambiance was pleasant and my service was attentive and friendly - thank you Anthony.   Given that I am a big fan of both Ticoz and Fez perhaps this place just works for me like the other two do. I was starving and ordered their classic cheese burger and then got double meat (it's America, why not and it's only another 5 hours on the elliptical). The burger was done medium as I asked, the rest of the plate looked good, the condiments were fresh - all in all a great lunch.  I will go back for certain and I like the fact that it is a different but related menu to the other two siblings - mostly - I was thrilled to see the Guaccummus from Ticoz.

EoZn2MqpG3JHR4nKdTs4yw.text: This is another great space on Central seemingly struggling with a steady clientele.  As another reviewer noted, they seemed really overstaffed last week when I was there for the three tables being waited on.   The two times I've been there - for Sunday brunch and an evening dinner - you could hear a pin drop.  I heard from staff that they're still working on the liquor license (supposed to be happening soon), so perhaps that the newness of the place and light rail construction is keeping people away.  My chicken and prosciutto panini and side salad was pretty good too and it's priced right for what it is at 8.95.  The wait for our food was a bit longer than normal (esp. given there was hardly anyone there and only three tables of people) - about 20 min. or so.  I also ordered a chocolate banana smoothie - which I've had better elsewhere.  I like the interior design of the place, but yes, it is very IKEA-esque.  Their extensive sofa area makes me want to curl up on one of their sofas and read a book sometime.    I'd really like to like Switch more, but it seems to be off to a slow yawning start.  I do hope things improve.

ObyIhqqD7KiOGJi_KtaJ6w.text: Switch was ok.  It didn't blow me away but for lunch it's a good standard place to pick.  The space is really nice, half restaurant, half lounge complete with Scrabble and decks of cards.    We started with the hummus which was fantastic just like I thought it would be.  However, I was disappointed with the mozzarella caprese sandwich.  I love sourdough but that pairing with the mozzarella just didn't work....the bread over powered the cheese and we all know that cheese should be the focal point.  I also didn't like the baby greens on the sandwich, just basal would have been perfect.  The Caesar salad that was included, however, was good.  I really liked the iced tea and loved that they give you a huge carafe of it on the table.  Some of lunch companions chose salads which looked very good, I'll probably choose one of those the next time I go back.    We got there at 11:30 but by noon the place was totally packed.

-lnkoNkcmE005fVA0ZxKZQ.text: Nice, relaxing, place!  Can here from out of town (OK, San Francisco--if you must know) for a business meeting across the street.  Stopped in here with some associates to stragegise and discuss before heading off to the meeting.  The decor is nice, the place was fairly quiet (it was like 2:30 PM) which was perfect for our needs.  We had the baked lobster and crab puffs for a starter and then I had the house burger.  All in all, pretty decent.  Our waiter was also very nice.  I'll be back.

ae_5Bjnmqn-XJ8w_12vbCg.text: I was avoiding writing this Yelp because I love Fez so much and didn't want to diss it's sister.   Honestly? The food is not very good.  This could be a great place. It just needs help.

p691TurnXeQdd5PSEm5Jqg.text: Switch is my favorite neighborhood, I go there a few times per week. My favorite food is the Thai tacos. The servers are friendly, the atmosphere is very welcoming and I love that I can walk home. Also, the wine list, drink specials and wonderful bread pudding keep me coming back.

SXpOebDVTHSzcwDlVF3Mig.text: It's trendy, they've got hummus and it's walking distance from work. My coworkers love this place.  But -- the prices aren't the greatest and to be honest, I can get just as good food next door at Schlotsky's. But if we need someplace to impress people, we can bring them here [unless of course we REALLY want to impress them, then we take them to Durant's, just two doors down!]  but the guys are nice, they do have good service.

8X49Ll8RoPS0k2TfQyXF2w.text: We weren't too impressed with the casual dining scene in Phoenix until we found this place! Located near the Heard Museum, it was easy to get to and the perfect atmosphere for lunch (kinda dark, but that's okay). The food was mega tasty and they had a ton of vegetarian options.   The only complaint I have is that the waiter didn't keep his personal comments to himself. ie: when i ordered something he said "well that doesn't surprise me."  not cool and i let him know it, maybe he was just having a bad day.  but over all, aside from our lame waiter, good experience and good food =]

fLWxrxPLRPz5QXA6NdrAqg.text: Great atmosphere for any mood. Great drink menu. Ordered the risotto croquets which today's flavor was Greek! They were hot ,creamy ,amazing and great balance of flavor. I ordered the Mac and cheese with the lobster and the crab, delicious! Be aware huge portion! Also ordered the fairytale brownie sundae, it was really good,but so big we didn't finish it! I would definitely come back again and tell others how great this place was!

vCTt5ZNVfNY2xz-jWagHfQ.text: I love Switch and I come here almost every Monday night for my always amazing $5 burger!!!  However, it is True, the staff, especially the host is a little snotty. There are many times that I had to wait standing up next to the host because my other friend, who was only a few minutes away, was not at the restaurant yet. It is especially annoying to have to wait when the restaurant isn't even busy. If only they would realize that people usually order more drinks if they are seated at their table while they are waiting for the rest of their party to arrive. It is a silly policy and they should realize that it will only drive customers away. If their burgers weren't as amazing, I'm sure that I would be turned off and wouldn't return...but I'm a sucker for a good burger!

Rn5Fj5ca75XaiIOA16psOA.text: Seriously, Yelp?    I finally find a place that I really like in downtown Phoenix, only to read that everyone's been ragging on it? WTF?  I came to Switch tonight to meet a friend who I hadn't seen in.. oh... 15 years? I was so excited to see the nice atmosphere -- much more a lounge, than  bar -- and that's something that's missing in the Valley. The place was cute, the music was the right level and the drink menu was great.  After a caipirinha (ok, well, it really tasted more like a mojito to me, but, whatever - it packed a punch!) and a nice malbec, I can say I truly enjoyed this place. It was a great space to sit comfortably and have a good conversation. The only downside was that the service was slllloooww -- but it was also very friendly, so that wouldn't stop me from recommending this place to anyone. My only surpise was to see that Switch is a breakfast and lunch joint? That struck me as odd, as I'd much rather come here for some nighttime drinks than for a breakfast. But, to each her own....

OfhivdDdw_PAZVqBwAAZ8w.text: 4 stars for the grilled cheese alone. MMMMM, smoked gouda.  Never had anything else, nor am I going to venture away from eating anything but the grilled cheese. Nothing really appeals to me, anyway. But I come here a lot because the grilled cheese is just that goooooooooood.  Did I mention the grilled cheese?

N9njPZMWEnbquMWLr8d8vw.text: Great atmosphere. Food good. Service even better. Jacob rocks!

ge2N-URXJT6u0_-ErEJBPw.text: My favorite! The best burgers in town and amazing cocktails :)

_bPv-Src44BHgPO_JBYP3w.text: The sign out front is kinda ghetto, so you'd never know what a cool little patio Switch has. We stopped in for a quick drink or three and it was just what the doctor ordered.  We found a cozy little spot on the elongated patio and enjoyed some boozey flavored Italian sodas.  They seemed to have decent specials throughout the week and this was ours for a Sunday night.  It was quick drink occasion so I don't have in depth thoughts, other than it seems to be a nice spot for some booze and conversation without breaking the bank - and those are places I could find myself a regular at.

NFTAGkJ_rEeHCQsERm_kVQ.text: After months of begging I finally granted my girlfriend her wish to check this place out.  Since we were on a time constraint lunch I decided to order the Recession Special Plate; this is a Ham and Swiss on a baguette that comes with a side salad for less than $6.  The only gripe that i have is that the bread was stale and almost impossible to chew. Not sure if its part of the "Recession Experience"  but I guess you get what you pay for . . .  Other than that the decor, atmosphere and specially the service was impeccable.

8edID4Y8iTB9kbXthaxgcA.text: Went here for dinner and tried the apricot bbq chicken skewers and some sandwich and crepe.  The chicken was decent- grilled and covered with a sweet and spicy sauce.  The crepe I had was the lobster and seafood crepes.  It was advertised as "2 large crepes" but when the dish came out, they looked puny against the big white plate that they were served in.  The crepe filling tasted just OK.  Nothing to write home about.  I couldn't really taste much lobster or shrimp (or notice any difference in texture) because it seemed like the main ingredient in the dish was the bright red "Krab" rather than "crab".  After the first crepe, I couldn't eat much more, there was something about the flavor and the sauce that really stopped me from wanting to eat the whole thing since it wasn't really that great tasting.  I tried some of the French au jus sandwich and it was also decent.  I wish the sandwich had more beef in it, for it looked like most of the sandwich consisted of toasted bread with just a thin slice or two of beef.  Dessert was interesting.  We had a warm brownie served with coffee ice cream and drizzled with caramel and pretzels.  I wouldn't have thought to use pretzels in a dessert, but the result was a pretty good mix of textures and tastes.  The brownie was delicious and decadent, especially when paired with the ice cream and caramel, contrasting with the saltiness and crunch of the pretzel.

grBbhFTivMv9jn0FOCGpJw.text: After talking to Thomas (of FEZ fame) we decided to give ole Switch another shot (and because the owner is super cool).  This time it was much better.  I had a hamburger and it was VERY good.  Awesome bun and greeeesy (just the way it should be!).  They now are bumped to a 3 star, and I hope they bring back weekend breakfast hours ... we need a good place for a hangover cure in CenPho!

h15HQZWmhf6MlS2lKZozyg.text: This is one of those rare places where I have been disappointed a few times, but still want to come back and try it again in the future.  Honestly, I think this place is just taking a bit longer than normal to get going and come into its own.  I was here twice -  once in the evening when it was totally dead (just me and 3 friends), and once for lunch where it was relatively full but not crowded.  Both times the service was really awkward.  Although I had different wait staff each time, on both occasions I or a companion made requests that went unheard - forcing us to be a little more aggressive than usual about getting their attention.  Is it bad accoustics?  Because the place isn't really that hectic, even during what is probably their busiest time of day.  The food is ok, but it's a lot like Fez and Ticoz in that they stick with offering several variations on just a few select types of dishes.  However, I like that they offer some casual and light choices like a fruit and cheese plate - perfect if you're just hanging out for awhile with friends or clients.  I've also had a salad and a sandwich here, although I can't remember which ones (they were not bad, but obviously forgettable).  The prices are reasonable, but the decor is cheap - so even without getting/tasting the food you already know they're fair.    Overall, I think I'd wait a few months to see if they're still in business, and then recommend another visit.  1/22/08 Update - I went back with friends two weeks ago to find the menu and service greatly improved, so I'm upgrading to 4 stars.

MgobUN9ouupwNiuJiBbsAg.text: I've dined at Switch several times over the last 2.5 years.  My first visit was actually the Yelp Elite Black & White Party.  They were out to impress that night, and certainly did!  Thomas was a fabulous host and the party was a blast!  Lately, I've been meeting clients or friends for lunch or grabbing to-go when I've pulled an extra long day at the office.  I've tried many things that have all been great, but keep going back to the same item- Pamplona Veggie Burger.  It is AMAZING!!  It's a black bean, soy patty with corn in it as well.  The burger includes shredded spinach, sun-dried tomato spread, aioli & chipotle sherry dressing, and topped with an onion ring.  I always add goat cheese.  I was hesitant to order a veggie burger, since I eat all types of meat.  I cannot be more happy that I did!  Switch offers modern decor, low lighting, and friendly service.  This is a fabulous sister business of FEZ.  Mark Howard and his team continue to do a superb job!

ZDZu8UifsDN9gZdLD3odpg.text: Came for a drink and my friend for a bit of food. The staff was not too helpful and was pushing us to order. Thw drinks were fine. When and if i go back i might change my mind as one bad experience. However. It was a cute area. Nice for a quiet night out with drinks.

teLcu8b6fzeow-5xA9KTXw.text: Switch has really picked its game up in the past year or two.  I remember the days of eating at Switch and walking away from the place saying, "Yeah..that was just ok". They seem to have a new chef now, or they really took customer feedback into consideration.   I have been to Switch several times and have found new things on the menu to love. From the delicious and rich Lobster and Crab Puffs to the hearty and filling Apricot BBQ Feta Chicken sandwich. One of my favorite sandwiches is the Mozzarella Caprese Ciabatta. I usually add prosciutto to my sandwich and it makes it THAT much better. Try the sandwich with a side of Sun Dried Tomato Risotto; yum!  Sometimes they have some amazing specials. About a month ago, for brunch, I enjoyed the Chef's Special of Duck Hash. The hash was well made and flavorful. I felt lucky that I came in for a quick brunch that day. He's always thinking something delicious and "hangover friendly" on the weekends.   My latest crush is Apricot BBQ Feta Chicken Sandwich. "Oh, what's that?", you might ask. Well let me tell you, my friend. That's a sandwich comprised of warm, sliced chicken, a sweet apricot bbq sauce, sauteed spinach, sharp, tangy feta cheese, and a garnish of onion and cilantro (I usually skip the garnish due to personal taste). The sweet and tangy combo is AMAZING. I highly suggest  it.   You might, also, want to give their onion rings a try. I'm not a huge fan of onion rings, but Switch makes some darn good ones.   Did you think I wouldn't comment on their drinks? To be honest, I'm not a huge fan of Switch's drinks. I always have to upgrade my alcohol selection and ask for less syrup in order to avoid Hangover City. When I do order a beverage, I tend to go with a Drunken Italian Soda.   If you're looking for a nice lunch or dinner spot that isn't too hard on the pocket book, give Switch a try. Their affordable, and creative meals will make you make that Switch!

4buC_37aQjfahsEtijfomQ.text: Switch is my favourite lunch place within walkiing distance of my office job. Of course it's good for all other meals as well but I try to stay away from the office when I don't have to be there.  Can someone say ambiance please? Aaaaahmbiance... This place is beautiful day and night. The ocean blue calming effect just consumes you when you walk in. Have a seat by the windows for the best food photos. Or have a seat toward the center of the restaurant for a more intimate/cozy feel.   Service here is alwasy amazing! The servers are alway pleasant, smiley, and patient when you're undecided!   Lettuce wraps are amazing. I've had them with both the lamb and the chicken. My favourites are tied at first; Buffalo Bleu Chicken and Spicy Bleu Burger. Yes, I love bleu cheese. All the burgers are really good though. I love them. Really.  Eat here. If you are thinking about it and you haven't or even if you have and you just want to basque in the deliciousness. You can trust me. I love good food.

fxFk6U63cphOuZY8iZqJDQ.text: Excellent food, nice outdoor patio and our waiter, Dante, was awesome! I had a lamb special which was great followed by the blueberry and white chocolate bread pudding for desert. I highly recommend both! We went during happy hour for which they have a pretty good drink menu with some tasty, unique choices. We will definitely be going back.

RDf6HmCi57krB0qUHS90yQ.text: Switch was pretty cool. The house cabernet was very tasty. My friend and I shared the Apricot BBQ Feta chicken sandwich and that was to die for! The side salad had a very strange tasting house dressing/vinaigrette drizzled on top. I would choose a different side next time but definitely worth a second visit. The service was fine, my companion was a bit disenchanted before I arrived due to the fact the server seemed completely shocked she was waiting to meet someone....odd but will give it another whirl.

Rks071UrzUzvGpEIhw2Tdg.text: This place is awesome...really great atmosphere.  I've only been here twice (in the evenings) but both times it's been relatively quiet, not super crowded.  Definitely an intimate environment.  Dimly lit.  The outdoor seating area looks cozy, though we've never actually sat out there.  Inside, there's a long bar with stools on either side that works well for large groups.  The vibe is relaxed, urban cool.  Staff is friendly, attentive, and welcoming.    I feel like a bit of a fraud writing reviews for restaurants because it seems I rarely actually order food...but all my friends have been super pleased with their orders.  The happy hour pricing is really good, I want to say there are appetizers for, like, $3?  I had a delicious drink special there, it had mint in it.  Not all that strong, but certainly tasty.    As mentioned in another review, it can be difficult to find this place if you're a first-timer.  Parking is around back and you can enter the restaurant by walking through the outdoor seating area to the rear entrance, which feels strange.  But once inside, you should find that a host is stationed right there to greet you.  Switch is a new fave when we venture downtown...check it out, for sure!    (PS, be sure to check in through Yelp when you're there to get $10 off your next bill of $50 or more.  Yay for that!)

2Q6uRHku0DzwRU2L0XCFRw.text: This restaurant was a great location and destination. It is easily accessible by the rail. The mood is very casual and relaxed and the service was pleasant. The tejano Burger was just amazing and filling. They also have great cocktails and decent beer. The choice of beer is not that extensive but the ones they had were good. All said and done, I would do it again for sure.

jIalwHqqekhDKKx3LsFvRw.text: Excellent food and wonderful atmosphere!  I had the spartan pita and the person I was with had the french dip sandwich.  The food was very creatively put together and very fresh.  I would have given it 5 stars...except that the service was unusually slow.  Will definitely return to check out some of the other dishes!

okRCWH_WkzpWbo98SZ_z-A.text: Based on the great reviews, we decided to try eating here while we were in town visiting.  For a Friday night at 7:30 I was skeptical that they weren't super busy, but we really enjoyed the food.  The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating to requests.  I had the cobb salad and it was OUTSTANDING!!!  If you are a salad lover who wants tons of stuff on their cobb.... go this route.

jmv0fMuS9EwRQkYkXm2lWA.text: Excellent Sunday brunch- we met here for a family get together and had a great experience! Good food, great indoor environment- quiet enough for conversation and everyone enjoyed their food.

oj-Z4bdGP0NYPKJp8d7QCg.text: I had lunch there yesterday and was very impressed.  Great atmosphere, good service and a perfect lunch.  Solid recommendation from a client.

sKdXgtJtEubp2x6UhQ0ruQ.text: So I decided to get takeout from this spot for lunch today, since I've pretty much eaten at everywhere else witihin a 5 mile vicinity of my house. What a greal lunch I had, let me just say. I called in my takeout order about 1045, and they were able to get the order in right away!  I went with the Buffalo Bleu Chicken Sandwich. ( I was going to go for the Lobster roll, but the guy that answered the phone told me that it was a mix that they ordered and had the Krabstick...eww). My sandwich was shaved chicken with buffalo sauce, field greens. Aioli, tons of blue cheese on an awesome roll. It comes with a caesar salad, and I shelled out the extra 2 bones for an additional side of  Mac and Cheese. The sandwich was perfect, exactly how a sandwich should be! The meat was cooked perfectly, there was tonnnnns of blue cheese and the bread will be the reason I don' t have a six pack haha    The Mac and Cheese was also super good, I almost decided to jsut eat that and half of my sammy. It wasn't all gooey like some mac and cheese, which I prefer. It was made with penne and was just what I was looking for.   I didn't eat the caesar salad, I was too full. Wifey will polish off the salad and the rest of the mac tonight while I'm at school. I ended up shelling out 15 bucks with tip!  What  a deal, for teh amount of food and the quality I got. Looking forward to going back with the wife for drinks and apps. I now have a new favorite spot in Cen-Pho!!!

2AV-aP10Vxv5DW9PBQZ4fA.text: Muffin and I got to Switch after about 8 hours travelling and though we weren't famished, we were definitely ready for something delicious. We were recommended this place by someone at the hotel (she even repeated it after I informed her we were kind of foodies and really wanted something great.) We were a little worried about how large and diverse the menu was, though in hind-sight we were mistaken. We started with Crispy Risotto Croquettes, the day's flavor was Lemon Asparagus. Lightly breaded with a Lemon Garlic Aioli. Creamy soft inside. We were well on our way in to a great meal. Then a couple of sandwiches. Muffin was hankering for a burger, so she went with the Cowboy Burger. Well balanced, little tang from the BBQ sauce, burger cooked perfectly. I went with the Southern Dump Truck. Chicken Thighs, homemade pickles, vidalia onion jam and more. It was either going to be really good or really bad. Again my fears were misplaced. What a great blend of flavors and textures. About the only disappointment was the side of Mac and Cheese. It seemed like a slight upgrade from velveeta shells and cheese. We were curious as to why the same person who made pickles from scratch had decided on such a simple Mac and Cheese. That's when we discovered (from talking to our friendly server) that the real way to experience the dish was with Bacon or chicken and then Baked (that is there Entree version). Now it all made sense.  All in all, a great meal in which you could taste the chef's desire to serve up delicious food prepared with care/

F1e38CCPeoFkwz30Rijf5w.text: Love this place. I was just in town on a business trip and happen to stumble upon it (thanks goodness for Yelp). It was great! Everything was so fresh and they use quality ingredients. The portions are large and it is very reasonably priced. I will definitely come back if ever I find myself in Phoenix again!

eo66OCx-tQtMYfYdkOb3Xg.text: This is our neighborhood restaurant.  Whenever I want Margarita Sunrise and desserts, I went to Switch. I never disappoint.

1EqzcUiTMBYAMGG8EAEX1g.text: I really like Switch. The crowd was a nice mix of people which is something I look for in a restaurant. We each started with a side Caesar salad which had an abundance of cheese, it was the best Caesar I've ever had. I ordered the mac & cheese with lobster & crab, it was so cheesy and delicious. I paid extra for the seafood, but they seemed a little skimpy with it. My hubby ordered some spicy burger, don't think he'd get it again.  We were seated promptly and received our food quickly. We will be back and next time I'll save room for dessert.

nUvac2WsW0d5ZycNyShrPQ.text: We had the crispy Brie to start and it was heavenly! The pork special my husband ordered was delicious and my Amsterdam pasta was fresh and amazing! Our waiter did a perfect job letting us have a conversation with each other but also making sure we had everything we needed! Great meal

173zWemBKCniy5_qK1HEvw.text: Love this place!  I've been here for brunch, lunch, happy hour, and dinner.  Great menu selections, awesome specials, friendly service, classy simple ambiance, fantastic wine and cocktails.  I especially like the  screwdriver and cape cod $3 carafes they offer on Saturday and Sunday mornings. I've tried many items from their menu and have never been disappointed.  The reason I did not give 5 stars is because my most recent visit: Met a group of 5+ friends & we were told that we'd have to dine outside on the patio due to the large number in our party and no tables available inside. I understand that it was a weekday/lunch hour, however it was hot.  Nonetheless, all my previous visits to Switch have been fun, budget friendly & an enjoyable culinary experience! Like them on Facebook to keep up with all their specials!

V1EW5S_8fRMtL7g2ntQyiQ.text: I was excited to try Switch based on the reviews. I enjoy wine and was hoping to find a new wine bar to frequent. A friend and I went on a Friday during happy hour. The decor is very nice and they have a small outside patio. Being it a wine bar I decided to try the house red wine on happy hour. The server said he wouldn't recommend that. He said it compares to the wine at the bottom shelf at the grocery store. I thought this was weird because a place advertising itself as a wine bar I would expect high quality. He suggested tempranillo.  It was ok. I also tried the malbec. It was ok. We ordered the brie appetiser. Dissapointing. It was breaded and fried. We also tried lobster crab pastry. It was ok. Needless to say there is nothing that interests me in returning.  If you are in the area go to Corduroy next door! Better wine for sure.

2ByRT7Fv-Ms5c8_V0Go5qQ.text: Switch, the sister to FEZ and Ticoz, does not disappoint.  I've tried a few things on the menu, but keep returning to the chicken with pesto risotto.  Yum!  Everything about this place is trendy but comforting.  Great drinks, great desserts, love the patio!  My only concern is that service has been really spotty.  Sometime great, sometime very very poor.  I'm not sure whether the servers are overbooked or what.  Luckily, I had a few drinks and enjoyed the extra time with my friends.

3XGKoJkQeHnTkl_BB8Kd6Q.text: I regularly visit Phoenix and stay in a hotel a few blocks away. As soon as I ate at Switch it became my go-to restaurant--as in, I have lunch or dinner here every day! Don't miss the lamb lettuce wraps, which are usually enough for a full meal. Staff is friendly and attentive, and the ambience is cool and mellow at the same time.

85evDlT1CgLE9oslWwPzPg.text: I've grown to like Switch more and more.  Conveniently located right off the light rail (Central and Virginia), it makes a good spot for a weekend dinner or brunch.  I've never been let down by the food at Switch... standouts include the baked crab and lobster appetizer and the apricot-BBQ-feta chicken sandwich.  I lament about the drinks.  Maybe I've not ordered the right thing, but the few times I've had their drink specials, I can't help but notice they are pre-made and unfortunately taste accordingly.    Service is spot on 4 out of 5 visits and I like the atmosphere, so I'll be back again and again.

9LnX3OIy48IIpmoVztwu4Q.text: The food, wine and service here was soooooo good - we came back 2 nights in a row.   The appetizers are amazing.  The Risotto Balls and Asian Beef Tacos are faves and the hummus plate is enough for 3 people to munch on while waiting for your main course.  Main course - I tasted everyone's food at the table and they were all winners ...so it's hard to pick a fave.

aaUF3HijWlmkNKgdw192sA.text: I have been there twice now, once for just drinks, and once for food and drinks. Food was excellent, nice large portions, but not crazy. Staff was friendly and attentive. I like the fact that I can eat there at 10:30pm when most other places are closed!! I can't wait to try the patio some night, it was just a bit too cold for me at 10:30pm, even though they had outdoor heaters.  Definitely making this a regular stop for me.

KXQfEfrFLTh4iuo_vSiTZw.text: This place is awesome, we went there tonight with our two kids 8 and 3 and was surprise it wasn't as crowded because it was Labor Day. We were greeted by Zimms; our waiter and he was very nice. We ordered our drinks and ordered a dessert first which was the bread pudding YUM!, it was phenomenal. For our entrees we order the Switch and Cowboy burgers with wedges/sweet potatoes combine along with the Spinach Bacon Salad. Both burgers we huge and very juicy, the fries very good, and the salad as well. The burgers come with a side Caesar salad as well. We didn't even have to ask for extra plates or the condiments for the fries, our waiter immediately had that taken care of. Zimms took care of us very well and he was such an amazing waiter to wait on us, we didn't even have to ask for our check it was like he read our minds and gave it to us right after..Overall, great food and awesome, awesome service. We will definitely be back! From our family of 4 we give you 8 thumbs up

ll8iS9emwBy6p7bjYbBvbw.text: I met some girlfriends for a midweek lunch last week.  I peeked at their menu prior to going and was really looking forward to the Lobster Roll.  The description was mouth watering----the actual meal was bland at best.  It tasted like artificial crab meat and mayo.  I would have loved to send it back but our waitress was MIA most of the meal.  My girlfriends didn't have the time to wait for her to come back and extend our lunch hour.    I will say that the bread was to die for, it was the only perk to the whole meal.    Also, our waitress took FOREVER to bring our bill.  Once she gave it to us, it took even longer to bring back our cards.  For a restaurant in a busy downtown area, I would have expected faster service knowing that the majority of the patrons were here on a lunch break.  If a friend suggests this place again, I may go.  However, I'll keep looking around the area for a regular lunch spot.

MHW0r76UZxSKfSJJt0K3CQ.text: I'm very disappointed for the first time with Switch.  The lettuce wraps were loaded with cabbage and very little chicken.  The feta cheese, tomato and cucumber salad wasn't all that great either.  Sorry Switch, not happy with tonight's food outcome.

6nsH8TLOl4RC-UjcwxS8lQ.text: We were in town to visit a friend who was dancing in the opera Carmen and she suggested Switch after the performance.  It was easy to locate as the restaurant is a straight shot up N. Central from the downtown area.  Seemingly situated behind some plain buildings on N. Central and with parking at the rear, we wouldn't have found it without help.  My Margarita Sunrise was great and I had lucked out because it was Happy Hour.  The others ordered the Sangria and gave them a thumbs up also.   My dinner consisted of the mac and cheese with smoked turkey, and it turned out perfect with not too much cheese but with a thin crust and lots of good flavor.  The field salad was mainly spinach and was very good for a side salad.  When we first came in you couldn't tell if it was a bar or a bar serving food or a restaurant with a bar.  It is a bit dark but comfortable and not too noisy at the time.  Service was on slow side to begin but improved once the initial order was taken.  Would I come back here?   Yep, the next time back in town we will return and at Happy Hour, of course.

K_hqMMv57hBGcix7T9NmkA.text: It's hard to believe it's been almost four years since I wrote my first review of Switch. Since then, I've probably been to Switch 25+ times, largely because I now live a few blocks away but also because it's a consistently reliable place for a meal, drinks or both.   Some of my Switch favorites:  *The Mozzarella and Chop Salads - unlike some other local restaurants that will go unnamed, Switch's salads aren't all overly sweet (I am so sick of strawberries and candied walnuts!). These two, in particular, are hearty but still have feel light and fresh. Even the salad that does have the fresh fruit and candied nuts (the House) does a little differently, with fresh blackberries and raspberries and delicious fried onion straws.  *The two seafood appetizers (Lobster/Crab Puffs and the Sesame Shrimp) - the first is rich and really satisfying with a light drink and the shrimp are very fresh and flavorful with an Asian kick.  *The veggie burger - so delicious. We were surprised to find out the veggie burger wasn't made in house because it certainly tastes like it is. It's very filling and doesn't fall apart like most, but still isn't overly formed or artificial.  *Amsterdam Pasta - this is a little heavier than I normally order, but they do a great job making the sauce creamy without overwhelming. Extra points for the truffle oil :) *Cheap-ass brunch carafes - while the size of the carafes has reduced in the past few months, you still can't beat $3 Bloody Mary carafes (serve about 3) and $6 mimosa carafes. How many lazy Sunday afternoons have I spent downing 2 (or 3) of these delicious concoctions.   Some of the improvable aspects of the experience:  *The brunch service experience - while I understand it must be frustrating to serve super cheap carafes, they're on the menu and people are there at your restaurant, instead of somewhere else in CenPho with almost-as-cheap drinks. So suck it up and don't act like I'm some cheapo or that I can't make a request simply because I'm paying a small amount for booze. Last time I went, I asked for a glass with a salted rim with my Bloody Mary carafe and was refused. Another time, my friend asked for pineapple juice in the Cape Cod carafe and got a lot of attitude about "changing something that's already cheap." Even if he were charged extra (which is fine), the server could have just said that and made the whole thing a lot less awkward.  *The overly-sweet specialty drinks - most of their daily drink specials are really sugary, with tons of grenadine and syrups. I wouldn't mind seeing just a good old vodka soda every now and then.  *The martinis - I've ordered a dirty martini a few times there and I never will again. Must be the olive juice?  *The brunch food menu - It's quite small and has few vegetarian options. Could definitely be expanded.   I definitely won't stop going to Switch, especially since it's so close, and I've had so many great experiences there, but I'd like to see them invest a little time in fixing some of the cons.

WR4X6HhlkkmeMw7OCwFNfg.text: 2pm Lunch on friday afternoon.  Food was tasteless. completely tasteless. We added about half the salt shaker. The lobster seafood crepe was greasy, creamy and tasteless..with yellow carrots on the side that were tasteless.  Also had a wrap that was nothing to write home about.  Maybe the chef had gone home, but we were pretty disappointed.

B72KLt_2aQV04tTleoMgzw.text: Go at 11:30 for lunch- parking is a breeze and easy to get a seat.  But they won't seat you unless your entire party is there, even if all but 4 tables in the entire place are unoccupied.  There were more people waiting for the rest of their parties than actually sitting in the restaurant.  It annoyed me until half-way through my lunch I saw the entire place was packed and there were people waiting to be seated.  Smart move on their part.    My sandwich: Chicken & Proscuitto- deeelish! It was a big boy.  I had it with fries and ate it all, why oh why did I eat it all?  It's filling and large and I felt in charge after I snarfed it all down.  Our server was quick and friendly, she filled our teas even thought the carafe sat on our table- I loved this by the way.  I can't get enough iced tea these days.  I will be back and I can't wait.

lcu_sYtmVlcOMRUt--m5RA.text: Wow...I don't even know where to start.  (The beginning...that's usually a good place)  So, the little lady and I had just finished up with yoga, and Switch was in the very near vicinity,  so we figured it'd be a good choice.  Wrong.  We were greeted in a somewhat timely fashion and seated.  Then we waited for a while...and then a little more.  The hostess was wiping off a nearby table and asked if we had been helped yet, and when we said no, she went to find our server.  Apparently he didn't know we were his table.  Ok, it's happened to me before, I'm willing to forgive.  Our server, Chris, came over and we ordered our food and drinks.  He came back with our bevs and then he didn't stop by again until food came out, meanwhile we had pushed both of our empty water glasses and my empty coffee mug to the end of the table...hoping that he would get the hint.  Nope.  Then the food came and he finally asked if we wanted more to drink.  He dropped off water and coffee and was gone until the END of our meal (which wasn't even good).  Was this a joke?  He comes over and says "So, how is everything guys?" My woman replied with "I've had better, can we please get the check?" and he didn't even ask what was wrong.  He brought the check and we were going to split it down the middle, and he said they were having system issues and couldn't split it.  Fine, one card...just get us the eff outta here!  When he brought the card back he literally tossed it on the table and told us to have a good day as he was walking away.  Yeah, where's the manager?  I told the manager all about our sucky experience and our even suckier server.  I was given some excuse that their computer systems were down due to a hacking of sorts and blah blah blah...give me a break.  I understand things running a bit slow due to a computer problem, but NEVER coming to check on our meal and us having to ask a different server to please get us condiments and then to not even acknowledge when we tell you we've had better...that's not a computer issue.  That's a server who doesn't care about good business and doesn't know how to do his job.    We were given a comp card for the next time we come in, but really I doubt that will happen.   It's a shame, because I really do love supporting local gay businesses.  But they make it so damn hard with their declining service and mediocre food.  Switch, our relationship must come to an end, because when it comes down to it...it's not me, it's you.

ZMCHZXDUCwZs_auAYt-6Uw.text: My meal consisted of the caiparinha cocktail, hummus appetizer, and switch house salad. All were excellent! The cocktail and hummus were special priced this evening, which is why I chose those items, and I was VERY happy with my selection. Everything tasted great, and the portions were very plentiful. Next time I'm in Phoenix, I'll definitely hit this place up again.

F1ozTTSYidmbZj7amg8LGg.text: All I had was lunch here, but hot dang it was a good lunch! I had the Jalisco Chicken Panini with a Caesar salad and every bit of it was very tasty. My friend had some of dat cheesy mac & cheese, I thought it was pretty good and I don't even like mac & cheese! Other then that, you know i got places to be! So we were in and out in under an hour and it's all good!

rbHdtIzLHOz3pCNTrU5A2Q.text: We have been wanting to check this place out for a few months now, and since we love to come to Phoenix for our date night we decided it was time to check out Switch.  We really liked it, the place, the food, the ambiance, was great.  Aaron was our server, very nice guy.  I had a glass of Malbec with my Apricot BBQ feta chicken panini, delicious and the thick potato wedges were awesome, it hit the spot.  My husband had the Jalisco Chicken Panini, another winner.  He also had the Caipirinhas, they were really good.  Next time I am having a couple of those. Can't wait to check it out for brunch.

MY0mdGc_JqytNmHRj0lsKw.text: Came here on a weekend evening to grab a bite and some needed beverages. We ordered a bottle of wine and started out with their app special, the fried green tomatoes.  This was def the best part of the meal.  They were pretty yummy.  I had the seafood crepes as my entree and wasn't expecting and didn't like the cream sauce.  It was too heavy.  My husband had a turkey panini of some sort which was pretty good but you can't really go wrong with a sandwich.  I wasn't super impressed with the food or the ambience so not sure if I'll be back.

jMq1ph9rx3J6Hpyp2987zw.text: I really dig this place. They have really great nightly specials. I can't get over their Monday Burger Night!! Try the House Switch burger. It rocks.

qzfs14KoAJ3Orv9qkU61-g.text: 3.5 stars for the food, 2 stars for the service.  Got the bruschetta appetizer which was tasty (although heavy on the cheese).  For entrees we got a salad, chicken with pesto risotto, and salmon - all of which tasted really good!  There are lots of vegetarian options on the menu, but when I tried to modify them to be vegan (ie: no cheese, no mayo, no cream) the server told me the dishes wouldn't taste good and discouraged me from getting them.  For dessert we got the "big cookie" (half-baked cookie dough baked into the dish with ice cream on top) and the brownie with coffee ice cream, carmel and pretzels.  The brownie dish was way better but both of were pretty good.  The service, on the other hand, was AWFUL.  Took our order fairly quickly, but only after we had finished the appetizer did our server come out and ask us to clarify something about the order, so obvi he hand't even put it in yet.  Our empty plates sat in front of us for WAY too long, my to go box never came so I had to stare at a plate of chicken while eating my brownie dessert!  And of course it took forever to have him pick up and process our check.  Even though the food was good, it's not good enough to make me come back here and endure the painful service.

eS6TV5M9PXoXIlW1ebh7dQ.text: Oh Switch.  I want to give you 5 stars.  I really do.  You're close, your food is fairly good, your drinks are hefty, and your 2 dollar bloodies are quickly becoming a weekly excursion for me.  Your service on the other hand......So hit or miss.  There is one server there who is always great.  Usually by the time I am seated she brings me my Makers on the rocks.    Who doesn't love that?  Other times however, I get other servers.  Usually they are a bit confused and looking lost.    Drinks are strong food is fair and I live close.  4 stars it is.

_3sXFEEFS96iWgtp0JhugA.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant yet! First time here and I must say Switch did not disappoint. The food was amazing and the service was awesome as well. I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. First time here and I must say Switch did not disappoint. If your new to the area or just want to try something new try Switch.

pKmdZ0TE4tKGz8xBzRUZvw.text: Love fried chicken? Well, look no further. The Switch is one of the best places downtown Phoenix to go for finger licking good fried chicken. Yummy!

4_JyhKWzAPvt5Ob1U2dm9Q.text: Nice Place!! Comfort food, what isnt to like right???  I got the Fried Chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies...I misread the description and only got white meat...kinda wish I got one of each...it was very good and "fluffy"...  Server was awesome and attentive.  I would come back!

OHjOyica2-gKjQH1LH83Lw.text: Another great meal here at Switch. We had a friendly and attentive waitress that pointed out brunch specials and was on top of our drinks the entire time. I ordered the green chili Benedict and it was delicious, creamy and so flavorful. I enjoyed how much Pork they were able to pile on and the hollandaise was perfect. My husband tried the breakfast mac and cheese and added bacon, he also enjoyed his but found that it had a lot of breadcrumbs and because of the way the dish was served it was difficult to mix them in the rest of the dish so he got mouthfuls if it at the beginning of he meal. We had a hard Arnold partner and tequila sunrise, both very good and a great deal for brunch time carafes. We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast mac and cheese add bacon
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burrito

EiTk67NYllvvw0lyuBHByA.text: Awesome food and service once again.  Our girl Gena is awesome server.  We had buttermilk chicken, twisted friends, Caesar salad, chicken soup, Benedict's & special brunch of the day along with mimosa carafes and Bloody Mary carafe.    All uber yummy.   Great atmosphere.    Must go to place while in Phoenix art district.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xWRFDcwzkojJGiTsfzClAw.text: Visiting Phoenix from Ohio. I stayed across the street from Switch. Looked over their menu online and once I saw the Brie wedge I knew I had to try this place out. I was not disappointed. I sat at the bar, when I walked in Cavs Game 6 was on the tv so it was an easy choice. The restaurant has an inviting modern atmosphere. I was greeted by the bartender, who was very welcoming, easy to talk to and makes a great Old Fashioned. The Chef brought out fresh, house made Pork Rinds with house seasoning. If this was the only thing I ate at Switch, I would have been more than satisfied.   I started my meal with the Brie wedge. If you are a fan of baked Brie, as I am, you owe it to yourself to try this dish. It comes out golden brown and with a perfectly crisp outside. The wedge is topped with thin slices of Granny Smith apple, walnuts and a habanero shallot honey that is good enough to drink. Fresh sliced strawberries and thin sliced bread, toasted to perfection, finished out this plate. This dish was delicious. The creaminess of the Brie, the crunch of the crust and sweetness honey are perfectly balanced with the late kick of heat from the habanero.   Moving on to my main dish. On special tonight was a 6oz Bison Burger, pressed out diner style, with American cheese, lettuce, tomato, chopped red onion, pickle and house made secret sauce on a toasted bun. This burger can be best described as Chef Jason's passion on a plate. The flavors in this burger are second to none. The bison was juicy and beautifully seasoned. Such an amazing burger.   Overall I would say experience at Switch was first class all the way. From the service to the food and the restaurant itself, this place is top notch. Great atmosphere, great food and great, friendly service.   Chef Jason, thank you for taking the time to sit and talk with me tonight. It is moments like that that are why I love eating at local places when I travel.   Switch is a must try. I know I will be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jiJpLYMQMlXzGnjSCYY_rg.text: First time at this place and wasn't disappointed. Appetizers on point...check. We had the special risotto croquettes, their pretzels, pork bites and Thai tacos. I can't choose which I liked the best. The drinks were delicious, go with the blueberry cosmo. And the entrees, my friends had the shrimp & grits...amazing. I got the steak, so perfectly cooked. Menu is priced a bit more than your average restaurant, but if you're willing, definitely drop the cash. I WILL be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aFZ6PzhbajvCf-yH2FndlQ.text: Great hidden gem.  The food was mouth watering, excellent drinks and great service.  I ordered the shrimp and grits.  Very flavorful.  Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NZOi6aT_rfuyme_YeKuASw.text: Excellent food every time! This place has never failed me. The food and service is always excellent with a cool atmosphere. I have brought family from out of town, coworkers, business clients and friends here and all have rave reviews. Do yourself a favor and whatever the daily special is, get it regardless if it's lunch or dinner. We went last night before the Shania Twain concert and we got right in since it's a couple miles away from the venue it's not over packed. We had the little neck clams and pretzel appetizers to start. We ordered the special which was a sweet potato gnocchi and an amazing sauce with asparagus and mushrooms (I'm not a vegetarian but with food like this I would be)and the sangria salad with grilled chicken. So damn good!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iTRteIMEqvuFAMOrLtcQtQ.text: We were here a couple of weeks ago and had a great experience. We had no reservation but luckily we got in early enough to get one of the last unreserved tables! Service was excellent, very informative, friendly and attentive to detail. We shared the fried green tomatoes (OMG!), baked brie, split an order of their Tuesday fish and chips special and ended with the bread pudding. All the apps and the entree were incredible, their french fries are to die for. Bread pudding was slightly disappointing but I think it may have been "nuked" in the micro so some of it was pretty tough but the flavor was good. Had to work later so I didn't have any cocktails but they looked wonderful also. Adorable patio and cool bathrooms, loved the ambiance and will definitely return. The entire staff was just fantastic!

95p_SgFfxiWeC-7DsqD_ZQ.text: We visited Switch last week on a Sunday afternoon.   When we arrived, the restaurant was empty except for a larger (loud, drunk) party at a hightop table and another couple in the corner. We entered through the patio out back, and sort of wandered around looking for a host or a sign to seat ourselves.  Once seated, I had to ask for the brunch menu, as there was only 15 minutes left to order off of it (which I was reminded 2 separate times over the course of 2 minutes.)  I ended up ordering off the lunch menu to make things easier; the brunch selections were limited and a bit uninspired anyway. I chose correctly, because our lunches were fantastic.  My boyfriend ordered the Very Berry Turkey sandwich and basically hasn't shut up about it since. (Later in the week we traveled to New Orleans and stopped at a well-known sandwich place, and in describing how his meal was, he just ended up complaining that it wasn't as good as the one he got at Switch.) He ordered the street corn as his side, and upon seeing it was worried it would be too rich and creamy. After eating it, he dedicated a full five minutes to waxing poetic about how great it was.   I had the switch burger and it was crazy good. To be honest, I swapped out the Canadian bacon for regular bacon, and it was unbelievable. The goat cheese, the fig, everything. Super juicy and huge.   We left feeling very gluttonous and very satisfied.

oChjbo1lAzqu6sdPS1QDYw.text: Came here for my company holiday party. The server was very responsive and attentive. The food was very good...I got the chicken....and reasonably priced. Save room for the cheese cake. It's amazing!!

wywnkho54DWn1ihkD97sFA.text: Horrible drinks and food. Customer service / wait staff were extremely slow and unprofessional. The restaurant was not even busy. The wine tasted old and the drinks were watered down. The manger never asked us if there was anything they could do to make our dining experience a successful one. I would not recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine was old. Glasses were dirty.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Empty and still received slow horrible service.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Manager must have been too busy to assist us since they were super busy. lol. I do not recommend this establishment.

_ZKPQX7XIAXtuQlQW7JJZQ.text: Wow, this is not the same Switch we ate at 5 years ago! Well, it's in the same spot,  same name, but that's about it. I liked the old Switch, but we Loved the new one:  Apparently there was a change of ownership a while back, and they doubled the size of the place. Gone is the hipster vibe with the tattooed and ear-spooled wait staff. Gone are the plastic menus. Also gone are the reasonable prices, but the food is even better than I recall. Ditto for the drinks.  Had a honey butter old fashioned. Heresy,  I know,  but the flavors just made me smile.  For entrees we had a salad and the buttermilk fried chicken.  That boneless chicken was accompanied  by an incredible garlic mash, a veg mix that was unusual and delicious and a white gravy that was anything but ordinary. The flavors just knocked me out.  Note to chef : give the chicken a minute less in the deep fryer, 'kay?  They seem to be aiming for the lunchtime business crowd, judging by the folks around us, and the fact that I felt a bit underdressed after a morning of sightseeing. A few of those business types must have been on expense accounts, given that with drinks, dinner, tax and tip, the bill was pushing 90 bucks. To be fair, they did offer many cheaper lunch options, but I had to try the chicken.   Expensive,  not really, given the quality.   Our waitress,  who seemed to be the oral historian of the place, was sweet as pie.   We"'ll be back the next time we're visiting the Heard Museum which is just down the street.  But next time I'll wear a collared shirt and leave the hoodie in the car..

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemon sponge cake with strawberries. Simple and delicious.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buttermilk fried chicken. Comfort food redefined.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Honey Butter Old Fashioned- crazy, but delicious.

ZFvVVLYA9kbbQZWnc88VYg.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a while and wanted to try it out. I came here on a Friday with a friend of mine. It wasn't very packed at all for a Friday night.   I started with the Coconut Margarita which was absolutely delicious! I really enjoyed it! For my entree, I ordered the Pesto Risotto and added chicken. I thought it was good but just a bit too saucy. It was a good portion because I almost finished the entire thing. lol.   I thought the service was a bit on the slow side, especially since the restaurant wasn't that busy. If you check in you get $5 off of $40 on your bill. They also have a cute outdoor patio. I think I'd prefer coming here for their happy hour instead of dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken pesto risotto
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut margarita

TL-QxyQ0hbjpUmA6ClnUyQ.text: AMAZING food and drinks!! The blackberry mojito and Creole shrimp and grits are my favorite!! Just make sure that Dan is your waiter and bartender because he is amazing and made us laugh so much!! Love him!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kuIPg_48yMRPj0tAziLLIA.text: This restaurant is located on Central Ave but the entrance and parking is in the back; Next to Durant's. The patio entrance is super cute with patio tables and hanging lights. Would imagine the lite up patio pretty for evening patio drinks.   We were greeted and sat right away. Cute roomy booths and some high top tables closer to the long bar.   We ordered brunch and lunch & these portions are huge! Had I know I would have shared. I started with a Cesar salad and it was so creamy and delicious. This place makes all their dressings from scratch.   My friend got the green chili benedict. She said it was full of flavor but needed more green chili. The breakfast potatoes are tossed in some Cajun seasoning and it was yummy!   I got the Asian BBQ chicken sandwich. Huge sandwich! I only ate half and took the rest home. The flavor was a sweet more watery bbq sauce, not thick like a regular bbq restaurant. Still very flavorful with the feta and aioli.   Over all a good experience. The prices are a little expensive but for the portion makes sense.   Check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bbq Asian sammie
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chili Benedict
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch &amp; lunch

8aRnZ6_mPdqf30O_MeVl0g.text: Awesome service.  Cheap brunch drinks. Great overall.  Was quiet but gave us more attention from the server.

oi5gEz5f5mbrShacCddkzQ.text: This might be a great spot for date night. This place gave off a relaxed concealed atmosphere for a more private dinner. The waiter was super friendly and helpful and my Jalisco panini was huge in portion and  delicious, accompanied by a side of  their awesome dragon sauce. I would come here again on a day I want to stay away from crowds and noise and still get good food and good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalisco Chicken Panini
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor Seating

wJ05DzxcGxlYFIC-mTzY1g.text: Disclaimer: I didn't eat.  But during brunch a carafe of mimosa is 50% off and that's wonderful.  Service was really good.  WiFi was free and strong so I had my drinks and did my work!

TeXPRL1_EE1kt4n_VgCgPA.text: This is the third time that we have eaten at Switch and the first time we took family. We were greeted with a smile and seated immediately. Dina waited on us and Loni checked on the group throughout our meal. The food was AMAZING!!! Highly recommend the Apricot chicken sandwich, but I will say that you can't go wrong with any of the food!

_doIYWvkUEdLd-LLAhDopw.text: Unbelievably rude service. I came here on a Sunday with two friends and we were the first people in the restaurant. We waited at the front for a while and the servers were too busy chatting with each other to acknowledge us so we sat ourselves. Once our server realized we had sat ourselves she had the audacity to tell us to in a very condescending tone to "wait for the hostess in the future". Again, we were the only people there. Do you really think you can be that rude to people when they sit down and expect them to stay?  We got up and left, and I will not return. Switch has been officially scratched off my list of Sunday brunches for this ridiculous behavior and I will be sure to tell anyone who suggests we visit in the future.

RS_wUdn9vugFv_2fZEjB7w.text: Fun vibe, quick service, delicious food. I haven't tried a lot of their menu yet, so I can't bump to five stars. But, I know that their corn pudding  and mac and cheese are definitely delicious. No pictures--i ate the food too fast!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Savory corn bread pudding. I love this.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and risotto.  Grilled herb chicken, sundried tomato and pesto risotto, rosemary tomato broth, pine nuts, asparagus
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vodka Paloma absolut red ruby vodka, grapefruit juice, lime, on the rocks. Delicious.

ooaTF9tcUdjkQhuQ3_akhQ.text: The food was acceptable... every bit as good as Arby's. The price was way out of line for the quality of food.  The service was ridiculously bad. When we first walked in, the snippy guy at the Host station told us it would be 10 minutes before he could seat us. He said this as we were looking out over a half-empty restaurant. When we asked him why we would have to wait when the place was half empty, he replied that he was just doing his job, then sashayed away.  When we did finally get to a table (place was still half empty), we waited quite a while to get a waiter. Waited an additional long time to get the food, then our waiter disappeared. We finished our meal without drink refills, and 20 minutes after we finished our meal, we had to ask another server to find ours for us to get the check. He showed up 5 minutes later and dropped off the check, then came back 10 minutes later to get our card to pay.  As we tried to leave after paying, the main walkway was blocked by another server talking to people at a table. When we tried to go past him, he moved into our path more. So we had to turn around and go around the perimeter of the restaurant to get to the door that started out 10 feet from us.  Ultimately, I won't go back. The staff was rude... every single one of them that we interacted with. Food was only okay, and overpriced.

Bu8XKjqxWdLHlDSLyKabbA.text: It started with our great waitress Devita and carried on to the food. We had the pretzel sticks and cheese which actually had more cheese than needed. For dinner I had the mac and cheese and the husband had the chicken pot pie. Both were excellent and highly recommended.

nfdMlEnagrolrvRAEABErA.text: I really enjoy the Jalisco Chicken Panini. I order it regularly and it is consistently delicious. I just wish they served more fries! They are great too!

arYjsEbUOyeKp-URIXMP8Q.text: Delicious delicious restaurant/bar! Very cool vibe, first off. Medium, casual lighting, very clean, chic, and modern. Staff were very friendly. Bartender Jeremy the bomb! He knows the menu and knows his drinks. And the food is PHENOMENAL!! Had the lobster/crab puffs, hummus, chicken board, and shared the catfish po'boy and dump truck with my buddy.
