drNcs1Px9IVZKRzBcv65VA.text: Excellent service. Delicious food.  Highly recommend the burgers and chicken.  Thanks for making our birthdays special.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southern dump truck
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PYHc6Fw2twMklMUsNWyiuw.text: So disappointed with Switch.  My friend and I both ordered their steak.  I could have ordered a steak from ihop and it probably would be better quality.  Meat was rough, chewy,  ordered medium. But it was a bloody mess, Super Chopped Salad a huge let down as well. I mean our steak was $24.00, I wasn't expecting too much. But at least make it flavorful. Carrots were under cooked (@ least for my preference).  On a positive note , Sever was nice and attentive.  Definitely thumbs down on our meal . $120.00 down the drain.

GycY1OlpWsuSE-dcINXjRg.text: Flying pig appetizer was delicious, and with six pieces it was a good deal, nice app for three people to share.  The street corn (off the cob) was the star of the show!  Lot's of good flavors.  The menu says the meatloaf is made with beef and pork, but judging from the taste and the texture, I'd say it's made of mostly bread. Dry around the edges, not good. Sweet potato puree accompaniment was just overly-sweet mush.   Sandwiches at neighboring tables looked good.  I think the waiter may have been in training, but he needs a lot more training.  Several times he walked past our table without noticing that our glasses were empty or our checks and credit cards were hanging off the edge of the table waiting for him to run the cards.  When we finally managed to flag him down to refill our waters and iced teas, he took way all three glasses, filled them, and brought them back (the same glasses) and distributed them incorrectly.

oO77oFX1qyL3hbeHbhNVLQ.text: This place is amazing! It was so good I decided to re create their appetizer of fried bre cheese at my house for a party. It was a hit! The environment is always nice and we have never had a bad waitress. We went for my husband's birthday and we loved it!

8udzn8urcPc_KL6_DY7JtQ.text: I'm rating this place a 4. It's a solid 4. I've been meaning to eat here for years, and finally today had a business lunch. My coworker had the switch burger, and he's a burger rater, and he said it was good. My chopped salad was a 3 stars, way too much greens, hard to eat, and not as good as normal chopped salads. The french dips, which was the special of the day, looked amazing.  They did not list any gluten fee bread on menu, and I didn't ask as any place that has it tends to state it on menu. It's a clean place with good service. I'd love to have a cocktail there, and I just may soon.

H6uPW14-71S0EQExgDDrPQ.text: I will start by saying I think it's a tad pricey. $19 for chicken and collard greens and $13 for a Brie app. With that said, I will totally be ordering the Sweet Tea Chicken again. I thought it was amazing! Any self respected southerner is out of their mind if they don't order this dish. I'm from the south and this tasted like an elevated southern dish. I sat at the bar and Dan is the man! Great conversation.  The restaurant is dim lit so I apologize for the dark pic but it gives you an idea of what the dish looks like. You won't be sorry. I'm glad I ordered that.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IphBZovFGrdq9eEM3qtGGw.text: When I was pregnant last year, I had the oddest cravings for chicken Caeser salads!  Like I wanted to eat one everyday, and I almost did, thanks to Switch and their delightful lunch waitstaff.  They definitely knew me by the end of the pregnancy and even remembered the baby's name after he was born (haha)!  There twist fries are huge.  If you get a side of fries, always order the aioli dipping sauce.  My husband is a big fan of the burgers and the sweet tea chicken.  My one complaint is that the drinks are kind of spendy...but if you get water, you don't have anything to worry about!  I've only been here for lunch, never dinner.  The lunch service is pretty fast overall, unless there's big groups.

6eqyJ_LrnatqysJ_SmoJDg.text: Delightful environment. Excellent service. Totally hooked on the blueberry vodka cosmo. Loved my tea smoked bourbon glazed chicken but was sad that I had to skip the masa dumplings. Hence my only note to gluten-sensitive folks: my niece who made the reservation asked about gluten-free options on the phone and was told everything on the menu could be made gluten-free. This is totally not True. I didn't want a salad and that left only two items that could be served without gluten. I'm used to this challenge and it's not a big problem but please don't be misled by bad phone advice... btw my niece LOVED her goat cheese burger and awesome home fries. We shared the strawberry gelato even though we were very fully. Looking forward to a return visit next time I'm in town.

6-F71-TghGZlcODDJO8XKg.text: Visited this place the other night and I must say the food was damn good.  I don't know if it was because we were the only ones in the restaurant but the food was good.  I had the chicken pot pie on the recommendation of the waiter and was not disappointed.   Kids had Mac-cheese and they loved it.  The 2 years could not stop eating it.  Also, their lemonade was damn good.  If I lived in the Phoenix area, I would check out this place more.

edLH2qeIDcBfArsx78ZQ0A.text: I've been wanting to try the South Bound Dump Truck chicken sammie for a while, and I was in the area and decided to finally go. While it was tasty, it's just too big to enjoy. Sandwiches that are 3 inches high aren't my thing. Eating shouldn't feel like a job. The twisted fries were delicious, though. I'd go back and try other things.

Mawow766xlrftIH91ogPjg.text: Love the atmosphere, staff, food, and definitely the drinks. Brunch carafes are a steal! Always go for the mimosa carafe and the very berry turkey. Also love the brunch burger- get the cheese sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very berry turkey

ycHi2WOxXN0aAClgTKjwvQ.text: Pricey but nice setting and excellent service. Food was better than most. We ordered the fried green tomatoes for an app, my husband got the catfish po'boy and I got the mac and cheese. I ordered a hot tea and the waitress brought out a box of teas to choose from.

KFqpegddssH8pkUfdal0jA.text: I went to Switch after a drs appointment that I had today. I googled what was in the area and this place looked great! I wasn't disappointed! Fantastic!! It was Tuesday so they have a fish and chip special with a side of coleslaw and house made tarter. Best fish and chips I have ever had!! And I lived in Alaska for a number of years!! The hostess greeted me warmly and seated me at a nice little booth. My server and a new server greeted me and suggested the fish and chips and a lovely Red Blend. Quite happy! I will definitely be back!! Thank you for a great experience you guys!!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d1-q6nc6huPWy0zOU4AeZw.text: Holy crap this place is good. Came here with 3 others and everyone loved their dishes and we will all be coming back soon! Get the dump truck!

n-Hg4gbPELme19BGKhLu7A.text: OMG! The best brunch place! Probably the only time I've ever sat and ate every bite without adding any salt or pepper! Little slice of the south finally in Arizona makes this Bama girl a huge fan! My boyfriend hates grits but he loved the cheese grits! He got the Green Chili Benedict and I had the French Toast...both so good we ended up sharing! Mimosas were delicious! We are so full but must take every last bite home! Atmosphere is casual and relaxed. Service was attentive. I'm coming back to try the fried green tomatoes very soon! Worth the trip from wherever you are in the valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Toast
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese grits &amp; Green Chili Benedict

mqS80A_6iAxGFZXJEYJq9w.text: What a joke, came in for a glass of wine  the worst pour I've ever had .. I won't be back.. oh and they charge 13 for a glass of Malbec..I could of bought the entire  bottle  for 10 dollars ..don't bother coming in the food  sucks too.

sBika2wBXG0zjbx63ZxWKw.text: Their drinks, their food, and their service - all 5 stars.  I have only ever been for brunch, but each time has been delicious. Their brunch specials are always unique and delightful and the service has always been good.  The decor is quite a bit like Ticoz, which is nice, and it's really an atmosphere where any sort of attire is acceptable. Wear your jeans and cute tank, or your LBD and sky-high heels, you'll fit in either way.

8x4qngYaxthxTmWHVwgyRg.text: Went for dinner as we had found this place once before. Service and food were very good. One complaint. We ordered an appetizer which was very good and ordered a salad and a pasta dish for the two of us. We mentioned we would share. When the food it came it was split in two portions which I thought was a nice touch. Little did I know when the bill came we were charged on both the salad and pasta a split charge. I noticed later the menu said there was a split charge. I didn't ask for it to be split and the restaurant wasn't busy. I get it if we had ordered one dish.  Customer service should have been the reason to take care of diners. To bad left a poor taste at the end of a nice dinner.

Xos106jYCzM6nxq460Nt2Q.text: I am up in the air on this restaurant. I'm not sure whether I love it or hate it. The food was pretty good and after my date raving about the Apricot BBQ Feta Chicken sandwich he was going to have - I figured it had to be good.  I got the macaroni and cheese with Lobster & crab. I'm very particular about my mac n' cheese and this seemed meh. I know..how can someone screw up mac n' cheese? But you can and they did. Sorry - date, I ate most of it and it was pretty good but I could hardly taste the crab and lobster and if you are paying for it then I better see HUNKS of it and taste it.  The appetizer of New Zealand Lamb Loin was delicious and cooked perfectly as I hardly ever like lamb.  My sangria was delish and I would go back for some apps and the sangria - any day.

1v3z1wcUUnvlkdj_oojIWQ.text: I finally went to Switch the other night and had an overall perfect experience.   Atmosphere: Clean simple with a little blue in the lighting.   Food: A great menu which everything looks good, so it's hard to decide what to get. You can practically point to something randomly and get something good.  Service:  Perfect and friendly, great gay wait staff which I think tends to be better at customer service in general.  Very friendly and fun, our waiter was warm and welcoming and very attentive. (don't know if the whole staff is gay, don't care, but the owners of the restaurant owns a few more in town and they are all great and tend to be gay staffed but I never had the gay bar feel or not welcome as a straight guy.)  Location: On central downtown Phoenix between Durant's and Schlotzsky's.  Price: Great for the quality of food. ($7-$14)  Room for improvements: Didn't get water by default, which I think all places in AZ should offer, although once we requested water, it was great tasting and kept filled.  Beer list is crappy, Bud, Miller, Coors, come on I know gays aren't beer pros but let's make a little more effort in that area.   My date says her Grey Goose and tonics were stiff like a good drink should be. I did find a few micro brews on the list, but not top choices.  What we ate: Lobster Crab Puffs, Great and the Chicken BBQ Feta sandwich, Exquisite. Greek side salads were the perfect size and creamy.  I will return anytime I can and highly recommend this place. I can't wait to work through the menu since it was hard to decide.

aQ8DZUWf1vsR1IdW3aPUHQ.text: Friendly staff.  Asked for rare burger came out medium well was hard and dry. Bun was a bit stale which did not help. Side Caesar was ok slightly bland. Onion rings greasy needed a different dipping sauce rather than catsup. Waiter did offer to have burger replaced but never been a fan of sending food back to the kitchen.  Based upon the menu descriptions and prices expected better.  Just very average.  Good ice cream for desert, but at $3.95 a scoop it better be!!!

AR4MgIsljYMKiXTVJ_mz1Q.text: My last encounter with Switch was not a very pleasant. I decided to go in for lunch but it didn't happen. Our server forgot about our table for 10 minutes, so we left.  I did take-out for a while, sticking to the Sangria salad and lobster crab puffs.  I finally decided to dine in again last night, taking two of my sisters with me to celebrate a birthday.  We were seated quickly by a gentleman who ended up being our server. He read our table pretty well, letting us talk and checking up every once in a while.  The food as always is amazing. My sisters were very satisfied with the Eastport Roll and the burchetta. I had the lobster & crab puffs, it's hard to say no especially with the sauce that goes with it.  Our server, Robert I believe, when mentioning dessert we asked if they had cheesecake. They had something better that I cannot remember what it was.  Robert made our night enjoyable and will definitely be going back soon.

OyZY8himSf0-R8f2Zvxgiw.text: I've never had a bad meal here. I've also never had a great meal here.  Its sort of that "yea, its good, that'll work" sort of place when we run out of ideas of where to go eat.  One of the things that this joint needs to work on is its service. We were there last night, and it was sort of a debacle when it came to the waiter here. We ordered onion rings as an appetizer. Appetizers, as a matter of tradition, need to come out before the main meal. As Eric Cartman so eloquently put it "Well Starvin Marvin, these are appetizers. This is what you wat before you eat, appetizers make you more hungry. You don't need those!"  And if Eric Cartman says it, its gospel truth!  So the appetizers came out with the main meal. This is poor form. Mind you this was a double down of poor form as it took them 30 minutes to get this out to us. The guy left carafes of water and tea (our drinks respectively) so he could avoid coming back to the table. It wasn't busy, it wasn't packed to the hilt, it wasn't slammed. Yet, he barely came to the table.  Then when we went to leave, it took him another 20 minutes to come out with the box and the check. This is pretty unacceptable, and it cost Switch a star.  Nothing to write home about here other than lack luster service and decent food. There are better choices nearby, but if you're without other plans this place does the trick in a pinch.  Overall, it gets a "eh, ok" from me.

9PttlvBHYsGKEmHaEICQvA.text: Good friend in town took me here right from the airport for a nice lunch/brunch; not too crowded, nice relaxed crowd.  Pretty extensive sandwich menu--tried the apricot chicken sandwich; the sauce and onions overwhelmed the apricot but it was still very nice for an airplane starved boy.  Just right amount of food and lovely mimosas....only on vacation!    Sat outside on the small porch against the row of leather pillows, there is a big place inside but that was empty.

0nc0zjy_XoMTgNcVZwbYrw.text: Go here. Now. Sunday breakfast was superb. I've never had eggs Bennie with such spot-on poached eggs (everything was runny but not like your nose you dope fiends). The melted Swiss cheese was a very nice addition as well.   Oh yeah. How about a carafe of Bloody Mary for three ducats.   Trust me, it's in both your best interest and mine to just make it happen.   Will be back for sure.

sgoY1VPKChfzaWS0DNCoKw.text: I stopped in to give them a heads up that me and some friends would be stopping by the next day on a bike ride (2pm on a Saturday), to which the manager flat out said we were not welcome. Huge blow and they missed out. I'd say better luck next time, but you not only lost me as a customer, but you lost all of our business that day and for the future.

XBJmIGVuIaiuno0i16UFWQ.text: This review is based on one visit for brunch, on Saturday, Sept 18th.   The space is really nice - a good-sized patio; a pretty cool, modern interior and a very clean bathroom (a huge sign, as any Kitchen Confidential fan is aware).   The service was eh. Our server did not seem very excited or even mildly enthused. She gave us the normal menu, then went outside to do... I'm not sure what. I had to go to the counter and ask if there was a breakfast menu. Our order was taken promptly, and our meals were ready rather quickly. Our water glasses were kept full. This was not a surprise, as we were the only two people in here at 10 am. People started to show as we finished, around 11 am or so.   So then food... ummm I'm pretty sure there was NOTHING low-fat about my meal. I went for the chef's special, which was:   - four smoky grilled shrimp (cooked just right, huge plus in my book) - white cheddar grits (cooked PERFECTLY, with a really creamy, cheesy flavor that did not overwhelm the rest of the dish) - andouille gravy (like a reddish roux, with chunks of the sausage, kind of heavy but very nice!) - and an over-easy egg topping the grits and gravy.   Oh... My... LORD.   I ate maybe half of this; it was so, so rich. The egg was so perfect, with its runny golden yolk adding even more richness to the grits and gravy. The shrimp seemed a bit out of place, but the smokiness of them went well with the sausage flavor.   This dish is my official brunch favorite, as long as I resist finishing the plate, and get a good retail meander in, afterwards.   My gal pal (haha, I know, how annoying to say) had the breakfast burrito. It looked pretty standard, but she said it was really good on flavor. She ate half of it, also finishing with an overfull belly.   Our bill (2 entrees, water), including tip, came to $21. Not bad, in my opinion.

WCs64nz9NLlMyWaVqzDbdQ.text: To say something nice, the atmosphere was good.  The problem is the FOOD!  I had the worst burger I have ever had in a restaurant in my life!  It was not a fluke.  Everyone in our group had burgers and several people picked at them and did not finish them.  The burger meat was painfully dry.  A friend had warned me that their food wasn't that good, but I figured it's hard to mess up a burger.  I was wrong!  I won't be eating here ever again.

LwKqVwCyF7pFf5R684Mhmg.text: I went on my lunch break, around 11:45, the place is less than half full and there is a 20 minutes wait. First you hear a 10 minute wait. Then they tell the person right behind you it will be a 20 minutes wait. When you ask the hostesss what is the real wait time is he gets really rude.  This is the second time I gone on my lunch break and they are less than half full and already have a wait.  It doesn't seem like they can handle the downtown lunch crowd. So if you are going on your lunch break don't waste your time.  The food is good but only if you have a two hour lunch break.

AXnXtNUuW4pQcjbrQ--dVw.text: So being a creature of habit, I usually have 1 or 2 dishes at fav restaurants that I order every time.  This is the first restaurant where I have found over 10 items on the menu I'd like to try.  We've been there 3 or 4 times now and I've tried something different every time (go me!).    *  The veggie burger had quite a bit of flavor and was well worth giving up the beef for the night. *  The mac and cheese is pretty good, sometimes cold, but that doesnt' stop me from ordering it each time we eat there.  *  The turkey and brie gallette was also good,  but gets a little rich towards the end. *  The jalisco sandwich is a fav!  A little messy but soooo worth it! *  Just recently I tried a bite of the baked lobster and crab puffs - will be ordering that one again! *  The bruschetta - there are two different kinds on the plate.  The first time we ordered this there was waaaay too much balsamic on the "caprese" but the ham & artichoke spread bruschetta was absolutely to die for, melt in your mouth, must have every time you go there good.  The second time we tried the bruschetta, both flavors were very good.  I've had bites of other things on the menu as well and I have no complaints.  The menu is extremely eclectic and it's worth multiple trips.

Xsw2R8P_pOTTSIdDVK9Y6g.text: I have been back a few more times since I last reviewed Switch. I will say that the service has definitely improved! Also, try the drunken Italian sodas. They're great.   I think it is a great place to go if you are looking to have drinks.

TaTeL9FU5A_BncYfBv1BqA.text: Oh. My. Yum.  I have been wanting to visit Switch for some time now, and today was such a special treat. I scheduled a work-related meeting at Switch for an early lunch (11 am - which is right when they open during the week). Parking was a breeze (although, I have SEEN the lot about an hour later, and it's not pretty).   I was planning on getting a salad because I had heard they have a great caprese-style salad, but I was wooed by the stuffed crepes. Rosted Mushroom Crepes, to be exact. Check it out: roasted thyme, mushrooms and onion with parmesan and bechamel. Hands down, I got the award for the most amazing plate at the table.   Seriously, my meal was hands-down fantastic. I cannot wait to go back to Switch.

rrJnQER3-ykaUEhW66HY1w.text: I've been to Switch many many times so it is about time I give them a review!  I was in recently and once again experienced great service, prompt attention and tasty food and drinks.  I particularly enjoy their $4 carafes (only during weekends I believe) of mimosas and bloody mary's.  At any other restaurant, it is usually $4 for one drink, let alone an entire carafe.  I have ordered the Breakfast Mac n Cheese dish which is loaded with scrambled eggs, bacon, chives and of course mac & cheese.  It is delicious and very thick and  rich.  I am also a fan of the Chilaquiles breakfast dish, which I was hesitant to try at first because Switch isnt a Mexican food resturant and I was afraid it would not be up to par, but decided to go for it anyhow.  The dish was absolutley delicious and probably better than my own mothers home-made chilaquiles.  Also a must try is their green chile crepes.  The green chile sauce is spicy and the crepes delicately envelope cheese and their mix of spices is incredible.  Switch is a great place to try if you are in the downtown Phx area.  You will defintely find something you will like on their menu.  I believe they also have daily specials.

qNti71IggjcZ5skHpAW3jw.text: Delicious! Great atmosphere. Most of the wait staff & bartenders are friendly, however one or two servers have given me a bit of a "diva" attitude at times. Luckily those times were few and far between, and usually the great food makes up for it. Try their house and cowboy burgers, the mac & cheese, and their out-of-this-world lobster roll.

_hdnCDwS6qv4BV63phQ5Nw.text: prob should get 3 1/2 stars.  Liked.. not loved.  Very classy looking place. Swankie. Kind of place to bring a date, or your woman, or sig other, or.. whatever you got.  Liked the wall with the pillows.  Nice lighting. This place would get a 5 for the looks.  Food was ok.  Again liked not loved.  Had Calamari that was good. I had a pork chop with apricot glaze that was very good. My womans pasta was great.  I can't explain why this place should not get at least 4 stars. The service was a little slow, but I could care less about that.  I will always take great food over service... but this place and the food and everything was just missing something. Not sure what, but for me at least... the "it" feeling of love I have with so many restaurants just wasn't there.

8-gebSvpE4T2bhNahaFq4A.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. I wish I lived closer to it so I could go more often. And I wish the sangria wasn't so good and so strong so that I could actually come here and be able to drive myself home. All of the food is amazing. I've never had anything that wasn't and I've been here countless times. One of my favorites is the Very Berry Turkey sandwich. It is so good. And the portions are huge so I always have half to eat the next day. The red Sangria is also amazing, and again the serving size is incredibly generous. Prices are reasonable, atmosphere is great, service is always wonderful and the food is awesome! I you haven't tried this place you are missing out and I feel sorry for you.

V624ten26K8NYS5IPmlJmg.text: If I could rate 2.5 stars, I would. I'll round up to 3 though. I really want to love this place.   Stopped in for a drink after dinner.  Loved the atmosphere - trendy but not pretentious. Great selection of drinks, and the menu looked good, even though we didn't eat. So impressed that I convinced my friends we HAD to go back for Sunday brunch.  Sunday brunch was less than impressive. Food was eh. Atmosphere was eh. Drinks were ok.   But I really want to like this place! So I came back a third time. This time I was by myself, and I definitely don't recommend coming here solo. The bartender was too busy to talk/ask recommendations/take the time to take my order. There's one TV, but it only visible to a few seats.   And the cliental is all over the place. Not a good spot for a 20/30 something to make new friends or strike up a conversation.  I'd say the average age on my third visit (Thursday happy hour/dinner crowd) was 45ish. My 28 year-old self definitely brought down the average.   I'll probably try this place another time. Because I really do want to like it. Good parking, good location, good drink prices. It's just good.

xIDNosaOCZyRKETvw2rFSw.text: Loved both the food and the service. And they are open til 11pm on weekends, which is nice. Easy to miss but worth the stop!

OdWWAarmeQsHdU5gg-klrw.text: Have tried close to 90% of the menu, have never been disappointed on anything that I have had!  Have introduced tons of my friends to  this place and they have quick to became regulars themselves.  You absolutely must try the switch burger!  All day drink specials, and a happy hour you can't beat!

z0LQsave8KfLSQtE6Za_5A.text: This has become my favorite brunch place to go with my girls. I have never had something bad from here! The breakfast mac and cheese is insanely good and so is the quiche.

W7m_Vi5ghDGxJBBYHsdZsA.text: Great weekend brunch spot. The food is consistent and they have awesome weekend specials that are always a nice surprise! The drink specials are even better-- daily drink deals and carafe specials on weekends. Definitely enjoy coming here for a carafe and breakfast!

886FeQxIeE3Hka0U_XezfQ.text: Cold coffee, cold eggs (I think they powdered or institutional eggs)  waited 40 minutes for eggs and bacon.    Our waitress never told us there were any specials...  we only found out spinach and mushroom crepes after we heard another waiter offering that special to his table.

voGWP_SMHzuChkyxdE5msg.text: I heard tons of positive reviews on this restaurant particularly their famous 'Switch burger' so I thought I'd give them a try.  Location & Aesthetics - Located in Phoenix and on my initial drive to the restaurant I sadly missed it even though the GPS said we had reached.  The facade of the restaurant looks unassuming and, in my opinion, the signage could've been a little better.   When I turned around, I didn't miss it the second time.  Apparently parking is in the rear and you can also choose to enter in the rear or in the front.  To me it was easier to enter in the rear as I parked there. Lots of parking when we arrived which was around 1630-1700 for dinner.  Our initial thoughts was we were going to be the only ones there as the parking lot was empty.  My advice, if you're going for dinner, get there early because as we were leaving, the parking lot was full with no spots left.  In fact, when we pulled out, another potential customer took our spot immediately. The restaurant itself is snazzy, chic, superbly clean, uncluttered, lots of space between tables/chairs, and well decorated.  One can chose to sit outside with what looked like comfortable chairs and tables, and even fans attached to the wall to keep folks cool.  We chose to sit inside where the A/C was on but wasn't blasting, just comfortable enough.  Menu - Well laid out, self-explanatory, and wasn't overwhelmingly 2-5 pages/leafs long.  Service - The staff was really nice, friendly, warm, welcoming, and accommodating.  Any questions (about the menu) were answered promptly.  Our waitress checked on us several times throughout the meal to ask if everything was good, asked about drinks/refills, and asked about our appetizers.    Food - For my drink, I ordered the sweet tea vodka lemonade which was positively addicting!  I wanted more but since I was the designated driver, one was where I drew the line. For appetizers we ordered the onion rings.  Initially we were told it was just going to be around 8 but instead was greeted with much more plus given 2 dips - ketchup and another whose name eludes me now.  The onion rings was hot, fresh, crunchy and very tasty with not too much batter surrounding the onion itself (not overly fried). For the main course, I ordered the 'Switch House Burger' which was out of this world.  The beef was well seasoned and cooked to perfection, mouth watering, and juicy, and cooked exactly how I asked -- medium-to-well done.  Many of the ingredients it contained balanced each other out, e.g., the tartness from the goat cheese was balanced by the Switch fig dressing; and the zesty taste of the Arugula was balanced out by the onion strings....everything was perfect!  The only reason they lost a star was because toward the end of the meal, we felt rushed as the waitress asked if we wanted to order any dessert, we declined, and immediately presented with us with the check.  Not a big deal in my book but the gesture was noticed by another in my party.  This place really some nice looking tasting items on their menu and, for me, it's definitely worth coming back to try some of them.

U4yJRtbwdqoSZJPSxLpI9Q.text: So I am a part of a June 2012 mommies group online.  There's a few of us that are located in Phoenix and we decided to all meet up for the first time and do a Mom's Night Out this past Friday evening.  Our original plan was to meet at Fuego, but instead we switched it to Switch.    We have a 7:30 reservation for 5 of us.  One of the mom's had something come up with her LO, so it ended up being just 4 of us.  We all arrived within minutes of each other - last one arriving at about 7:40 or so.  We're greeted and asked for our drink order - easy peasy.  That's where the decent customer service ended and turned into at best, mediocre.  Our drinks arrive and we're still looking over the menu (and chit chatting at the same time).  Our server, Angel (according to the Associate name on my receipt), came back a few times to take our dinner order...but we were still deciding on what we were going to get.  He tried to make recommendations to one of the gals, who is a picky eater, and we thought..okay..we'll get to order.  He left and didn't return to our table for at least 30 minutes.  He finally comes back and it had been so long that we had forgotten we hadn't ordered yet.    We order and our food arrives (3 of us order salads, and the other ordered a sandwich) about 15 minutes later - Time is now going on 9:00pm.  Our server disappears again for at least another 45 minutes.  He finally comes back and asks us if we want boxes.  We say no, and you'd think he'd already have the check ready.  Think again.  The time stamp on my bill states 10:07 pm.  The only good thing he did was he split the check for us based on Guests.    I had a Yelp Check-In offer, $10 off a bill of $50 or more.  Our bill after taxes was over $60.  We decided to not use the Check-In offer because we didn't want to confuse our server and end up waiting around for another 30-45 minutes.  We had tables around us come and go, but yet there we were still sitting and waiting.      We were there in total about 2 hours and 40 minutes - all for 3 salads, a sandwich, 2 glasses of wine, and an iced tea.    Friday Night Mommy Fellowship - Fantastic!  Food - Average.  Our Server Angel - Terrible!

-5VG1TBlZ0UzE7xBDIhZ1A.text: This is one of my favorite places for weekend brunch and happy hour, and when I have friends from out of state coming to visit, this is one of the places I bring them for lunch or dinner. The food here is excellent, as are the drinks. The servers are very friendly, the prices are very reasonable, and I enjoy the contemporary decor and the very casual vibe of the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious lamb!
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crustless morning quiche with Mornay sauce, potatoes, sauteed mushrooms and spinach.

V3nEderJN3p4G1wqE0CHnw.text: The place is next to an icon Durante. We were seated immediately.  Place is nicely  decorated.  We had thei r pastry appetizers  with lobster. It was nice and flaky but very small for the pice. We did like their onion rings. We tried their lobster  Mac which was a healthy  portion. . Service is always good but some of their dishes can be on the salty side

zpWsKa2_9owQTE3YUG2w8Q.text: Not very impressed. The water cups had finger prints in them. The water jugs were not clean and had food in them.  I was charged 23 dollars total for a burger and some fries. I was up charged for fries and was only given 5 fries total, which I feel is a complete rip off. I gave the waitress 40 dollars and only received 6 ones back. Switch has taken 10 of my dollars because the waitress could not do a simple subtraction of 40-23.61=16.39. They also did not give the cents back and just rounded it. I will NOT be returning back to this place after this visit. Awful.

h5I5eWpGcyKvdx25b-st1w.text: Excellent service.  Had the roasted cauliflower appetizer.  Half in buffalo sauce and half in barbeque sauce, very good.  Entree was fish and chips (potato wedges) which was crispy and flaky inside.  Nice comfortable dining experience.  Reasonable prices.  Server had a good knowledge of the menu and answered all of our questions.

6TYUk4Uo50BfeyRJJEy09w.text: We bumped into this restaurant while in Phoenix running errands. What a great find.  I can't decide what we liked best;  the service,  the atmosphere or the food.  Everything was perfect! ! We will definitely be coming back and bringing friends and family with us! ! We tried the Lobster Crepes and a side of Lobster Mac n Cheese. There were several items we wanted to choose and I would imagine they were just as good.  The bread pudding was incredible! ! If there was anything at all that might not be a 5, it would be the Lobster Mac n Cheese. It was excellent but not worth adding the lobster up charge. I believe the regular mac n cheese would be just as good.  The lobster was barely noticeable. But, other than that,  everything was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread Pudding,  Lobster Crepes,  Lobster Mac and cheese

LPz0z1GFp59a8h2KG0NQpg.text: Stay away if you have food allergies. I was served a regular bun after ordering a gluten-free bun, specifying that I had an allergy, and double checking after they brought me my food. The waiter Eric's first response was something along the lines of "it's already in your stomach, I can't take it out now - so what do you expect me to do?" Good luck with your attitude before you seriously injure or kill someone! I will never come back here.

gwUCJS1V6Kv2omph1IXsqA.text: A few of us came in for a drink after a meeting tonight and it wasn't a great experience. Our waitress, who said it was her last night spilled a tray of drinks on a couple of us along with breaking some glasses. I'm not upset with her and we didn't give her a hard time because shit happens but what was surprising is that when our bill came there was nothing discounted. I had wine on my skirt and when I got up to leave had a piece of glass in my shoe. Another girl had a big wine spot on her blouse. Our phones were wet and I have a very expensive bag that fortunately wasn't stained. I could not believe the bill when it came, no discount of any kind. It's a shame because I've been here several times and like the place but after tonight, never again.

9Uh0AN534EGk3a4dgauH7A.text: No early bird special?  How will Switch ever survive in a town where the old folks sleep before the sun sets!   (Story: Sunday night, every place in closed - literally, our three bookmarked Yelp spots in downtown.  What's up with that, PHX?  Luckily, Yelp pointed us to Switch off the beaten path north of downtown.)  Always get a seat at the back patio.  And don't be a pansy by asking to turn on the heat lamps - get an extra drink instead.  It's only Arizona "cold."  - $6 Red Sangria - Served in a tall highball glass.  The fruit blend was unique with apples, strawberries, and blueberries.  And of course, who doesn't love sangria?   (The abundant other cocktails were dirt cheap at $6-$9!)  - $12 Lobster and Seafood Crepe (3) - I didn't taste much of the crab and shrimp, but there was a lot of lobster.  Paired with the bechamel sauce, the crepes were a delicious, lighter fare.  The accompanying, seasonal long baby asparagus were fresh and tender.  - $11 Thai Braised Beef Tacos (4) - So much flavor in the tacos from the marinated beef and the sauce, although a bit drippy.  Five stars, and the extra sixth star is for subtly advertising on the drink menu that there are $4 Screwdriver & Bloody Mary carafes and $6 Mimosa carafes for weekend brunch.  Consider it a Yelp tip for when I come back.  Well played, sir.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster and Seafood Crepe (3) - With long, tender asparagus and a béchamel sauce.  Mostly lobster goodness.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai Braised Beef Tacos (4) - A little drippy, but good.

_cCjt9e5MijIF8bsQ84Fog.text: Came here for a birthday dinner. Just wanted to say Carlos and the entire Restaurant exceeded our expectations! From start to finish our server was extremely patient and accommodating with 6 VERY undecided gals. The food was spectacular, we each ordered something different and even ordered their shrimp appetizer special twice! Make sure to order the cornbread pudding, it needs to be a side for everything! We never felt rushed and everyone seemed happy to be there. The service and hospitality definitely Wowed not only me but all the guests including the Birthday Girl. Thank you so much for making the evening a pleasant and delicious experience!

Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp special-Amazing! Had it twice!

gr--DrrDI6760GQObHyevQ.text: Love this restaurant! Awesome vibe, good energy, wonderful waiters/waitresses. Came here for prom a few years back and remembered loving it. That's why I came back for my 20th birthday dinner here with a group of 15 friends.   Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. Had something simple like chicken fingers as an appetizer, shared the steak special (honestly I've had better elsewhere) but I won't complain it is what it is. Had the birthday dessert Pazookie and loved it as well as everyone else who took a bite! Only other thing I might add is that it was really hot inside. We told our waiter about it and he kindly told us that he agreed and alerted the manager. Also, they give a discount when you check in on yelp, which was pretty cool too.  I recommend Switch :)

bFQxMncz_zmMApGhnA2IvQ.text: We like their  lobster pastry  it was nice and fluffy.also tried their  fried chicken  which consisted  of chicken  breast it was  on the dry side . The sauce  was underwhelming.  The lobster mac and cheese  was good but the order came out late . Meal was spaced with ample  time . . They comp us desert. Service was a little  slow. We do like their  food

6welf9bDXMk1SxX3EE0-oQ.text: The French toast here is amazing. Blueberries and cinnamon and maybe the best French toast I've ever had. The service could be faster, especially when it came time to get the bill and pay.

X00Bl158lBlV82g9-GyGGA.text: OMG!  1st time here.  It' amazing & amazingly clean. Our young lady was fantastic for the amount of people we had (16) Very clean, extremely good food(pricey) well worth it. Plenty of parking in the back. Nice Patio we will be back

EUfV-LJCZpf4gzGdNxwUOw.text: Environment: Clean. Spacious.   Service: Server was actively engaged and suggesting different items on the menus. She checked in constantly which was great.   Food quality: the food were fantastic. The portion size was definitely larger than my expectation. For a person who eats a lot, it filled me up very well. Normal sized eater would likely have leftovers. With the quality of the food being amazing, it definitely makes you happy.   Price: The price of this restaurant is definitely on the higher end. Each entree is about $17+. But given the portion size, it's quite worth it. If you're worried about the cost, I recommend sharing a dish as the portion size would cover both of your stomach.   Overall: I'd definitely recommend this place to my friends and others. Give it a try and you won't regret it.

czcZpl2KQiMvRGvQIlPKNw.text: We found this place last year and had the bomb ass chicken pot pie ... then we refound it today!  What an amazing menu with great options and taste.  We friend the meatloaf and sweetcorn this time and it was just as amazing as the pot pie.  The staff is friendly, polite, accommodating and professional.  The second experience was as great as the first.  They even went above and beyond when a large party made our food take a little longer than usual.   We will be back to try a third menu item ... maybe the burgers! They looked super too.

CUHMFMgPB31PAYOwWBfWiQ.text: Had the chance to stop in to Switch recently. This is a very nice, laid-back establishment with an open feel. There's an intimate and cozy patio area in the back that looks to be a great spot to spend time. The menu consists of what might look to be, at first glance, a mixture of "bar food" type fare on a slightly upscale level consisting of items such as burgers, pretzel bites and fried chicken bites. But also to be found are Creole Shrimp & Grits, Prime Pub Steak, and Roasted Pork Pappardelle, to name a few. I opted for the Classic Burger and let me say, this is not just typical "bar food"; nicely presented with a choice of sides ( in my case the Twisted Fries which included sides of ketchup, a nice mustard sauce concoction and a mild but tangy white sauce for dipping ).  The drink menu is nicely varied with a decent selection of wines. There are also a number of hand crafted cocktails to choose from. I decided on the "Green Crush Margarita", which was pretty damed tasty. A good selection of craft beers is also there for your enjoyment.  Seating is spacious and includes a long high table for large groups as well as numerous booths. The bar is a great place to hang out as well (that's where I posted up).  Overall I don't think you'd go wrong spending some time at Switch. I know I'll be back. Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Crush Margarita.

tbJWuancgPduvf5c5Co59w.text: When we got there the host was clearly mad. He sat us and dropped the menus on the table and walked away so that was weird. The place itself is weird also it looks kind of like they tried to make a diner look nicer. The lights were a little too bright and it just didn't feel as nice as it looked online. Hard to put my finger on what was odd. But the food was amazing, huge potions and so yummy. Our server was also very attentive and we ended up having a great time here.

UwOb5tzNjPPcp1mo2024hw.text: Great lunch for our monthly team meeting. Easy free parking, modern open seating areas, excellent service and amazing food selections.   We had the crispy brie cheese wedge and flying pig appetizers. Both were unique and very tasty. The crispy brie cheese wedge had a panko breading with habanero honey,  berries, and crusty bread slices. The habanero was not overly hot. The favorite was the flying pig. That was mini pork wings with an apricott BBQ sauce, feta cheese, peanuts and celantro.  Everyone in our 5 person party had something different and all had rave reviews. I had the yard bird chicken sandwich with the apricott BBQ sauce, feta cheese, spinich, red onion served on a ciabatta roll with a large side salad. Took half of it home for another meal.  This one is a keeper for midown Phoenix. Prices were moderate but very reasonable given the quality of food and portion size. A well deserved 5 STARS!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Apricott BBQ Feta Spinich Sandwich &amp; Salad

tQzrigde31vaOqM1brSceQ.text: I ordered the South Bound Dump Truck (a fried chicken sandwhich) which has, "...onion jam, bacon, tomatoes, lettuce, tabasco maple mayo, crispy onion, pretzel bun" ($14). You get a side, I chose their twisty house fries, which is essentially between a potato wedge and a curly fry - it's a curly wedge. They have mac'n'cheese and other options to choose from. The sandwhich and fries were pretty good.   Inside you'll find a contemporary grayscale interior with pops of bright colors. I like the monochromatic feel, but others might not.  You can park in the shared lot 2601 on Central, Switch, and Durant's share.   They have a real lunch rush here so don't expect a quick lunch, they get pretty packed.

Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Restroom stalls were lovely (never thought I&#39;d say such a thing).

p4lv4kv4nawI6OdLYyAo8A.text: Wow superb service. The chef came out and gave every woman flowers for Mother's Day. Another patron jokingly mentioned bacon for her dog and the chef brought some out and hand fed the dog. Just a great experience with the service. The patio is so cute and inviting. The food was delicious and everyone enjoyed it. Plating was beautiful. We all enjoyed our brunch and didn't mind paying a little extra given the great enjoyable experience we had. I'll definitely be back for some wine  next time.

Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch menu

rUe5nZizrIOGnRY4mDJJIQ.text: You've got big portions at Switch to go along with big smiles from the staff, but when it came to the food I wasn't all that impressed.  Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  Switch is essentially a perfect work lunch spot. It's big a vibrant but not so much that you can't have a conversation, and while it gets busy during that lunch hour the service is great. Star.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  My very large portion of Roasted Pork Pappardelle came to $17.00, which wasn't unreasonable given the portion size. Star.   Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  This pasta dish was just okay. The wide noodle pasta itself was fine although didn't taste handmade, and while the pork and peripherals were flavorful the meat and the pasta just really didn't go particularly well together. The dish needed some sort of sauce to bring it all together. Single Star.   Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  Switch Restaurant is a-okay, but I'm not dying to go back anytime soon given the breadth of great spots in the area. No Star.

yRZVNb-14PoLXeGEj-OBrQ.text: Walked in for dinner at 8:33pm. Took the bartender until 8:36pm to greet me and give a menu....and tell me it's last call. At 8:36pm. They close at 9pm. They just lost my business. Guess they don't need the $$$ WOW.

ELSLswd0BqgjMz36ADz0WA.text: This started out a bit suspect but the owner and waitress that we finally got made up for the rocky start. I sat there and no one addressed me for a good 30-mins. Had I not been waiting on the rest of my party I would have left.  The manager FINALLY looked me in the eye when the rest of the party arrived. I still had to stare her down to get acknowledged tho. I swear I HATE being invisible when I'm spending my money in your establishment. ANYWAY the manager comped our drinks and the owner created a seasonal dish that was no longer on the menu. The food was delicious and the portions were adequate.   Very quaint spot but they could improve on greeting their customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tequila Sunrise
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon melt, potatoes, grilled asparagus and grapes
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Catfish Po&#39; Catfish Po&#39;Boy

TXeq2rSOHTdII2aX1YRoaA.text: Really liked this place! Had a large group and they were very accommodating. All the food we got was good! And huge portions too. Had a watermelon mule which was really yummy. Staff was nice and the ambiance was great for a group lunch. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Watermelon mule
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Clams!
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AfU9ZBJ573CK12zeRTRWlg.text: Enjoy switch this pkace is non pretentious and the food is great. The staff and the environent is inviting. I enjoy coming here abd would recommend to anyone wanting a good meal and to sit and chat

qSO5MyxxakSmHQLBaZ6dTQ.text: A delicious meal in the heart of midtown Phoenix.  We were greeted immediately at the door by Marcus who served us attentively.  The food was delicious and served quickly.  Try the twisted fries and the caprese sandwich!

isLmu5CSUxh1yvVA4y41KQ.text: Great ambience. I sat on the patio on a beautiful day. Music is a great mix of classics and current. Inside looked cozy. Great bar. I had the Thai tacos which are a must try! Messy but awesome mix of flavors. The super chop salad has a good variety of veggies and a delicious dressing. You have several protein options and 2 sizes are available for salads. Service was top notch. I used my yelp check in coupon and there were no issues. They were happy to apply the discount. Drinks here are great. I didn't expect much from a mule but it was watermelon based and spicy! So good. Porch swing tea based drink is great for a hot day. Will definitely be back to try more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai tacos are messy but amazing. Super chop is a good mix of yummy veggies and dressing goes great. You can add protein as well.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great drinks. Try the mule!
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Porch swing. If you like tea, try it!

lwnpIJ5G1c0pkoB0VjaLCQ.text: Really good service and nice ambience, perfect for hosting big groups- there's a large high table that can seat 20! The dump truck sammich had lots if ingredients but the flavors individually were not too spectacular (e.g. the fried chicken tasted only slightly salted, couldn't taste the maple, the onion jam was good). I got street corn as my side and my first bite with cheese was flavorful but the rest of the corn didn't have enough sauce. Others in my party got the spicy pork pasta, BBQ burger, clams in wine sauce, the tacos (heard they were really good), and the other sammiches. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. Overall good experience though!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U_kkvLfyH_R0SnjDPv4big.text: I've gone to Switch with a couple of friends, and I've also gone with a group of 10. Every time, I'm reminded how lucky I am to live so close to it.   My experiences, however, are limited to their brunch menu. The 3 Egg Breakfast, the Huevos Rancheros, and the Switch Benedict, have all been major successes.   But let's be honest, Switch's brunch special of all cocktail carafes being 50% is the main reason for this 5-star review! It's always cool when you get alcohol half off, but it's how tasty and refreshing they were that really made the difference. I've tried the mimosa and red sangria one, and the red sangria takes the cake! It has fresh fruit in it, and the perfect balance of "juiciness" and a "lit time".   Oh, the service has been flawless as well, obviously.

vsMj2NRHNQlamdxqgINzMA.text: Switch is one of my favorite restaurants. Went for brunch today to celebrate a friends birthday. Service and food were great, however very disappointed with the mimosas, which I found out is not made with real orange juice. That being said will not order again.

nU6v2IozDspSWNnBW1r69Q.text: I have been here twice.  Both times have been excellent experiences.  Both times I ordered the pecorino watermelon salad and shrimp and grits.  My spouse ordered the dump truck sandwich which was delicious.  I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. South Bound Dump Truck
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creole Shrimp and Grits

XEYUN0o-2eZI5cdAV8IDJQ.text: You won't go away hungry! Started with the pretzels...had no idea these things were so big! Super good though. Had a chicken Caesar salad. Also very good, and very big. After the pretzels there was no possible way I was going to finish that huge plate of goodness!  Wait staff seem really friendly and know their product, which I always appreciate. This is a good place and I'll be back when in Phoenix.

cYyppzgbDjG5-FjFp6Y0jQ.text: Good food, good service. I found this restaurant because it was near the hotel I am staying at and thought it would be something that myself and my teenager can enjoy. The menu is on the upscale side but my son found the triple cheese grilled cheese and really enjoyed it. The food was good and both of us had a great meal. Next time I'm in town I would visit again.

MW-UOc1DkYZ_5swZ9I33cw.text: Switch is awesome. The reviews are True. Really cool place. Was in town on business looking for something close to my hotel and lucked out with Switch. Staff is incredible. Every time I am in Phoenix I am coming here! Believe me on this one, its not on the menu so you have to ask for the Southwest Hanger Steak. Best thing I have ever eaten.

wdHkEkFmF7jFVhnH2B_sVg.text: I went here tonight with a g/f and got the house salad (delicious!) wine and creme brulee for dessert.  All of it was excellent.  Very cute atmosphere.  They had an interesting menu with other things I would love to check out.  I would definitely go back again.

8c0pVUiyS3H3LMl6S3YmGQ.text: As an city dweller, who has been going to Switch for over a year, I'm sorry to say, I'm NOT going back. Two back to back horrible customer service experiences do not make up for a great atmosphere or good food. Wait staff was rude and unfriendly, which doesn't make any sense for a downtown bar. Boo to that!

QA_wM4kI0_QO1EpIwMZY3g.text: Great happy hour! Our waiter Tim was by far one of the BEST waiters we've ever had. Highly recommend!

2F5rkYBCh5Ik16Jn4uk20w.text: Truffled Hangar Steak is AMAZING. Great service and awesome atmosphere!

68doAUKvzX39r2NfG6QkGQ.text: I love the foo, eat here about twice a month, and try to try something new every time I come in.  I have not been disappointed on the food front, yet, and have enjoyed everything immensely.  That being said, the service is spotty, at best.  One visit, the staff is great, the next, I'm having to flag down an employee to get my drinks or to order, etc.  And, on a couple of occasions, I swear there was one waiter for the entire restaurant.  I really love the food, but the staff needs to take better care of the customer.  Rudeness and condescension are not really important to make me think the food is fabulous, it just makes me think the staff is full of jackasses.  I have had some truly phenomenal wait staff, so this is a "not all the time" thing, but it should never really happen at all.  I will still come here for the food and atmosphere...lets just get our staff in order, eh?

9f_DPlgoQTWTUqweB9-0mA.text: Yay-a short walk off the light rail. Yay-decent drink specials and a nice happy hour. Yay-open till midnight for late night downtown noshing. Yay-service is almost always impeccable-with explainable lapses few and far between.  My only real "complaint" is they screwed with my favorite appetizer-the Apricot BBQ Chicken Skewers/Pops. The sauce is to die for-first they were flat grilled skewers-awesome. Then they rolled them up into a Popsicle looking piece of grilled chicken-OK, a little odd but still tasty. THEN...they breaded the chicken. Ewww. The best BBQ sauce on the planet can't save these things. I asked my server why tamper with perfection, and he said that most customers like it better.  Ah well-won't keep me from going there ever again. Maybe just less often.   Sell the Apricot BBQ sauce-you could make a fortune!

enDJ8oIgKIOCAIrekNd49A.text: This is my favorite restuarant in the valley.. The food is always delicious and Chef Jason is an awesome chef. Very friendly and accomodating.. The waiter Tim is awesome.. Best waiter we've ever had.  He knows what we like and automatically brings us our drinks. Their Carpese Ciabatta sandwich is the best ever.  Don't miss out on this awesome restuarant

zdCaDMDYopPEDDfbnae6rw.text: Four of us went here for dinner tonight. We all agreed that the food was decent. It wasn't bad by all means, but it wasn't amazing. The prices were pretty good. The portions were okay - I know most places here in America serve way too much food, but it felt kind of funny to finish a meal and still feel hungry (I almost never finish my entire meal). We probably won't be back unless someone else want to go there, but we definitely don't have anything against this place.

v_Ht60L300KUJ36ZkeGsaQ.text: I really like the atmosphere.  We started with the cheese and fruit plate that was on special.  It was really good sized and had a lot of variety.  The lobster and crab puffs were really delicious.  For dinner I had the grilled cheese sandwich which was quite delicious.  I can't remember what everyone else had but 3 out of 4 of us really enjoyed our food.    The negative, the service was really really slow.  For 4 people on a Wednesday night with not many people there it took almost 2 hours for our meal.  I really enjoyed myself but probably not going to become a regular staple for me.

e0mWH697dpbMwWrTU4sGdA.text: This is my happy place. When you're having a bad day, Switch is like the best friend who has a few Vicodin left over from knee surgery. It's an insta-chill sensation.  So many guilty pleasures here. The mac 'n cheese with lobster is a favorite, as is the Amsterdam pasta. The salads and huge list of sandwiches are likewise comforting on hot days. The galettes aren't usually special, but I'll still order them when the mood strikes.  The service is way above average, though sometimes the patio can feel like Siberia. But because this is a place where you'll want to relax all evening, that's okay.   Always ask about their recession special. Five dollars (I think) gets you a sandwich and salad. It can be hit-or miss, so I usually have a friend order something else and we split our plates.

y6TPVtOi8Hf5ShauGQnHGg.text: The waiter got the drink wrong: "up" means served strained without ice, not on the rocks, but I was happy about the mistake, The Salmon melted in my mouth and the bread pudding made me fat for hours, but was so worth it.  Great atmosphere and none of our plates were empty when taken away.  I would definitely go back.  Good service, great food, fun atmosphere.  Great flexible hours on a Sunday.  GO !

ubPP87PnhXUdayrh4RQUZg.text: Switch was pretty good. Nothing negative during my experience but nothing super amazing, either.  Everything was good, the patio was cute, our waiter was nice. Really A-OK! :) but not somewhere i would say "LETS GO TO SWITCH!!!! IM CRAVING IT!"   Here are my likes (i have no dislikes) - the specials, can't beat the price.  - the mac & cheese - our waiter (dusty) - patio - heater  all in all, i dig it. if someone wanted to go here i'd be up for it. also, i would recommend it as a place to go if you're wanting to eat a bit later since their kitchen is open til midnightish.

bb-ooxm4jxRGbnHNX89mDQ.text: I was in Switch last night with a couple of my friends and it was awesome!  I have been in before for lunch but have never been impressed enough to write a review.  The hostess was so nice as she sat us at our table.  Our server (Ramon was his name according to the check) was really friendly and had great biceps!! (ha ha).  He told us about the specials and was really helpful in deciding on wine ( one of my friends is a bit of a wine snob but she said his suggestion was spot on.)    The food was amazing.  Try the lettuce wraps they were fantastic.  I had the french dip and a glass of zin and they went together perfectly.  For dessert we had the bread pudding.  Yum!!  I will definitely be coming back here with my friends!!!

QPbvZJ2P0pPFqGjuHzm9sQ.text: I had the salmon and it was delicious.  The green beans were just the right degree of al dente and the potatoes were perfectly done.  My friend had the chicken and risotto and after a taste I wished I'd ordered it instead.  The pesto flavoring was out of this world.  The wine list was a bit limited but serviceable.  My only complaint would be the music.  Some of it was nice, "rat pack" background music but every once in a while it would move to this horrible techno nonsense which was very annoying.

qho36Yq1xmP048o-Xfculw.text: Switch has been my favorite restaurant for every and any meal since 2008 when I moved to Phoenix. Always have the best service (LOVE YOU DUSTY!) and the food has never been anything less than exceedingly delicious. It also is not expensive. My  menu favorites include the jalapeno and bacon clams (the bread is unreal), BLT sandwich, turkey and brie gallette and pretty much any of their weekend brunch specials. My only suggestion is that they start serving brunch 7 days a week!

sDksl-qywZRxw5dO5l2w0g.text: What can I say- beautiful staff, amazing ambiance and the food... oh man the food.  It's a total package at Switch.  Anytime a friend comes to town or just looking for a classy but relaxed joint for a business lunch or Happy Hour- Switch is my go-to.  Fantastic drink specials (though not too high-priced outside of HH either).  Burgers are ALWAYS cooked to perfection- and I like 'em bloody not burnt; so I know my meat.  And the mac'n'cheese- forget about it... or rather- Don't.  Perfect blend of cheeses and perfectly cooked noodles makes you dread having to wait for it too cool down before shoving in your gullet. Staff are always slammed- but attentive despite the rush.  Went here for New Years a couple years back and you better have that "Ball Dropper"- helluva drink and again- at a great cost.  I'll be going back for years to come I'm sure. See you there!

iAKg2GwdbagDJMJsNDYAVw.text: This is a tough one for me.  I've been to Switch several times and I'm really pretty torn.  I've experienced some pretty terrible service (both times on the patio) and I've only really loved one item on the menu.  I tried the Spartan Pita the first time I was there, and the last time I was there I got the pesto chicken sandwich.  Both were pretty average, especially for the price.  I recently took the boy here and he ordered a burger- he said it wasn't anything special.  Lately I've been having some beef envy (as I am very close to the one year no beef mark) and I had zero desire to take a bit out of this piece of cow.    I'm a huge fan of their seafood crepe because it is delicious.  I also am a fan of $1.99 brunch beverages.  I'm just a bit weary of heading over here on a groggy Sunday morning when I need things like water constantly.  I live way too close to not come back here often, and I'm hoping that other menu items and slightly more consistent service will make me feel less torn about Switch.

QM66iTJetQWqpgUmf3GaMQ.text: Food was very good. I had the Italian sodas with vodka and those were good as well. I would recommend this place to anyone. Atmosphere was nice and the servers were nice and attentive.

lCfOIS_9GbHKyDvVAaYOiw.text: Delicious food, great service, wonderful atmosphere! The staff is excellent! If you love iced tea, try their mango iced tea, it's too bomb! We had a fried Brie and habanero honey appetizer today that was too die for! We've been here multiple times and we will never stop going here!! Keep it up!

29WRky7oTDtXWtOhN35PNg.text: Friendly staff, eclectic menu and great location.

nnOPL-4uNJz9_FxAfy2H9Q.text: I love this place!  Food is amazing, drinks are good and music is great!  Try the Lilli's Chilaquiles, Yummy!! :D

R-gCN-cIQlKsT4eLkCp6tA.text: I am a bit behind lately....too much school and work for my liking so haven't been out as much.  I was craving the delicious chicken pot pie gallette last weekend, along with a hot toddie to stave off a cold.  Rolled in there about 3 with one of my besties and had the most delicious and comforting meals.  I grow more in love with this place every time I go and am digging the additions to the menu!

7V8tBi9EigxEEdxqLMnPLg.text: Not sure where I've been hiding out lately, but so glad I found Switch. My friends and I visited on a Saturday afternoon and sat outside on the patio. They do allow smoking, so be fore-warned about that. The only way we could tell our server was a newbie was that he had a pal shadowing him around and taking care that he was doing all he could to make our meal memorable. And it was! Our brunch - quiche of the day - was ridiculously delicious. I imagine they are all different, but this chicken, asparagus, chipotle, mushroom, spinach, and corn creation was amazingly flavorful. Mimosas were made from the freshest orange juice I have tasted in quite awhile. Two of us ordered the quiche and one of us ordered the breakfast special with beautifully poached eggs, crunchy baguettes, and a heaping pile of prosciutto. Great service, lovely ambience, good cocktails, and the food - wow, oh wow! Can't wait to visit again.

uJwYLy3gPM0tI9Dx2YJLtA.text: My husband heard good reviews from a business associate so we decided to  try Switch's Brunch.  My first impression of the actual restaurant was "bar like", basically dark walls and ceiling.  This always makes me feel like I am in a man cave sports bar, which is fine for evening, but for brunch? Not so much.  General decor was good.  The hostess was very pleasant and fortunately seated us near a window.  Our waiter was prompt and very nice.  It took us some time to browse the breakfast and lunch/dinner menus. Many items were intriguing and unusual, maybe even gimmicky, i.e. Eggs Benedict with provolone cheese .  I will say that I do have a problem with restaurants that have too many dishes on their menu.  It has been my experience that no dish is really done well.    My husband decided to have the Amsterdam Pasta with grilled chicken and I decided to try the Eggs Benedict (without the provolone).  Both dishes were highly recommended by our waiter.    First, I will say that my husband's pasta was good.  I thought the flavors were nice and pasta was cooked well.  Grilled, unseasoned, sliced chicken breast was the cliche'd bar style addition to the entree.  Overall, my husband would give it a 3.     Now, the Eggs Benedict, sigh, I will first premise my review on the fact that I am a huge fan of this dish and when it is done well, it is heavenly.  Unfortunately, I was not a big fan of Switch's Benedict.  First, one of my pet peeves with some restaurants is that they lack the understanding that a truly great Eggs Benedict must have a well made hollandaise.  The sauce must also be made from scratch: eggs yolks, melted butter and lemon juice (basic).  It can be made in a blender in under a few minutes!  Unfortunately many chain restaurants and hotels use pre-made sauce or powder base that is really vile.  I did ask the waiter when I ordered if the Hollandaise was made from scratch.  He answered, "Yes".   Unfortunately the moment the plate was placed in front of me, I knew my worst fear was realized!  "IMPOSTER"!!!!!!  The sauce was some weird concoction (an odd sweetness too), the eggs were undercooked (whites a little runny) and the English muffin was NOT toasted.  I did not complain.  I ate one egg and left the other.  I give this dish 1 star.   Overall, we had a pleasant experience (good staff and of course good company with the hubby) with mediocre food.    Not sure if I will selectively come back but if my husband and I are in the area....

--4yS1qzrZI9xoH_2Z-sCA.text: After a grueling hike on Saturday mornings I like to indulge with breakfast.  Switch's Fried Toast is a common item for such a craving.  It's very delicious and flavorful, crispy on the outside and soggy in the inside.  I think between my husband and I we've tried everything on the breakfast menu.  Nothing has been disappointing.    The service is meh.  The servers always seem like they have something better going on.  Once we ordered French press coffee and the server made fun of us because we didn't know what it was.  It's called "trying something new" you bounder!

lhK5I8mwGOA5jtVR_7VW4w.text: I passed this place every morning on my way to work. Finally decided to meet a friend there for dinner. Lets just say I was pleasantly surprised. Nice patio area along with great happy hour specials.  Also the Spicy Bleu Burger is a keeper. The wait staff was friendly as well...All and all a good experience, and would definitely come back.

m01GOvaWXI_8CfIcOF6qkA.text: Only been here once for lunch but very impressed.  Walking into the courtyard there is lots of comfy seating and pillows.  Inside, there are more loveseats and pillows, navy decor and dark tables, adding an instant air of intimacy, warmth, and relaxation to the place.  I was having a business lunch on a Friday afternoon.  It wasn't super-busy, and we were seated at a nice table near the street indoors.    I was impressed with the good variety in the menu, from salads to burgers, pasta, seafood and more.  I came across a different kind of listing: crepes, and decided to try their seafood one.   Two crepes came with lobster, scallops, some chopped tomatoes, white sauce, and I believe chives, along with green beans on the side.  It was very tasty, the crepes were great, and the fish tasted good.  Coming from the Northeast, I know good fish!  Service was fast, friendly, and efficient.  I definitely will go back here!

QdolE8WCyZD96AZxo526Bg.text: This is my new favorite place for sandwiches.  The menu had such a variety, I was sad I could only eat one meal when I was there.  Everyone enjoyed their food, and they made special accommodations for a birthday desert.  I want to go back soon to try more on the menu.  They were very accommodating to our large party (about 18 people), the service was pleasant and quick.  The atmosphere was trendy but comfortable.  You should go for a nice cheap dinner.

xx3TBcp0YsQmHGXgK-N-Qg.text: Possibly my FAVORITE restaurant in the world to go to for breakfast!  I have been here numerous times but the last time I went my food and my friends food (that I dragged with me because I swore by the food) was cold and bland. Maybe an off day? Idk. Regardless,  switch has been my favorite for a long time and I would give another chance.

9uvlqHIcB6XDYkUIErKuYw.text: Great service, thank you Tim!  Bruschetta was amazing as was the sangria salad.  And great happy hour specials.

C7URxGi-sii_rgM4eIMcbA.text: I'm just going to reiterate everything that all of the other yelpers have said about Switch but (hopefully) in a more cohesive manner.   I took my boyfriend to Switch to celebrate a recent work promotion, and the restaurant offered the perfect setting for a happy occasion. Everything about the decor is perfect for an early to late dinner date.   The server was awesome! I was still pretty inexperienced with drinks of the alcoholic persuasion, and our waiter really took the time to help me decide on a beverage. We both ordered the sangria (trying sangria from different restaurants has since turned into a little bit of a hobby), and it was delicious. They use plenty of different types of fruit and put a lot of it in the drink which is a rarity.   The food followed the drinks in both quality and taste. The Pesto Chicken was very flavorful, and the Caesar Salad also tasted great. I want to try the Mac and Cheese next time I eat here; I saw someone else order it, and I was very impressed.   For the service, food, and atmosphere the prices are too good to be True!

llaBJoSx8FF8civYoZe_IA.text: Good place to grab lunch on Central. I could probably live on their hummus. I have gone when it was packed and had fast, pleasant, and adequate service. The chef seems to really care about the food that is coming out of the kitchen

N2cdwOzxZ3J7xF6zkwKkfQ.text: After the long drive to Phoenix from Cerritos, the hubby and I were starving. After we got settled in our hotel room, I hopped on Yelp looking for something GOOD to eat. Switch popped up near the top and after reading all of the positive reviews, we headed out.   From the outside, the place looks really unassuming...almost DEAD even. But once inside I was pleasantly surprised. The decor is HOT! I love the section of leather couches all along one side of the partition and the sofa seating outside on the patio. Since those areas looked like they were for groups of people, we opted for a table.   We were shocked because the place wasn't DEAD inside, but it wasn't what we were expecting as far as crowds are concerned. I guess living in L.A., we've become jaded towards the Happy Hour crowds we're accustomed to. Our server was REALLY nice and offered the specials for the day (which sounded amazing). Instead I opted for the HIGHLY raved about Lobster & Crab Macaroni & Cheese and my husband got a sandwich.   I don't even know where to begin. The food was AMAZING!! It was almost a sin for anything to taste soooo good. Never mind that I'm shell fish and lactose intolerant! Sometimes you just gotta bite the bullet, yanno? It seemed the more I ate, the more there was STILL to eat! We got there with 15 minutes left for Happy Hour specials, so I ordered a $3 Hurricane and WOW...that thing was STRONG! I totally got my $3 worth! I couldn't even finish it (LAME, I know...I know...)  This is just the kind of trendy place I'd take my girlfriends to for Ladies Night!

UtNC3nGW4WLaJnvvVf4zQA.text: Brought to you by the owners of Ticoz, Switch is fantastic! I've only been there once but that one time was enough to make me want to go back. as testimonial, let me just say that I never clean my plate. There's always something left. I usually get full and have to stop eating. here, I cleaned my plate. I was practically licking the plate! I had the pork chops with cheddar cheese grits and veggies. I don't like grits... these were GONE. The veggies were asparagus and baby carrots, cooked perfectly. The chops were done to perfection, which is rare. Too often you get dry lumps of meat on your plate that taste like cardboard. Not so with these sweet chili glazed chops! Sheer perfection! My friend had the macaroni and cheese. Again, delicious!   I'm ready to go back for seconds!

HmainR8A5qYNFLhh-6z_rg.text: I've been here probably a hundred times. I love it here. With only one exception in the many times I've been here, the service has always great regardless of who our server is. The food is always consistently good, I've tried probably half the menu and have yet to experience something that wasn't enjoyable. I think what really prompted me to write this review (though it's been a long time coming) is that I was working late one night when I saw that the chef had posted a description of that night's special on Facebook. They do it all the time (I assume daily) but this dish really caught my eye. It was an Asian inspired dish which is a bit different than usual. It had chicken meatballs, noodles, veggies and a sweet and spicy broth. I called to order it for take-out and the person on the phone taking my order told me she would have to check if that dish was available for take out since it was soup. She puts me on hold and a minute or two later and Chef Jason himself gets on the phone with me to tell me how he is going to package the dish (noodles/veggies/meatballs in one container and broth in another container) and explains he's doing it that way to keep it from getting soggy and making a mess on the drive home. He even told me how to prepare it when I got home. I loved that he took that extra minute and gave me personal attention that I didn't request or even know I needed. It was that extra care and attention that really set Switch apart from it's competitors.

E3wct1znbPkzIWnbmc376g.text: Clean, nice hip atmosphere, too pricy for what you get.  Like other reviewers I most noticed the excellent service.  The food was presented very well, yet when I dug into my brie and turkey filled pastry puff, I was disappointed with the quality of the turkey.  It seemed as if they get it in bulk from Costco deli or something.  The puff pastry on the other hand was very good and what I enjoyed most about the dish.  I would have to go again and try another menu item to be a better judge of the food quality and consistency that others Yelp about.

qXYtuNpsK-c_a3iI46t3Mw.text: My husband and I stopped here for drinks and appetizers on our recent trip to Arizona.  The environment is great for drinks and socializing.  It's has a nice modern, dark feel to it.   We ordered their special Pear and Apple Bellini which was yummy.  It's not a real Bellini by any means since they don't put the real fresh fruit puree in it but it tasted great.   The calamari we ordered was fresh and delicious.   The service was great and the waiter was very nice and attentive.   We stopped here before we went to eat at Durant's next door and since Durant's was horrible, we actually would've wanted to stay and had dinner at Switch instead.  The rest of the food looked good.  I only wished we did stay versus going next door.

YyJpOTEA3jUGZQLxx_SrZA.text: This place has great food.  Went for a birthday party with a large group of friends about 10 people.  The place handled our group size with their seating fairly well.  Now to the food.    The Mac and cheese with lobster was to die for.  They do make other things very well but I only go for the Mac and cheese.  It is one of those meal where you recommend that everyone gets that as a side because you are not going to want to share it.    This is a spot you need to go to if you are in downtown located on Central and Virginia just off the light rail it should make your places to stop by, without a doubt.  Do not sleep on this one.

KozWqy79oClXmYoUyz-Hfg.text: Coming to Switch for lunch was quite a surprise as I didn't expect the trendy interior and it almost had a downtown San Diego kind of feel to it.  I can't comment on the pricey dinner entrees that I saw on the menu but their sandwiches were delicious.  I ran through the list and looked for whatever looked the most unique and I settled upon the apricot BBQ chicken sandwich.  What comes in that sandwich?  Apricot BBQ sauce, cilantro, feta cheese, aioli, spinach, red onion, and all of them on warm fresh ciabata bread.  And all that is served with some cesar salad.  You can't go wrong at all!!!!!!!  But running through their sandwich menu, it didn't seem like you could go wrong with many of the options. Switch it up and come here for a try.

HTvQpSjx_0BewidwFHRxLQ.text: LOVE this place. The service is always wonderful, drinks super tasty, and food scrumptious. This has become our "usual" stop on theater night. Will keep going back.
