c23bxjT22OPqUvMrpYq7hw.text: So I went to Switch and walked into the back door, that faces Central Street and not the cozy entrance that would have been perfect if it wasn't so cozy. I need to come back and hang out in the couch-filled lounge area up front one day. (Has very little to do with the review, except that it must be super nice to hang out and drink outside when the temperature allows for such an endeavor)  Ambiance Its dark and cozy, in a hipsteriffic way - but the clientele doesn't shout hipster at all. I really enjoyed how they had the setup of this place, and the design and the atmosphere really works. The staff was way friendlier than the ambiance suggests - which definitely helps with reasons why I will be back. Not saying anything bad about the ambiance, because the place definitely is well thought out and designed - it's just that some people can be intimidated by hipster hangouts. I'm not one of them.  Food We had sandwiches. I had the Rioja Panini to which I added Prosciutto, and it was fantastic. For a sandwich, it was all I expected and more. Well done, generous enough servings and very very tasty. The presentation didn't lack either, in short this was quite nice.  Drinks Switch have some interesting beverages suggested on the menu. I tried some and they were tasty, quite strong and for $3 before 630. The only complaint I have is that some of their drinks were too strong for my date, (when do you ever get that complaint) but this was rectified as soon as it was mentioned to our server. I would come back for the drinks alone. (Especially if I can hang out in the before mentioned outside lounge area.)  Service I must say, if any of the categories above would have been negative, it still would be lifted by the service. It was nothing short of stellar. My party had a gentleman that was knowledgeable, opinionated (in an awesome way) and attentive. Yes, he made a faux pas by forgetting our appetizer, but that just left room for the dessert (which he recommended and was awesome). Stellar service, absolutely stellar.  Switch just made my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. I can see coming here with any kind of party, it really made an impression on me, and I will bring them business. It had that kind of milieu that makes you want to revert to a more polite version of yourself.

v50ZLEAvumkEbaeooDtnsQ.text: Me and a friend went to have dinner on a Wednesday night to try this place. The server was not very attentive and did not suggest any drinks or food when we mentioned it was our first time there. My friend and I stayed at our table chatting after paying the bill, then we went to the ladies room and I completely forgot that I had left my credit card wrapped with $40 and my receipt by mistake at the table. I went Friday to see if they had my credit card, and yes one of the managers handed me my cc but no receipt nor my cash. The server was not there either so yeah there was nothing the manager could do. It is very disappointing to see how the servers could be so unhonest even after leaving them a good tip.

cNxB56unnyEzIRZcO__lyg.text: Was not sure if we'd be getting service or not.  Came in for dinner & drinks with a small group of ladies and I felt like we were bothering the host and servers for being there.   It took a long time to get menus and once we ordered, it was an hour before we got our food. (3 burgers, 1 salad and 1 mac & cheese).  After awhile the service from our server got a bit better.   Food was good.  If you're wanting to sit and wait a long for service & food and don't mind being snubbed by the staff, this is the place for you.

6ZxoNLGT-I1tpoKwXNX-tw.text: Our annual trip to this restaurant and it's a great place to be. Great food,staff,and overall awesome!!!! Can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The switch classic burger!!! Get it!!!

a80jYqQzIgla5wKyQflABA.text: My friends and I used to frequent this place every Sunday for Sunday Funday. They have drink specials that cannot be beat. Dusty is 9/10x our guy and he consistently takes great care of us. These days we don't get to make it in as often as we'd like, but when we do, it remains to be a good centralized spot for my friends and I to gather for brunch.

6HbcfgY4TOiienHjsAcK2A.text: Maybe an off night??  (our party of 6 went on a Sunday night tonight) but some of our orders were wrong or forgotten. charged extra for items we didn't order,, appetizer(tho the onion rings were good) ..the food was pretty good and our server was kind but a little..scattered. Won't be back, sorry.

udKHNRm0mHivYAJQlgxxHg.text: We overall enjoyed our visit. I came here for my birthday and my waiter was amazing. The food a delicious. My only real issue is the hostess was the rudest I have ever encountered and I had to take away a full star because of it. No paying customer should be made to feel unwelcomed. She kept glaring at us and rolling her eyes. It was ridiculous.

eou1R4yaESn6UG6U1pqBlA.text: Very trendy atmosphere, good food, reasonable prices, great bartender and drinks.  Went here with co-workers when we were on town for business.  It was recommended by our hotel... We really enjoyed it.  The sandwiches, salads, and soups were really good.  The drinks and desserts were fantastic!

AvTZd0ULdFHd1lU6AUB-hw.text: This place is wonderful. Had the crab and lobster crepes and they were delicious!! Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu!

8gY4o0X0sKu4LAWCxk_TUA.text: Met up with a friend for weekday lunch..yum!  I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was super good.  We kept it simple since it was very hot outside and we're both light eaters, by ordering a cheese board/plate and the fresh mozzarella and tomato salad.  They were both very good and satisfying.  I am looking forward to returning and sampling other menu items, as well as taking advantage of their adorable patio (when it's not quite so hot out).  I would totally give this place 5 stars if not for one thing...we needed to keep our items gluten free for my friend so we asked for the bread to be separate from the cheese plate and for the salad to come without croutons.  Our server assured us this was no problem but unfortunately both were served with the bread on them.  We didn't make a big deal of it and just took them off rather than complaining but it is still annoying to be assured of an easy request, only to not have it be met.  Still great food though.

O7SfFY3SiFM8E2cM0rbwgQ.text: I had gone to Switch a few years ago with a friend for lunch I believe and because I don't live near Central I hadn't really bothered to give it another try. However I definitely can say I'm a fan after going back a few years later.   We were heading to a concert and decided to stop by Switch to change things up a little. I was very impressed with not only the friendliness of our waiter but most importantly the quality of the food.  We tried a lot of things and all were delicious. My main dish was the Mozzarella Caprese Ciabatta sandwich and it was delicious. I'm always worried there will be too much dough in the ciabatta and usually avoid it at restaurants but this one was perfect. Just the right size, tasted fresh and one of the better sandwiches I've had in a long time. My friend had a few starters, the mac n cheese which was very good and also their hummus with pita bread which was also good.  If there is anything I might have not liked as much was the sun dried tomato and pesto risotto but that's probably because I had my eyes bigger than my stomach and ordered it with my sandwich which was already plenty enough food for me.   I don't know if I'll ever go often but I now can say with confidence that this place has great food and definitely worth a visit if you haven't been.

UfWtrJK3JyNWQlI-BZRb2w.text: Met with some friends from work that have eaten here before and decided to give it a go. Ordered the pork sandwich and was not disappointed! The flavour was great and the pretzel bun was amazing. One coworker got a sandwich and was asked if she wanted cheese, she agreed and didn't think much of it. However, when we got the bill, my friend was charged $2.00 for half a slice of cheese and almost $3.00 for her soda! My water was never refilled and the waitress did ask how our orders were, but was really contrite about it. Between the cost and service, doubt I'll be coming back again.

9HqpmJxsaqYuOaWDcaeqbg.text: Enjoy coming here the food is delicious I ordered the catfish poboy and it was to die for I had to share it with my friends and family and the wife ordered the veggie burger she said it was great we will be back again

rfTmC3GcLbyHr4ev3lRl8Q.text: Wow!! This is the 2nd time here when in Phoenix for work and has not disappointed. Tonight had the Smoked Adobo  Meatloaf and all I can say is awesome!! Came with the street corn that was great also. Will be back again!

_Orb30Ch-4nxmTZaiVhxLw.text: I have never been disappointed. Casual dining located next door to Durant's with easy parking in the rear. Nice menu with a blend of comfort foods as well as unique items and daily specials. Full bar. Owned and operated by a talented chef.  They offer brunch on the weekends with carafes of cocktails.   Small rear patio for outside dining. Service has always been excellent as well.  Pricing is reasonable; most lunch items are $15, dinner entrees $20'ish.  I have dined here 100 times.

zobrqdUEglIr395YaOSjJA.text: Service was not that great. The food was okay but you can tell that the scrambled eggs on my sandwich weren't EGGS eggs. There's a difference b/w fluffy eggs and eggs that were on this sandwich. The consistency was different than regular scrambled eggs. Anyway, I more than likely wouldn't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The eggs were a bit questionable

479kbKxp8IKTRtLqVaPz7g.text: The food here is great, the staff is excellent and the owners are amazing people. The inspiration behind every dish is amazing. The clam appetizer is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9OmlJcMDz_CkSdR8wiU6dQ.text: This place offers great food. Everything we had was very good, and the creme brulee was one of the best I have had. The menu items are also somewhat unique.

j9kabxl_DppNpiNHLQvKMw.text: Switch is a hidden treasure in Downtown Phoenix. It's located right next to Durant's, but still not super well-known.   The atmosphere is very trendy and local. They offer indoor and outdoor seating. If the weather is nice, I would recommend sitting in their patio space.   The cocktails are delicious and the Cowboy Burger was extremely juicy! Definitely order a side of the twisted fries, if your meal doesn't come with it.   I've been to Switch multiple times and I always leave happy with a full stomach. I will be taking more lunch breaks at Switch!

Cf6_h7Wjj0xikM9itRiwlg.text: Pretentious, over priced and rude staff . Not impressed

c7WD8oEgHwoW4M53gAuVYQ.text: Great service!  Four of us had Breakfast Saturday, right at opening.  Ali was our server. Fantastic!  Engaged, professional, efficient.  She carried on conversation with us, all the while providing perfect service.  The food is great and we will be back!

lb0-pVXoPGywfclyG1jWkg.text: Delicious food at great prices. We were a large group with separate checks. The waitress took great care of us. Unfortunately, happy hour doesn't start until 4 and they wouldn't budge by 10 minutes so we had to wait before ordering drinks. Otherwise, we really love this place.

eAS4WSfn9Kj11S2ImzggTg.text: Nice patio seating area. Quite, dark, cool environment. Good choice for a weekday date.

0i9J7UyN_OZrgmM4IdEbWg.text: The restaurant is very inviting and the quality of food is paramount.  The staff (ALEX) is very accommodating and very patient.  Alex knows the menu inside out and has provided options to fit everyone's palette.   I give this place five stars for the food (amount is ridiculous) and the professionalism of the staff!  Thanks Alex!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

32pby9SpNcxDw1tSmx2Z8w.text: Interesting menu, we enjoyed the food, the prices were competitive, service was good. The seating could be better for large groups but over-all, highly recommended!

8nfkh4HB1TTikTaAoB2E3g.text: If I could give 0 stars I would. And if I could post the video of Daniel ARGUING (loudly) at my sister, I would. Our waiter, Daniel, provided us with the WORST customer service I have ever had. Put aside him being a waiter and us, paying customers, the way he treated my sister and I as human beings was absolutely disrespectful. How he handled the situation- LAUGHING in our faces, YELLING, INTERRUPTING us and how he disrespected women for everyone to see is absolutely the lowest form of humanity. I hope no one has to go through what we had to go through! Absolutely TERRIBLE.

TvGQi6b4_QbvvK9GvDL9Wg.text: Had a business lunch here yesterday.  Very nice ambiance for the area. Unique variety of salads and sandwiches.  I opted for the blue poblano salad (pic) Great selection of eclectic tea varieties, many I've never heard of before. Just a touch on the pricey side even though the food was great and service was fantastic but $5 to add a couple pieces of chopped bacon to my salad was a little steep. Still will keep this place in mind when I'm in the area. Definitely try this place though.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wQF0ekyd8SIHBfb2dVJuvQ.text: For the second time the hostess is actually talking away with someone else and gave me the finger to just wait. I said I want to sit on the patio and have a drink it was 10:45 and the hostess said we just called last call. I asked if my drink with the last call and she said no  Prude again service is horrible and the food is mediocre at best

iy4MwzXOUW4COQokV846Hw.text: Was visiting from CA, and stumbled upon this place. Oh my gosh, best hot wings I've ever had. Nashville Wings , the flavor of these was so unique and delicious! I also tried the dumb truck sandwich, I highly recommend ! Loved this place!

k4NCKbF4mk1EBE3LAbwUqw.text: We had not been to Switch in a while, and, we were glad it's still very good. They offer a full bar in a casual trendy atmosphere. Our waiter, Lonnie, was very polite and friendly. We ordered two of their burgers and the Shrimp and Grits. They have a good selection of unusual beers on tap. The burgers arrived cooked to perfection. We choose the house regular fries, which were fresh and hot, nice and thick cut. The shrimp and grits also were excellent. Mildly spicy and delicious. The grits were cooked perfectly and the shrimp were not overcooked. The portions are generous.  I would definitely recommend this fun restaurant.

PffXZyY-NQnKigfAqIumLQ.text: Love the brunch menu. Good coffee. Great food. Portions are good. Staff are attentive to details. I am definitely going back.

l8PQfXgEO2AISueGnH40yQ.text: The food was perfect. I knew something good was cooking when I walked in. The smell alone makes you hungry. Great drinks, blackberry mojito was so good I had two. No complaints. I go there as soon as I'm off the plane.

_c67AgxEsI4fRt7F6oLSSg.text: This was our first time visiting Switch. What a wonderful experience! The service was great, the drinks were good and strong, and the food....oh my goodness! DELICIOUS! The onion rings with Dragon sauce...yummy. The entrees were generous and just REALLY good. The hot cookie dessert was a great ending to our meal. We will definitely come again! Thanks for a great birthday experience.

yi3i199-Ogu7s4IOvQDb7w.text: I lived near this restaurant and went there many many times.  I moved away, but went to lunch with friends.  We choose Switch.  Mistake.  On July 16 we entered restaurant and saw it was not busy at all. Maybe 5-6 tables.  A man informed us they were short of help.  I was seated and sat for about 15 minutes, while this man ran from spot to spot pretty much ignoring me.  My friends arrived and one ordered a drink.  We noted her drink was sitting a the bar.  Another order was placed by it and the waited picked up that order first and took to table.  Our drink sat for abut 10 minute on the bar and was given to us when we asked,.  He got another drink order wrong.  Food came quickly.  This waiter needs some training.  The service use to be great, it has really gone down hill.

Oy4BJvzBKpTv4rb5otim0Q.text: If you're going to make reservations, apparently don't use Open Table. Reservation for four on the patio out the window because only two tables available are high tops, which doesn't work when dining with a 77-year-old. "Sorry, those tables are reserved" is a weak answer to someone who also made a reservation. Apparently if you call in, you can specify a low-top. Use Open Table and you are left to the high top tables that you didn't know existed. Between this and the removal of the fish and chips from the menu, I'm done. Food is excellent but seems like there's been a hassle my last couple times here and don't need the aggravation  Added: the staff did find a way to get us to be patio table, which I appreciated a great deal. I do like this place but it wasn't a good night.

h4qrfkD25dWpUH6SdYwV7Q.text: The above note really just scratches the surface. SWITCH, that fabulous. Patrick Cunningham, ps do not miss cast iron clams.

dWQAsyWFRJgqo0TrJ8pykw.text: Me and my 10 companions walked in on a busy Friday at noon, and we treated so graciously, given a table immediately and server with a kindness rarely seen in fine dining.  The food was wonderful, perfectly cooked, generously sized and extremely tasty.  I just cannot say enough good things about Switch, only that we will definitely be back!!

Z4-o6yHSE7moGE7QLbBUTg.text: Such a quaint, hip venue! Our server last evening, Tom, was attentive and informative! Two older diners split the classic burger with French fries and were delighted along with their choice of adult beverages! Another guest devoured her salad topped with grilled shrimp. I enjoyed every delicious bite of the Cobb salad topped with grilled salmon! Every bite was an explosion of delight! I went along with Tom's suggestion of the full salad and did not rue my decision at all! Regrettably none of us had room to try any of the dessert offerings..a good reason to return SOON!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cobb salad topped with grilled salmon was ever sooo tasty!  (Full size portion)

fY4imXlVjPc4TIOI2OWYnA.text: Stayed at the hotel in front of this restaurant and decided to eat here based on the good Yelp reviews.  It did not disappoint!  My wife ordered the Jalisco Panini and I had the Roasted Sweet Tea chicken.  Both were delicious!  The service was also outstanding and the restaurant has a good ambiance.  I highly recommend it.

2qceUUgHtei6XmanW-WA1g.text: Ordered lobster crepes and sweet potatoe fries on my way to Avondale from the airport, def a good spot to stop and have some drinks to wait out rush hour! had a few drinks they were good and strong!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rb0Wqqq3fBlbGLAZQ_QmHQ.text: Came in because of a review on Huffington Post. Did not get what they reviewed but everything we had was superb. Sweet potato gnocchi special was delightful. My burger was perfectly prepared sans bun. Caesar side was only marginal dish. Mussels were excellent. Drank all the broth like it was soup. Bartender that served us was very friendly...really enjoyed our conversation with him. There were so many wonderful sounding things on the menu we are certain to return.

Ba8VqLcOeT1EpOa4saJ61Q.text: Came here for a fabulous lunch with ten other people.  Understandably, the wait time was a little long since they wanted to bring out all eleven dishes at once but it was worth it!  I got the Chicken Pot Pie Gallette, Creme brulee for dessert, and a Caipirinha to wash it all down.  That chicken pot pie was flaky buttery goodness!  The non-tradition pie and crust with a delicious savory cream gravy was some good old comfort food eating.  Even after offering bites to some of my lunch patrons, I still ate it all up with a happy smile.  The green beans were also really fresh and crisp.  Although I was content with my dish, I gotta say I loved my friend's Mac N' Cheese Plate even more.  Oh man, how I wish I got the same.  Yum!  Their fish and chips were also pretty tasty.  I especially like the dill tartar sauce accompaniment.   Although I was full, I couldn't pass up on getting a creme brulee.  Let me indulge a little!  It was a decent brulee with the perfect caramelized crust and creamy custard goodness.  I ate it all, my dress was feeling a little tight, but I have no regrets.  The Caipirinha cocktail is a delicious mojito drink so no complaints there.  It was a bit light on the booze though but at 11:30AM in the morning, I shouldn't be out getting wasted anyways!  Switch is a swanky place with a cozy simplistic atmosphere.  I like it!  I would love to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken pot pie gallette.
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crème brûlée!

QQrh61vbKjI0bokVqgeiBg.text: I have frequently visited Switch because it seems that the food is always consistent. Lunch time, it is always packed and the service lacks. However, the food makes up for it.   Recently, I came to visit for lunch and they changed their menu a little. I tried something new this time other than their Switch House burger and the thai braised tacos which are usually fantastic, which by the way are still on the menu. I ordered the dragon pita. I did not like it all that much. The sauce was all the way on the bottom so I didn't even taste it for the first five bites. Without it, it was dry and bland. I probably wouldn't order it again. My fiance ordered the cowboy burger and I asked him if we can switch. Being the great man he is, he said "yes".   The bill came close to $30 for two entrees. Parking is in the back off of Virginia and you go through the patio to get to the host. Try to get there early to avoid a wait.

nnZDBMzosfyUO6Eln3CPGg.text: Very good comfort food. Generous portions. A sleek modern diner feel inside. Our server Cherie was excellent. Great cocktail menu. We recommend pot pie, burgers, spicy shrimp and grits. Will return. Place is hidden even though on a corner...parking is in back. It's next to Durants

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pot pie
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger with seasoned fries
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PXBOOTnJS00idG8uqjF5OA.text: Me and my date, also my new boyfriend, went here for dinner last night as a belated valentines day date. I've been wanting to try this place since my mom and stepdad love this place. We tried the fried chicken bites appetizer and loved it. The habanero honey sauce wasnt too spicy and provided a nice zesty kick to get our moods going. The service was great as our waitress was timely in getting drinks and our food before the big party there had their food orders in which would take a while. I also had a glass of tasty rose, but boyfriend decided to not drink as the night before was his alcohol cheat night (hes on an intermittent fasting diet, and we decided that our next date nights are cheat days for him) He got a catfish poboy sandwich and I had the mac n cheese with bacon (always need that protein in!) He claimed that the catfish was the best hes ever had and he personally thanked the head chef/owner for the food. Also got a gooey cookie but was really rich and we were pretty much too full to eat it all. I'd totally go here again.

d6QNSPHiVjA7xxkgxiG7Qg.text: I liked the mac and cheese that I ordered.  I got it with chicken added.  It's a huge bowl and I could only eat a portion and took the rest home.   They left a water pitcher on the table to refill water, as needed which was soooo nice.  :D  The area is good for groups and there is a bar and outdoor patio area.  Nice for a variety of moods.  The prices are reasonable.  The wait staff is excellent and very thorough.    The menu is varied so there are things for every mood.  Overall, this was a very nice place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and Cheese w/Chicken

FPb9gFXVcoJPRsunlieyrg.text: Went for brunch at 1 p.m. & it was slammed inside & out on the patio. So this review may be askew due to that fact but honestly it's brunch ya'll staff it up. It happens every Sunday. But the food was delish once it was received & the carafes of Bloody Mary & Mimosa were a super deal but had problems keeping them coming & the food took FOREVER. I asked for water & never received it. When I gently asked again the server said she'd be right back with it & never did. Instead the table next to us got it. Super bummer on the service. Can't say I'll be back for brunch unfortunately. Maybe lunch sometime to give it a 2nd chance since it was my first try.

FcIakxy7ysDVDkYYF7lbsA.text: Tried this place again for Mother's day brunch. Sadly had the same experience in ordering our eggs. Ordered 2 over medium eggs, received over hard.  Our server offered to replaced them.  Received only 1 egg and over easy. I guess lesson learned... should we come back we'll just have drinks. However the service was much better.

xCzRBFFCwfIvk0Jh11J00g.text: This was my first time visiting Switch. I must say the atmosphere was great! The host Jack and our server Dan were amazing!! They made us feel very welcomed and were always checking on us. The food was absolutely delicious!! I will be definitely visiting the restaurant again!!

hxnXhtdKX3NnM-h-XKhhHA.text: I went to Switch with several co-workers today, and I believe our server's name was Dan.  He was very attentive and friendly...great service.  And since a new owner took over Switch several months back, the food is TO DIE FOR.  I call it Soul Food Fusion, but that term doesn't really do it justice.  The "Dumptruck" sandwich is scrumptious as are the warm pretzel sticks.  Portions are very large, so share or plan to bring home leftovers.  Everyone in my party loved the food!  Thanks!

9t47eJWqs1wdWAqneQyhiA.text: Oh Switch, how I used to love thee...What have you done with the menu?  And why?!  So many of the old favorites are gone, you are a skeleton of what you used to be.  Time was, I invited all my friends & out of town colleagues to join me because you had a menu option for every taste & appetite, but no more.  Even my favorite drink is gone.  So sad because it, alone, was worth the drive.  I ordered my last meal today.  It was the braised pork sandwich.  I think the pretzel bun was probably delicious before it was soaked in grease.  Whilst it wasn't too crowded in there today, I had to shout to be heard.   I will miss you, goodbye :(

CIdfreEe1enBeXcOpf30Hw.text: Found this place on Yelp and also from a recommendation of a friend.  Great food, amazing cheese grits, friendly staff.  Recommend!

sR-Su2FwA8948LRw-R2CYg.text: We were running downtown to the theatre and decided to stop in for a bite.   Place was hoping on a Saturday night and thanks to the rain there was no wait.  Good vibe- odd arrangement where they sat us for dinner next to lunge chairs but ok.    Ended up waiting for 15+ minutes before I asked who was serving us. Didn't seem real organized.     Ordered the croquette special- tasty- dipping sauce was very good.  Two orders- Beef Rib Hash which was more a stew with big chunks was excellent...deep flavor with the dish.  My order was the pork rib special.  just ok- meat dry not moist and lots of fat.  Veggie was interesting but just bland.    Very little heads up from the staff of whats going on in their tables.  At the end it took another 15m for them to get the check to us after repeated requests and then I had to give the payment to the host due to time.  Go in prepared...

Bxujm2zfXJX9Smd9ybG5eA.text: We were the last people in the restaurant and they never made us feel unwelcome or rushed. The food was amazing and the drinks were great too. I highly recommend this place.

5Us3v6LmumKMyu7My1JHOQ.text: It usually lands somewhere between decent and pretty good. The service makes me feel uncomfortable sometimes. Recently, they stood and talked about how much they didn't want to be there. I've done the same at a job before. Service people are often temporary, so this may not be an ongoing issue but it was off putting at the time. I always seem to rack up a fat bill way quicker than I expect to. I bet some of their dishes are awesome but I struggle with justifying the expenditure.

rSK-xZ29-tocaU6xNiNMcg.text: It's not easy whenever I have to venture into a trendy restaurant with young kids.  We were greeted by a snobby hostess who tried to give us a small table.  I politely reminded her we have party of 5 and she gave me another table.  I understand if she want to sit kids away from other patrons but that was not the case.   Our waitress on the other hand was awesome.  She brought out water (with lids) for the kids & was very accommodating as I try to figure which adult meal I can split btw the 2 of them.  I ordered the Country Club Panini for the kids which I didn't try.  But the Cesar salad that came with it  was pretty good.  My order was the open faced Focaccia Ck Salad Melt (Switch Special) 3* - bread was too hard but the side salad was not bad.   What I really enjoyed was my sister's Egg Benedict which was much better than the ones I had at FEZ.  I'm still kicking myself for not ordering  from the weekend breakfast menu. I hope to be back soon to try out some of that $3 breakfast cocktail carafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2011 - view from hostess station

JXt10T7Fj1HW0Sl55Q33xQ.text: I've been in many times over the years. Brunch, lunch, happy hour, dinner. And it's consistently good. Quite good. Not amazing, not life changing, but solid good quality, good service and a very comfortable dining room.  Most recently was brunch with a friend. I am a huge fan of the $4 carafe of Bloody Mary. My heartburn isn't as big a fan, but that's what Tums are for!  We shared the cheese and fruit plate appetizer with the added meat option. The cheese of the day was a sage cheddar. Okay - it wasn't really cheddar. I don't remember the name, but it was similar to a cheddar and quite tasty. Add some salami, prosciutto, strawberries, grapes, jam, almonds, water crackers and baguette and it was a lovely way to start brunch!  I had the chilaquilles - not the best I've ever had - but quite tasty. Just think I'll explore other options next time. Nothing wrong with them - just not to my taste.  My companion had the special - poached eggs, asparagus and prosciutto. He was the clear winner in the ordering department - the presentation was photo worthy and while I neglected to ask how it was, he finished it all without hesitation - so I am thinking it must have been good.  Will definitely be back!

2G5AA6mxVFJPOwYnOKb-Ug.text: I hadn't been back to Phoenix in 22 year. Yes, 22 years, and oh my how it's changed! So many new freeways and high rise buildings! But more importantly, new restaurants!!! Not knowing the area well, my friend's daughter suggested this place for dinner. It was Saturday night around 8:00pm and I was really happy we didn't have to wait at all. Parking is at the back of the restaurant parking lot. We entered the restaurant back entrance via an outdoor patio where people were enjoying a AZ summer night. I loved the restaurant as soon as I stepped in. It's very modern and open. In front of me was a nice bar. Our table was reserved for us and we were seated right away. Once we ordered, the food came out fairly quickly. I had the Spinach Feta Salad with Chicken (add on) with balsamic vinaigrette. yelp.com/biz_photos/-Ht7... It was delicious! They weren't stingy with the meat and I was only able to eat about 1/3 of chicken but I finished all of my salad! My fiance had the T ruffled Hanger Stead (medium). He said it was very tender with good flavor. yelp.com/biz_photos/-Ht7... Others ordered Spicy Burger yelp.com/biz_photos/-Ht7..., Wedge Fries yelp.com/biz_photos/-Ht7..., Le Mans French Dip yelp.com/biz_photos/-Ht7..., Chicken Sandwich yelp.com/biz_photos/-Ht7..., and Salmon Western yelp.com/biz_photos/-Ht7..., which looked sooooo good. If I ever return, I'm going to try this! Our server was super nice and attentive. The sandwiches are pretty big, so if you're a small eater, you might be packing 1/2 of to go. They also have Happy Hour everyday. If you're in this part of the town, give it a try. You might like it as much as I did!

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wedge Fries
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon Western
Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sorry, don&#39;t remember what this is.

GzFLp57HfDUEaq0F0VXZ3w.text: The food is excellent, the wines are phenomenal and the staff is amazing. Try the Mac and cheese for sure it's out of this world and pairs nicely with the Chardonnay. Just wish it was a tad bit brighter in there it was a bit hard to read the menu.

6CWc0h0fkF-tnMo-7Vpu7g.text: Ugly outside building, beautiful on the inside. As I was walking in... one of the waitstaff coughed on the glassware she was filling without covering their mouth and looked relatively unconcerned about it. As I read through the menu, I was asked for a drink order. The waitress seemed annoyed that I had a special request from the bar. As she came to get my food order, I ordered an appetizer to which she replied, "sorry, we're out of that." Mind you, the place opens at 10am and its 10:30am. Wtf!? Secondly, I read over the menu again to re-choose my appetizer and when I ordered it, she replyed "we're out of that too." Excuse me?! What do you have?! I left...

YsOqp5uz9g8H9Rj6ERsrIA.text: ORIGINAL REVIEW August 2012  Very nice ! We came for HH to try some apps and have a look-see .  Great vibe and atmosphere ..tonight was free wine tasting from (Southern wine ?) with donations to help Arizona animal league. we decided to stay a while longer for the tasting  .(Eh ,the wine was ok) ,glad we could help some animals, hopefully.  Switch itself was awesome ! We had a great time. The hummus was tasty,  really loved the lamb lettuce wraps these were super yummy and really flavorful . We also tried  a new drink to us called pom-pom passion ( light and refreshing )  friendly and fun service ( thank you)  we look forward to having dinner here .  Update;  Decided to have dinner here last night.  We started our night with the lettuce wrap app (chicken,feta and fig) loved it ! We both had the seared scallops with leeks and tomato jam ,it was a pretty plate and it was a delicious light meal .Blond sangria hit the spot .  This was our 2nd time,(HH was enjoyable) Dinner confirmed the following facts  -cool place, cool people,  a great place to relax and eat a decent meal at a reasonable price ( really inexpensive)   we will be back !

tKaxXp9eB1IX2u5l5mINNw.text: Had a great dinner last night with friends!  The Napa Valley Pita was outstanding and the $3 drink of the day (Cosmos) hit the spot!!  This was a review from 2 years that I found never posted....been here since then...sadly they took the Napa valley pita off the menu :(

9mAgSNJvtak1E6rT4iYlHA.text: Really great place, mostly just tried the burgers off their menu. They used to have a Monday special on their burgers, but they discontinued it. Actually haven't been there since, but willing to eat there again. Sad to see the burger special go, their burgers are really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Switch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cowboy Burger

In8UJwZj70_jlIg7hQfAkw.text: Well another AMAZING time at Switch...Thank You for the perfect service from Tim Lott....he is the BEST in the business! We took a new friend there last Saturday, and she had a blast...!  Relatively new to Arizona from LA, she was impressed with the urban vibe, eclectic menu and great service from Tim.  2 for 1 happy hour, great apps, non stop attention who would not be happy?   Well I could not say anything that has not been already said....just GO Ask for TIM and enjoy....!

qY9taNiPi8cTxzXMgiO8sw.text: Love this place, service is always good and the food is great...but really took me back to see they were storing table tops next to the toilet
